fCfRwzUMb_iZKdX0ZtqATg.text: First, Our server's name is Sunshine. That is actually her legal name!.  She was simply amazing, from making great recommendations and accommodating a few special requests, and just being present, she was awesome.  I know this place has a reputation for being crazy expensive, but I had a $22 lunch that included an authentic Caesar salad and a 10 ounce New York strip.  I think that's very good value! Portion sizes were good, unfortunately because I feel really full.  We sat on the patio and had great people watching as well.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

paMJivl_fZQmgRxd4ARw4Q.text: I was sooo excited to dine here! It all started out so well! Drinks perfect, server attentive and fun, appetizer delish! Then the steak came and after a few bites my evening was deflated. The bone in rib eye was undercooked, and way under seasoned, if at all. The rosemary and duck fat fried fingerlings were equally tasteless. Mushrooms same. I was shocked. I'm not used to having to salt and pepper my steak, especially at these prices. Maybe it was just an off night, as they have many great reviews, but I was sadly disappointed.

4a4-SkCiXXxWUxjEz6y9Rw.text: We came in this past Saturday and were treated to a truly excellent experience. We were a bit early for our 8pm reservation and while they were very busy, we were promptly seated in the most comfortable booth. We had an entire team of servers who were well above expectations!! They were all very kind, knowledgeable about the menu, efficient, provided great suggestions, but never intrusive. The cocktails were delicious, but the food, oh man, the food was unbelievable!! We started with a colossal lump crabmeat cocktail and bacon-wrapped sea scallops. The fresh horseradish and cocktail sauce on the crab and the perfectly crisped bacon, so good!! We then split an 18oz NY strip and their 3lb lobster special of the evening. I love lobster and that was the best one I've ever eaten! One of the servers even cracks the claw for you!! The steak couldn't have been cooked any more perfectly and was seasoned just right. Paired with the wild mushrooms and Brussels sprouts, it was incredible!! We probably would've spent a third hour here to settle in for dessert had we not had a show to go to. This is a definite must go if you love a classic experience that never fails, a foodie's dream!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime New York Strip and lobster

qHK9cA0Xhdr-DO1BW_J7kg.text: This place was a very pleasant surprise---their lunch special was a steal...their basket of bread had a delicious variety & the service--Sunshine indeed! That was the name of our server--sunny of disposition & very helpful. Another server--Ricky--was great. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Swordfish --catch of the day...delicious!
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice sized Caesar&#39;s Salad
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch Special is a steal!

8ng0ALF0pO8-iW2Ih_7LYQ.text: Very disappointing.....had a reservation for 8 people at 8pm... waiter not very friendly, got our food at 9:15.... cold and congealed.   However, the manager took care of us, but still a disappointing experience.

_WkQMTP961dRO5UorbOu0Q.text: I have come here every time I've been in Vegas and been so impressed .. prices for lunch are great and service good.. food really good.. highly recommend it here!

wUgIdUjfdXPvysfKOZ6DRw.text: Service! Service! Service! This place has exceptional customer service and every single one of their staff went above and beyond leaving our table impressed!  We were in Vegas for a trifecta of birthdays, my husbands, A girlfriends and a guy friends all within the same week! Our friend Laurie wanted to go to The Palms because she was dying to have the 3 lb lobster and so we're we after she mentioned it!  The restaurant is really nice and has a great atmosphere to it! The murals on the walls of celebrities made for great conversation pieces all evening.   The 3 lb lobster was huge and delicious! And their mushrooms, mashed potatoes and asparagus sides were sensational!  Their drinks were strong and they had a great selection!  My favorite part of the experience was the lemon squeezed into my hands followed by a warm wet napkin after dinner! Another part of our experience that I appreciated was when our waiter brought out a whole 3 lb lobster for the birthday girl to take a picture with it!   Such a great night and dinner! Well be back on our next Vegas getaway!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YVzrnLVjs_vewpKRlMR08w.text: Great service,wonderful food, super atmosphere, What's more could you ask for. Always a treat while in Las Vegas.

y0N3VN2FLakE2HSJdWM9eg.text: I ordered a bison burger and side salad for lunch, my friends both ordered chicken Parmesan, and all of the food was pretty good - nothing to be excited about. I am giving this place 3 stars because we sat down at 1:03 PM and it took 57 minutes for us to finally get our food, including bread. We had to flag down our server to finally get a food order in and ask multiple times to ask for bread for the table.

1hDW6RvQxEbt2wP8zAZeeg.text: Best service, food, and atmosphere! I've been here several times and the best thing on the menu is the lobster BLT sandwich with sweet potato fries. I will definitely be back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster BLT

7GYendD7-QnTNBvHxXyl8w.text: I loved this place! The waiter we had was super friendly! The food was great! I liked the ambiance and you can either dress casual or dress up, regardless it is a super classy place. I wanted to drink something like a strawberry ish alcoholic drink and I didn't know how to explain it. The waiter knew took what I said and came back with a mule and he had muddled strawberries in it. It was perfect! The attention to customer service here is impeccable! Price range here is more on the higher end side so expect to pay more. I ordered fish here and it was totally worth it!

EShGWpCeWl_kEHTdrKNqBw.text: The food was delicious, I been going to Palm for years. I only gave them 3 because when I made reservation in person the manager ask was this a special occasion and I told him yes my son engagement. He say they would do something special which reason I choose Palm. At the end just the check and thank you . Something nice was expected at the end turned out to nothing!!! Yes it was a disappointment celebrating a engagement celebration when it was planned. So won't pick there no more for a special occasion!!!

XVvV3JU0P9wxncjsIjq8zQ.text: The service was great, all of the workers were so nice! The food was pretty good, especially the house bread. Must try the mashed potatoes!!

HjVrlISB0Z0v3AX2ss1png.text: This is my new favorite restaurant in Vegas! I ordered a steak and my husband ordered salmon. We also order Soup of the day and wine. The steak was cooked perfectly medium rare and the salmon was well-seasoned. Soup of the day was British clam chowder - very unique and delicious! Love it

z7NlDWUkdpdyUYjHUkse0w.text: 6 pound lobster $100. Need I say more?  Most friendly way staff ever, great food, and I cannot believe the price of the amazing lobster deal here-not to mention you are in Vegas and Caesar's Palace, where you expect to pay an arm and a leg and here you are with the best deal ever!  Did I mention how ridiculously tasty the lobster is grilled, cracked in half, succulent and fresh?  And did I mention it's claw is bigger than my hands?  And the claw meat is oh so amazingly tasty?  Look forward to coming back and having lobster again, I think I'm I have to make this a regular stop from now on.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 6 lb lobster&#39;s claw
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flourless chocolate cake

hnLjxq4hbXVgVPDCALtDjA.text: The food is great. The service is most wonderful. The price point is a bit high, but I'm assuming they are Vegas tourist prices. I had a side salad, their famous chicken parm (absolutely delicious) that doesn't come with pasta, cheesy potatoes, green beans, cheese cake, and lemon aid and my total was around 115 bucks. Gratuity included. So you can see what I'm saying about the prices. But I'm glad I went. If you have money to blow, stop in. Maybe get a steak though to make it worth wild. A great touch was the manager stopping by to great us and say hello!

qaW5txiupurIMnn2fvRErA.text: I decided I wanted to do a small group of friends and family for my 40th birthday and I came here for it. The communication that I had with the sales staff was amazing. Adriana was my contact person. Anytime I had a question, a comment, or a concern all I had to do was email her and she would get back to me ASAP. There was never a moment when I was stressed or unsure about the process of doing a dinner party at this location. The day of my birthday was amazing! Everything came out and orders were taken as they should be. The wait staff introduce themselves and worked well together to get my party of 14 people in and out in two hours. It was a wonderful experience and I will definitely come back for a solo dinner or for another celebration. I highly recommend this venue for a date night, a meeting, a family event, a wedding reception, or even a 40th birthday party. In addition to that the manager came in and introduced himself to me and he also gave me a business card so that I could contact him if I had any issues. This was the best service I could have imagined and a stress free situation.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They make a personalized menu for your event. Amazing!
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mr25asuExlHtzFqLEmCwCw.text: This place was the worst experience at not only any of The Palm Restaurants I have visited but by far the worst service I've EVER had at any restaurant. Such a disappointment. For a place that says they treat their guest like family, my fiance and I had the worst server. He had no respect for us and engaged in conversations with every other table but ours. Very disappointed.

yYE5o63pz1QRjKI272RAyw.text: I want to really like this spot I do but it was just ok. Sat at the bar with my bf, the bartender was super nice,engaging and knowledgeable. We both ordered the lunch specials for $24. Starter salads and soups were fresh but nothing crazy. I got the salmon, it was good but not much taste to it. He got the steak, which presentation wise didn't look too appealing. It was just tousled with crunchy onion toppings, no sauces on the side or on it.  It was really sad and dry looking. Ordered medium, came out medium well for sure, was tough and not a good piece of steak. I even had a bite just to make sure :/ I know The Palm has a good reputation, and have even been to other locations, however this one was not one I will rush back to even as locals.

_uBEoXBKjM5QfbtYPv3E1w.text: My first time here. Amazing steaks and delicious Lobster Mac n Cheese. Porterhouse and Surf and Turf special.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JqMDnIytArbH0bi1vZXJkA.text: Sooooooooo good! This is one of the best steakhouses in town, excellent and friendly staff, the food is superb!!! We ordered lobster and filet, Caesar salad and garlic mash potatoes. It was an experience, presentation was beautiful. Drinks were great! Everything was great, definitely gonna go back, we even joined the club!

A6nLLnkLRaTJLW2C5GepeA.text: Visited The Palm for special occasion while visiting LV! Service was terrible. No bread or special pre-dinner nosh was provided. Ordered salad for appetizer and steak came out during salad. Felt very rushed. Beverage glass was cracked, hence that beverage was free. Desserts were on the house. But overall experience was terribly disappointing for the price...

bySVnsqFon-ELASfB9OsGQ.text: Great spot to share a salad or burger. Comfortable atmosphere great service impeccable food. White chocolate bread- amazing! White sangria is a must!

BtFtHy-M_0auLU2wfULoZg.text: Palm in Caesar's Palace is just one of many and I mean many steakhouses in Las Vegas. Came here specifically for the $25.95 Business Lunch Special. No you don't have to be a businessman or woman to enjoy it! :) Here's a Snap shot of the "Business Lunch" offering: yelp.com/biz_photos/w12x... FOOD: 3.5/5 stars +Assortment of Bread: yelp.com/biz_photos/w12x... +Caesar Salad: yelp.com/biz_photos/w12x... +1/2 and 1/2 (shoe string potatoes and potato chips: yelp.com/biz_photos/w12x... +10 oz angus aged steak with mashed potatoes and brandy peppercorn sauce: yelp.com/biz_photos/w12x... +Key Lime Pie: yelp.com/biz_photos/w12x... Overall, the food was pretty good. The highlight definitely was the steak with the peppercorn brandy sauce. It was not the best steak I've ever had but it definitely had a nice age and flavor to it. Definitely lots of value for your $25.95 lunch price tag. Everything else was pretty standard, nothing that really blew my mind. PRICE: 4/5 stars For $25.95, you will get full. Sure this is vegas and you could get much more out of a $5.99 steak and eggs but we're talking about a nice steak at a steakhouse. Compared to other steakhouse prices, there is definitely value to be had here. VARIETY: 3/5 stars It's a steakhouse! Palm has meat for days. There are seafood choices if someone in your party feels like indulging in something other than steak. SERVICE: 3/5 stars Waiters were dressed formally and the service was good.. When the waiters congregated and chatted (quite loudly) in the dining room, it took away from the ambiance of the restaurant. INTANGIBLES: 3/5 stars I've never seen so many cartooned framed pictures of celebrities. It's kind of cool to look around the restaurant at the pictures. Besides that, it seems like quite your typical dark wood furniture steak house. Good lunch at a nice price and we left happy. :) I definitely think the Business Lunch has great value if you were in the area and wanting steak for a reasonable price.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Key lime pie dessert!
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak with peppercorn sauce and mashed potatoes
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 and 1/2

6XceececmAC-OBRLPY6YVg.text: If your taste for great food can be influenced by one particular restaurant then the Palm is it for me. I have been eating at this gastronomic icon before I was even an adult. I've eaten at the Palm in most major cities and had the most magical dinner at the original in NYC. What a great place to start to form a love for incredible food.   Unfortunately, like the mall it's in, it's a glitzy place with no substance (sorry, Caesers).   A friend and I walked in right on time for our reservation and were made to wait after we declined to sit at the bar (the hostess tried to convince us that eating in the bar was an option for reservations even though there were many empty tables - rude). Finally we got a table and from then on the experience got a bit better.   Service here is impeccable. Our water glasses stayed filled, plates were taken away, everyone was very polite and efficient. That is the best part of this restaurant.  The bread basket was delicious, it has several different kinds served with butter. We each ordered steak, that is why we came. I ordered the bone-in ribeye and my friend ordered the filet mignon. We also ordered three sides: mushrooms, mashed potatoes and creamed spinach.  I usually love sides, I think they can be an incredible accompaniment, but these were so bad we didn't even touch them.   The mushrooms were clearly soaked in vinegar. The sharp acrid taste was so overwhelming that the taste of mushrooms was clearly lost. The mashed potatoes had goat cheese mixed in, which I'm not a fan of, but the potatoes were fluffy. I just can't eat goat cheese. Blech. The creamed spinach was overwhelmingly creamy, almost too thin to eat with a fork. The taste was bland as though they had added too much tasteless cream. The spinach taste was also lost.  I ordered my ribeye medium rare and it came out so rare that if it had been cooked any less it would have been raw. The meat was stringy and so fatty that I almost gagged. I ate a few bites and then asked for it to go. What? My dogs love undercooked, overfatty meat!  My friends filet was good, but I refused to taste it. After all this bad food my stomach was starting to hurt. Ugh.   I'm extremely disappointed in the food at this restaurant. It was my first bad experience with the Palm, EVER (in 28 years). I would never go back here. Not for free, not for pay, never.

jgxmA4u0ZTUD7IJz1f4PEQ.text: I was here last week for my boyfriend's birthday. We all got the Lobster Special. If I remembered correctly, it was $99 for 2 and included some sides. I'm not big on seafood, but I enjoyed it. I LOVE their wild mushroom side.   This was my 2nd time here and the customer service is excellent. Everyone greets you with a smile. The servers and their assistants are kind and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Napoleon cake we brought to the restaurant was delicious too! Happy birthday babe!
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorite here, wild mushrooms!
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Special for 2. ($99 with sides).

hgeMUnmvHXtjng1VOjf8qw.text: I would describe this place as very average, and I have to admit, I'm a bit confused by all of the hype. Our waiter talked to us through clenched teeth the entire time. He dropped a steak knife on my foot and did not bother to apologize, even though the knife clearly hit me. The hearts of palm salad (which, for some reason, is not listed on the menu) is really delicious. The wedge salad is a clusterf*ck that somehow includes walnuts and a ton of fried onions.  My friend and I each ordered a filet. His came out perfect, while mine came out covered in a layer of grease that I was actually able to pour off the top onto my plate. We ordered the brussel sprouts and the half fries, half onion strings as sides and both were mediocre. My friend likes this place, so it's possible I'll be back, but rest assured, there will be some kicking and screaming along the way from my end to get there.

aCtkdk-pddZWMUSvDFExUg.text: Sept 22, 2017 Overpriced!!! Two of us without alcohol was over $225 Crab cakes had great taste but $31? The "special"...Dry Aged 160z Bone in NewYork $75...nothing special and I doubt it was 16oz The plate presentations were blah. Never again.

RLu0yqLXE5V80qxHjlTGBw.text: Definitely not the same palm I remember.   Steak quality has drastically dropped.  Ordered the bone in rib eye.  It was dry and mostly fat.   At the price they charge you'd expect better.  Won't be coming back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb chop
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in rib eye

nwQPVw89rwTJCqTCIygnGw.text: If you like Maine lobster, this is your restaurant.  Fresh and very delicious.   The staff are very efficient and friendly.  We live in Seattle and go to Las Vegas quarterly.   We always come to this restaurant.  In fact during our last trip we went twice.  Don't miss this one.

4YLRr0wYQ17ugfdxWG37bg.text: My boyfriend and I went here for an anniversary lunch. When we sat down, there was congratulations card on our table, which we both thought was very sweet.  My favorite thing we had was the baked clams casino! We sat on the "patio" and people watched as everyone went about their shopping. Our meal was delicious, and the service was excellent!

zuADWjQzIQMp3FgBwObpvA.text: The services was very slow. The waiters took forever to bring the food. Some came in on time the other entree came in 20mins. Worst part the steak no matter what you order they taste the same. Very disappointing and would not recommend this to anyone who are planning to go to a steak place.

KY087iV6TYdWEJzSNxrdlg.text: The "surf and turf" is the dish to order here. You can have one order for two so my coworker and I ordered a 6-lb lobster and we each had an 8-oz filet mignon. Their lobsters were from Nova Scotia and tasted great without needing any seasoning or butter. The half lobster on my plate also came with some browned lobster "liver" and that was the first for me and I ate it all. My filet was cooked perfectly to my preference: medium rare and it was tender and juicy inside and seared brown outside.  For desserts we had New York cheesecake (rich creamy and slightly tangy), flourless chocolate cake (dark chocolate & creamy) and creme brulee; everything was fantastic. The restaurant is located in the Ceaser's Palace Hotel right at the entrance of the "Forums" so you can do some window shopping afterwards at some of those expensive designer brands clothing shops.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. flourless chocolate cake
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York cheesecake
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. cream brulee

uOzAvpcvWw0boKqpTotnHA.text: Chose to make a surf and turn out of the special bone-in filet mignon and a half of a 3 lb lobster. The steak was great but I'm not sure what the advantage of the "bone-in" feature was. The lobster was good and the attendant who took it apart for me did a great job. I'd never been to a place that provides that service. Made the bib kinda pointless. My wife had the tuna which was good but the layer of peppercorns over the top was a little overwhelming. We also had the calamari appetizer, which was big enough for 4 people.  I tried a signature drink called the "Seasonal Mule" (Grey Goose Vodka, ginger beer, hand-squeezed lemon and lime juice, Angostura Bitters, served on the rocks.) DO NOT get this drink, it tastes like how a urinal cake in a public bathroom smells. Luckily the waitress took it off the bill and gave me a vodka/tonic instead.  Our waitress was overbearing. Friendly, but barely gave us a chance to breathe with renovation stories and opportunities to join the rewards club and blah blah blah with too many visits to the table. I could've used a bit more space to enjoy the date with my wife.  Other than that, it was great.

uUGZuzzvwc2LuNfKhdeWxA.text: Had a very disappointing dinner at the Palm last night. Our party of four stopped in early, around 5:30 PM , and got seated right away.  After browsing the menu, two of us opted to split the surf and turf and a salad, I chose the grilled salmon with a mango salsa and my daughter chose the filet mignon.  When our meal was served, my salmon was so dry that I had to send it back. I commented to our server that I prefer it medium rare.  When she returned with the new dish, it still was very overcooked. Because the other members in our party we're already halfway through their meals, I did not send it back to the kitchen again. For $38 though, The chef should be able to cook a piece of simple fish correctly.  The two people in our party who split the surf and turf asked to have their steak cooked medium and it came out well done instead. Again, for the high prices that they charge, you would expect your meat to come out as ordered, especially when the restaurant was practically empty because we dined so early. The only positives to our meal were the cocktails and our friendly and personable server.  The food was extremely overpriced and very mediocre quality-wise.  $300 later, we were very disappointed...

KUu8-rwjCGVZctDg3NlLFg.text: We were so happy we came for lunch. My family is extremely critical when trying new businesses. Our dining experience started with Brian, our server- he Is such a professional. We ordered the chicken piccata, salmon, and swordfish-- we were very happy with the tastiness and large amount of food. Take your big eaters-- great value.  We will head back for steak dinner ....

X0cCGuIzdsUuiNjjJ_Pl_w.text: As good or in some cases better than SoCal. Definitely consider the happy hour at the Palm, One of the best in LV!

aVtkKC4akfZbiGUqEiXa_g.text: The Palm Caesars has awesome food and service.  If you are like me that loves to eat at the bar try to go during the week for lunch and get awesome service from Ashley.  The steaks are delic and definitely try their white chocolate walnut covered bread.  Yummy !!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0p-N2LR92pErewNRM27n5A.text: The best lunch specials bar none. They have recently renovated the interior. The service is perfect here. Food came out quick. If you have never been here the lunch special is probably the best deal that exists. They recently must have slightly modified the offer it doesn't include the dessert any more but it's still a good deal. I had the swordfish which was perfect. It came with split pea soup one of my favorites and as good as it gets. They give you homemade bread as well to nibble on. You also get a side item. Had the green beans also perfect. I realize why they cut the dessert no one can eat all this. The price is great at slightly over $20.

Made_EjBvNuvHEnWTmtAig.text: First off I hardly remember waiters name because its rare that you have an unforgettable experience. The day I went I was celebrating my birthday and let me say that I left feeling extra special! Our waiter was the best ever(Carlos) and the staff as well!! I was with a party of 4 and we ordered the potatoes, salads, shrimp cocktail, lobsters amongst other things and boy was the food great!!!! The lobster is the best lobster I have ever eaten! If you eat a dessert I would recommend the cheese cake that was also the best I have ever had! It was expensive but  so worth every penny!!! I will DEFINITELY be back there!!!  Went again for the second time in a week and it was even better......this place is amazing!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf N Turf!
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is half of a lobster!

Ldwf19hODUIclrDFJw7lVA.text: Review of the "Prime Bites" Happy Hour only 4:30pm-6:30pm Monday-Friday:  The dishes have gone up to $5.50 each but that shouldn't stop you from coming here.  Imagine me saying the next passage in a Liam Neeson "Taken" kind of voice: "Sit at the bar.  Look the bartender in the eye. Only order 4 plates for 2 people.  You will be full.  And if your spoon is missing, take off your belt, snap it in half and fold it like a New York City pizza to scoop up the rest of your food."  We got the following:  Charcuterie Plate: calabrian salami, prosciutto, parmigiano-reggiano, danish blue & pepper relish.  This was a pretty substantial amount of cheese and cold cuts.  Great with some wine.    Mini Broiled Crabcakes: (3) chipotle tartar sauce.  These were just OK.  I would've preferred just one large crabcake.  No need for the cracked on the bottom of each piece of crab.  The homemade potato chips were a nice touch.    Chicken Parmigiana Sliders: Nice little fried bits of chicken in a bun.  Can't possible hate on this.      Nova Scotia Lobster BLT Sliders: lobster salad, applewood smoked bacon, oven dried tomatoes, avocado and micro greens.  The best dish we had.  I would order a double of this next time.     This would be a clear cut choice for a 5 star happy hour ONLY IF they actually offered a discount on beverages!  Palm, couldn't you even entertain the idea of $2 off a drink?  $13 martinis at 4:30pm seems kinda crazy.

FJ_Qf1f2wSpeITGHxjo6HQ.text: Great view, food, cocktails and friends. What's better? Try the new appetizer. Applewood smoked bacon. Meet the new manager Luigi

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s cocktail time exclamation!

r7YbRCyi9hBC5r8fvPGn5A.text: Went to this restaurant because Gordon Ramsey was too long of a wait. What a terrible mistake that was. The outside looked welcoming and crowded so that must be a good sign. Wrong. They sat us in the back of the restaurant which was empty.   Probably the slowest service ever. I am sure the kitchen had 1 cook. The waitress was sweet but this was over 2 hours of waiting for our food and check. The "chef special" of the day soup was claim chowder, and it tasted like they spilled a bucket of salt in it. It also tasted like soy sauce.   You've been warned.

tNt8-JaXOgJG1jeWceZEcg.text: Amazing experience - start to finish! Great service from Tony and Barry and the manager even stopped by to make sure we were having a good time. Appetizers (shrimp, tuna, calamari) were awesome and the wine selection was very good.  Of course - the main event entrees - we had steaks, salmon, chops, and chicken Marsala were all raved over. Desert too was a diet busting treat. We shared the awesome NY cheesecake,   And carrot and Chocolate cake - all were delicious and decadent (and worth the extra gym time).  Have a blast - we did!

6Yd48piyPyuQqsbiLe5h_g.text: The best customer service I've had in a really long time. Sunshine was my host. Amazing girl !!! Good conversation. Food was amazing. I'd definitely come back !!

GSJU2GNUvSXENcShWbHthA.text: We stopped in for a light dinner before seeing the Elton John show a few weeks ago and had a great experience.  Upscale vibe, professional service and seriously delicious food - beware of the huge portions though!  I ordered a wedge salad and loved it and our group shared calamari, the thick cut applewood smoked bacon (tremendous!), creamed corn brulee (sinfully good) and the hash browns.  Definitely a nice place to enjoy a good steak while visiting Las Vegas!

xVlPCaW8jkIu8ntj7ew1KQ.text: I brought out a party of 11 to Vegas with wives for a great 4 days of earned R&R.   Everything was great till we went to The Palm on April 22nd. To get our final meal it took almost 2 hrs to get our meal.  My wife's filet Mignon was the worst steak we have ever tasted- my sales manager tasted and had to spit it out.  I had the veal Marsala and it was fine in texture but had no taste.   Out of the 11 folks we had only 4 that were satisfied-non over the top as we had the other 2 evenings out.  The waitress did credit and she claimed the chef said it was a poor cut and apologized.   For me it didn't even have any seasonings.  Will never go or recommend this restaurant- even in other cities.  Maybe it's management! No one seemed to truly care- spent almost 2000 bucks- ouch

eISNRUmlkj0ybCnxQDt4Yg.text: Went here with my fiance during a Vegas conference visiting from Los Angeles. We were blown away by the service and personalized experience by Lawrence the general manager and Izzy, our server.  We started with crab cakes, and these were amazing because they were made with mostly crab which was a pleasant suprise.  We shared the lobster special (unbelievable). I added the filet and it was cooked perfectly. The super Tuscan wine by the glass was perfect. Unbelievable value!!!  Lastly, we were not rushed in any way which is rare in Las Vegas.  This is our new favorite restaurant and can't wait to go back.  Thank you Palm!  Dan and Rosalyn.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excellent experience
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and Turf! Perfectly cooked Filet and delicious Lobster

p7rlpKJSY03KxATT9FWS-A.text: This was the best service that we ever had thanks to our server Karlos Massih and his associate, who was assisting him with our table.  Both were very attentive to our needs and had wonderful people skills.  We will definitely be back to visit them next time we arrive in Vegas.  Thank you both on a job very well done as well as an experience that will last a lifetime!  God Bless.

pVXDVec6xiACNu8VkkF55Q.text: The Palm is an incredible dining experience. The food is magnificent. The staff is outstanding. Be sure to request a table on the patio , so you people watch as they walk by in the Forum Shops mall.

8XgrOAyTTsYIQ-yzcsGnzQ.text: I've always wanted to try Palm in DC but always had somewhere else to go and didn't want to get all dressed at other times. The great part about Vegas is that you can try these places in casual clothes if you feel like it. Well, I felt like it. This is really a 3.5  Yelp Tip: If you check in, you get a $15 off $100 at dinner.   I was here for lunch, so maybe next time. BUT here's another tip. They have a 3 course lunch menu for only $29. It's such a steal. I chose the lentil soup which was super flavorful. I've never had a lentil soup this good.   For my entree, I got the steak salad. There's a lot of steak on it - flavorful, perfectly cooked steak. You'd probably need to eat only half. They also give you a TON of lettuce, palm, etc. with a great vinaigrette.    For dessert, the server told us that we could get cheesecake, in addition to the key lime and flourless chocolate cake shown on the menu. She didn't need to say anymore. The cheesecake was fantastic. It's definitely New York cheesecake - HUGE piece (again, you probably only need half of it), dense and creamy at the same time, topped with strawberry sauce. It was really worth the calories.   I liked this place and loved that we could sit on the "patio" cuz you know it's really inside of Caesars' Forum shops, and totally people watch. Super plus is the server. She was perfectly chatty and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh so good cheesecake with fresh whipped cream
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak salad
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lentil soup

P-KHVeHc3Lw3-jyghy_xJQ.text: Stopped by on a whim 3/8/16 as i had won a little on the slots and wanted to treat my wife and mother in law to a nice lunch.   We happened to be walking ti the forum shoppes and this place peaked my interest    I had the filet mignon power lunch, which was soup or salad, filet mignon medallions, a side, and dessert and all for only $26 which blew me away. The salad was fresh and very flavorful,  the Filet was perfect and i do mean perfect. So tender i cut it with a spoon. Cooked the perfect rare, and dessert was a no flour dark chocolate cake with raspberry sauce and my god was it amazing.   My wife had a chicken club that was huge and soo fresh and delicious.  Add a side of sauteed wild mushrooms and you have a top notch meal for $15   My mother in law had the chili soup and it was by far the best soup I've ever had. Very flavorful great spice with a smooth finish.   Ruan was our server and boy was he on top of it. Never waited for a drink, he was funny and kind. Very fast and brought a great sence of pride to his work

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken club
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great service from Ruan
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet

oYb6dDYHPzf3qEfPzS8hGw.text: The Palm Restaurant in Las Vegas is expensive, but worth it. The salmon was incredible, and at the time that we went to Vegas I was into eating salmon frequently, and the one served at the Palm has turned out to be the best I have ever had. We live on the east coast, near the water, and seafood is readily available, but I still remember that meal as having been the best.   The atmosphere is like most steakhouses, with perfectly lacquered hard wood everywhere, and a fine dining feel the moment you walk in. As a family of four, we felt it was a little bit much to spend, but when you are in Vegas, you are there for the whole experience, so don't hold back. Enjoy and spend a little.  This is definitely a great place to do that.

D89yORia43WZD8w7FPmVZQ.text: Complete fail. Been to london branch a bunch and other ones so was expecting a great meal with 6 friends. Food took an hour and ten minutes to be delivered after we complained to waiter, then manager apologized and said seat was because food had to be redone as it was not up to his standards.  That said, we had to send 3 steaks back as 2 undercooked and 1 cold. I got the bone in ribeye and it was very unmemoriable.  We spoke to manager and he comped some food and wine, but all in all a big disappointment for what was supposed to be a memorable night out with friends.

OGdbGJf-slfItMV5hRiNng.text: The food was really good - I had a huge chicken Cobb salad, it cooled me down after a tour in LV.

DhAZ0B-jv9UBWC9LihGtXg.text: For years, no visit to Vegas was complete without a visit to the Palm.  It was a tradition I looked forward to, especially the lobster bib!  Until now.  Thank you, Palm, for providing the worst dining experience I have experienced in Las Vegas.    Ever.  From the pompus, rude 'gentleman' at the host desk (thank you for turning your back on my mom while she was asking you a question - way to make the guests feel special!) to the rushed and perfunctory service from our waiter you have more than assured me that I will never again set foot in this establishment.  The highlights included:  - The most indifferent and rude 'greeting' from the excuse of a person at the host stand. Yes, Mr. Personality, I DO have a reservation. - No greeting from our waiter - he merely opened his notebook and asked what we wanted.  Were there specials? Anything we should be aware of on the menu? We will never know. - The waiter bringing me the wrong wine selection twice and then arguing with me about what I actually ordered.  I had to show him both the name and number on the wine list - twice.  I did eventually receive what I requested - a small miracle. - The same waiter slamming down our shrimp cocktail (presented slapped on a bed of lettuce rather than in the standard iced bowl, with only four on the plate rather than the usual five) and salads (a three year old could have made these look better) at the same time on the table while mumbling that they were 'busy'. - I had to ask for water, bread and yes, even a FORK. - Lobster should not be served partially raw.  No.  I could go on, but writing this just makes me annoyed all over again.

3ncZoDx44V4-1ek_LBabzA.text: Once again pressed for time, I stopped by Palm to grab a bite. I opted for the 3 course power lunch including:   Classic Caesar Salad Chicken Parmigiana Vegetable of the Day New York Style Cheesecake  I enjoyed sitting outside and people watching; it made the time go by a lot faster as my waiter seemed to be in lalaland...  Good deal for the power lunch but I don't really like being ignored and having to do the hokey pokey to get attention for someone to refill my water...

gGTlR9hAoy1MGwDaorHoyw.text: Had a great time at The Palm!  Service by Lynn made it extra special!  She had exceptional customer service and every single one of their staff went above and beyond leaving our table impressed!

wKJi9Y6o1D2pCRZwnTG2Ig.text: This restaurant was a wonderful surprise!! It was a part of our VIP concert experience at Caesar's Palace and unexpectedly the BEST food we have ever had in Las Vegas! The service was amazing and every employee we encountered there was a delight. Have never had a better steak!! Check it out!!!

o0tFTk7Jqm7-8v8Ug-LgQg.text: I used to hate dining alone- however now I like it. I can enjoy every bite and savor each one with out having to pay attention to someone else or talk. I can just focus on my food. Btw, I love food and when I can pair it with the perfect glass of wine- well that's my heaven on earth experience. The service here at the Palm made me feel like royalty. The pretzel roll sprinkled with salt and a touch of butter was salivating my palate with that savory salty taste and butter- what a treat! They even offered more but I didn't need more carbs. I ordered the filet with sauteed spinach. It was so nice to enjoy a slow dining experience enjoying every small bite of red meat with a light pink center. A small bite of filet and a small sip of Cabernet. No need to talk or rush just savor each bite. I love spinach and it even had a few garlic cloves - I had to finish it all - sorry honey. I love garlic too. Enough ranting about my wonderful Vegas dining experience as I was feeling spoiled rotten and just enjoyed the moment.  One thing they could improve is the wine by the glass menu- not many Cabernets were offered by the glass - so I settled on Chateau St. Michele Cabernet.  FYI- there is wine bar in the Ceasar's Palace that offers Caymus by the glass. It's above my budget and Caymus is on of my favorites if you want to splurge on a good glass of cab.

d0FKdtssUq_AMKy-UytkVQ.text: A group of 20+ family members and friends have been traveling to Las Vegas every year now for 15+ years.  Every Saturday night of this weekend trip, always involves a visit to a great steak house somewhere in Las Vegas (either on or off the strip).  Sometimes we go to the same steakhouse two years in a row (eg. Maestros, Del Frisco's, etc) because the food and service are exceptional.  This year, we chose the The Palm Las Vegas.  After hearing great things and setting expectations really high, they came up a bit short.   Our bill was well north of $2,000.  But its not about amount of the bill, as much as its about the expectations we had going in.  We were expecting gold level service and unfortunately, we left feeling like our business wasn't valued.  Three members of our party were not satisfied with their main entree (either under cooked or over cooked vs. what they had requested).  When the manager came over, all he said was, "Do you want another dish?" To me that was the wrong answer.  We had been there for several hours already after ordering drinks, appetizers and salads.  These members of our party didn't want to wait another 10-20 minutes for another entree while the rest of our party continued to eat.  Their meals should have been delivered to them the right way the first time.   My only expectation at this point would be for the manager to take those three entrees off the bill. Alas, he did not, he just walked away.  To me, that response is amateur hour and not that of someone who's supposed to be running a first class dining establishment. I sent a note to the restaurant and I received an automated response saying I would hear back from someone shortly.    After speaking with Michael Martin, the GM, he assured me that our experience was not the norm.  Based on our conversation, I would be willing to give them a second chance to make things right.

RSquCPWIjtOt1ycIusWCFA.text: Expensive food with average food quality. It looks very classy but upscale but the food turns out to be just...okay. It's definitely not worth the cost if you want to eat at a place like this but I definitely do enjoy that it's in the mall when you want to take a break and eat semi-boujee.  Price: Expensive. It comes with a place like this and you know beforehand. I don't think it's exactly worth as the food isn't really compelling once presented. Other top tier steakhouses usually have a twist to the food that allows the savoriness or texture to compliment the dishes super well. This place doesn't really have much of that but charges around the same amount.  Service: Pretty good, a lot of places like this usually have good waiters/waitresses and this wasn't an exception. Waiter was nice and friendly and would speak to us when serving us, but that's about it.  Food: Pretty bland. Very typical from the same food. I hate to say it but it is what it is. I wish there was something that diversified it's dishes from the rest but like I said it's just typical. It's not necessarily a bad thing when it comes to lower tier prices/restaurants but when it comes to upscale places like this, I always want to see something different or unique that makes these places memorable, not typical.  Only wouldn't come back simply due to the food being average.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar Salad
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can this place beat Ruths Chris? Time to find out...

FFvtpUt6etkJMw7Ny4ZmgQ.text: We stayed in Vegas for 5 nights at the Golden Nugget but decided to rent a car one day to visit the strip. We visited Caesar's Palace and the Forum shops and came across a nice looking restaurant called The Palm which served a variety of items including salads. Since we had plans to go out that night for dinner to celebrate my birthday we wanted something that wouldn't be too filling! Our amazing waiter, AJ, recommended the Lobster salad and said it was his favorite so we ordered one to share! WOW!! The most amazing lobster salad EVER with so much lobster , we couldn't believe our eyes!! AJ told us the Palm imports Nova Scotian lobster fresh every day and that theses lobsters are typically 3-5 lbs in Weight!! He even brought a lobster out to show us!! Amazing food! Amazing service and he surprised us with the most delicious creme brulee for dessert to celebrate my birthday!! The Palm is on the top of our list to visit on our next trip to Vegas!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A beautiful 5lb lobster
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AJ showing us one of The Palm&#39;s lobsters!

stj1PfBvhIqfXbbIRi_WVQ.text: My husband and I came here for our anniversary. Barry was an excellent waiter and saved the day. My husband got a Prime Bone-In Rib-Eye Steak  and I got the Double-Cut Lamb Rib Chops. Both were very good and I especially loved the mint jelly. The sides were delicious also. This restaurant goes above and beyond to make sure their customers are satisfied.

-70QfLcACd_yWsk8fWv8jg.text: I was a little hesitant to eat anything because there were a few recent negative reviews.  The service was great! The portions were large.  The pricing matches the portions and food quality which was unexpected for eating on the Strip.  The drinks were tasty.  The food was also surprisingly good!    We had sea bass (hubby says it was buttery), salmon, fried calamari (comes with peppers and fried lemons), hash browns (you have to get them), green beans, Capri salad (lots of basil) and a plain house type salad.    There was way too much food for us to eat and we were on a schedule because we had tickets to see Celine. We brought the leftovers home and I heated up the hash browns for breakfast and then I heated the green beans for dinner to enjoy with bratwurst.  I almost forgot to mention the bread basket.  We ate almost all of that too! Tasty! Tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was good
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The calamari appetizer was large

Vcdlecq3_YjYyyfGbishrg.text: Every time I come here the service and food is top notch. Our server, JR, is amazing, fast, and has the best customer service skills EVER. My husband and I have been coming here for over 5+ years and not once have we left disappointed. Everything on the menu is incredible! One of the top restaurants in Las Vegas. Luigi Perez and Michael Martin the managers of the restaurant always take time to approach you and show their appreciation towards their customers. All the staff go out of their way to make you feel welcome and make your dining experience that much better.

4Xf4nAqzO4WGY85c1MEDxg.text: It was time for a return to the Palm, for it was offering an excellent summer deal on Lobster Tail.  Realizing that we meant business, our dining table was expanded on all four sides to afford more room for food for my party of four.  Then we were presented with a nice Bread Basket but Pretzel Bread was hard and the Rye Bread was not warm.  I enjoyed Torino Breadsticks dipped in butter, and a Classic Caesar Salad with requested anchovies that contained nice crisp croutons.  Meanwhile, Diane liked her Lobster Bisque, for she noted that it did not have a lingering liquor taste to it.  Then the two of us settled in to split a giant, fairly sweet 5-lb. lobster, while our guests did likewise.  As sides, Au Gratin Potatoes were suitably cheesy, and grilled Brussel Sprouts were very good.  So was the service.  I was disappointed though to hear that my Club 837 membership had expired when I submitted it for the recording of earned points.  I felt that I should have been notified about this by the corporate office before this occurred.  Nevertheless, I will certainly be back to dine here again!  XXXX-1/2 overall!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Au Gratin Potatoes
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plating the Shelled Lobster
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shelling Lobster

dvT6CpbqnDzMilKEJwNzAQ.text: Our server Tay was amazing. Very personable. Made us feel like we were  regulars, very attentive. I appreciated the wine list. Not over the top, but nice quality selections. We had some nice cocktails to start, Manhattan and Martini. Our wine was a nice super Tuscan at a reasonable price. Especially considering we are one the strip. We ordered oysters, and we think it was just an off night for them. As a bit of aficionados, we are finicky, to be fair. We has shishito  peppers that followed and they were excellent. Garlic aioli and parmigiana Regino. The Caesar and watermelon burrata salads were very good as well. The main corses steak and lobster were perfectly prepared. Small sides were more than enough. Thank you Brian Schell for the recommendation and gift. May you Rest In Peace brother.

YCbug48jq2PHraz4_nFeBg.text: Always a great experience at The Palm! Exceptional food and always cooked to perfection! Try to come every time we are in town. A True gem

_tyBAfI02EA2HJsKN51uhA.text: Arrived at The Palm shortly before our reservation time and were greeted by a friendly host. The host presented a birthday card and we were escorted to a comfortable banquette midway between the the front and rear of the dining room.  The recently renovated restaurant has wall art that consists of caricature paintings of many celebrities. It makes for interesting conversation. The dining room has a variety of seating options, tables  in the center of the room, booths and banquettes along the walls. There are also table outside on the patio which are in the Forum shopping promenade. The patio seating is a choice if you prefer people watching. The dining room is open to the bar area with viewing of the 3 large screen TV's from most seats. If you prefer not to view the TV's. request a booth towards the back of the dining room.   Immediately after being seated were asked for our choice of water and the bread basket  arrived. There were several choices of bread along with butter and the requested containers of olive oil and balsamic. In celebration of the birthday our table was sprinkled with multi color stars.   The appetizer was the Baked Clams Casino. A flavorful dish with 8 clams topped with crispy bacon in a nice butter garlic sauce.   Our entrees were the 9 ounce Filet Mignon and the Atlantic Wild Halibut. The meals are a la carte. The sides were the Half and Half Potatoes and Grilled Asparagus and can be ordered family style, for 2 or more or an individual portion.   The Filet was cooked as requested and was an ample portion. The Half and Half potatoes was an enormous individual portion that would satisfy 4 people. The order is a mix of crispy cottage fries and fried onions. The Atlantic Wild Halibut was served on a bed of kale with garlic and lemon. The fish was flaky and mild. The grilled Asparagus was lightly charred and  al dente. The individual portion size was just right for 1 person.  Our server Angel and associate Michael were top notch. They were friendly, helpful and checked on our satisfaction throughout.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Richard Gere &amp; Friends
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half and Half
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Asparagus

k7LloK-4zkMYwQuELUXnlw.text: This pricey steak and seafood restaurant in the fake outside space of the casino can get lost in the massive sizes of the other restaurants, but it offers up some tasty, though expensive options. I opted to stay li on the light side and skipped the steak and got the lamb instead. It was incredibly delicious and very well cooked. Service was super friendly and checked in often.

02JSeCRnwhLIaADAJSqOBQ.text: We were trying to make our way to Joe's at Cesars, but holy crotcholi, all that walking, the heat, the people, the being 4 drinks deep, we needed sustenance!  Just like a mirage, there was the Palm.  It was about 10 pm and we were immediately seated in a large booth.  We were also quickly greeted by our server and bus boy.  Who introduced themselves and picked up on our vibe and brought over waters and bread and Butta.    Nice Steakhouse menu, I liked seeing the 14 oz fillet.  I went for that and the creamed spinach.  The dishes came out quickly and were wonderful.  The fillet was cooked perfectly, and the creamed spinach was naughty AF.  Like all cream and fluffy and stood up and just che bella.   My Girly went for the Rib eye, which was smart cuz it was delicious and after a bite reminded me why rib eye is so divine.  The last steak I had in vegas at BLT was really lousy and the Palm was far better.    Plus our server, was excellent, attentive, genuine, and pickin up what we were putting down.  I slept really good after 14 oz of meat. Well done!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Close up
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 14 oz fillet :-)

2LUFFELbl1KOHaWcMaS_pQ.text: We had the surf and tuff(5/5), black berry bramble(2/5), seasonal mule(2/5), 7 layer cake(5/5), Bulleit bourbon Old Fashioned (5/5), cream corn brulee was incredible (6/5 - yes, that good). Lobster was perfect as was the 12 oz fillet.   Server didn't come to the table for 10 minutes and we asked someone else to help us. Our server didn't realize we were in her area. Otherwise, she was fine yet the overall service experience felt a bit weak given the outstanding food.   Even though Las Vegas is choked with options, my wife loved the lobster and I the corn, we'll certainly return.

Nn4Y25n1OnwnxyA0l3zBkA.text: I have eaten here twice prior to this  Mother's Day . I was expecting it to be better . The filet mignon Oscar a  little chewy and tasteless & very little crab and bernaise sauce . The desserts were not so tasty either I thought they would taste so much better. (Chocolate cake & cheesecake) .  The service was terrific our waiter was  very attentive & friendly. Five stars to him! Bread on the table very very good ! Maybe it was an off day for them - it happens.

_kKvUvu5OyVI1WYe2cYKug.text: This was a last minute but always the best decision when hungry. I had such a wonderful experience tonight with my sever--Ms. Phenomenal TAY! She jumped through a couple of hoops tonight without even asking. She deserves more than a 5 star we need to start giving out 10 STARS to the ones who are most wonderful like Tay!!!  I had impeccable food.. started with Small Lobster (since they were sold out of the big ones) then came the pasta and delicious chicken parmigiana, followed by sides: creamy spinach, mash potatoes, and mushrooms. Very nice service and glad I signed up for the membership that is available. This location and all the locations are different so I recommend it highly to try out the one in your nearest city. They aren't everywhere yet but I hope they will be making more chains because they treat you like family and you are always in good hands here. Never a bad dine. I've been coming here since 10 years old and I'm almost 35. Thank you for the upmost service and hospitality. My 2nd Home for sure!

9TxM4RTpge8cM10IfjC-hw.text: Always a favorite.  A Tuesday night with friends.  Great food and company.  Love the lobster bisque and filet.

7b89DZXCSpRzKZN5Ej6vCg.text: Love going here when we're feeling a little high class lol food and service are great. I always get the Seared Crusted Ahi, and my wife gets the Classic burger. Let me tell you it's no ordinary burger. Food is great and they serve San Peligrino which is always a plus.

AtC2cSVfo-kV9Mo83ZzWWw.text: Consistently an amazing piece of meat! I've eaten at Palm in LA, Vegas and airport in FL and it's always amazing!!! Service is par with the food. Today's server was wonderful too.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York steak yummmm

w_IfkR6kUqmrV8fpaNmSrw.text: Service is superb, food is ok, ambiance is very cool and "Vegasy" Consider it a bit overpriced.  As many places on the Strip...

-V0wOfIexDxbnUUalI1Qaw.text: The Palm is located just inside the Forum Shops immediately as you exit Caesar's Palace. It's a classic New York steakhouse (born 1926) that serves familiar upscale comfort food such as steaks, salads, Lobster and chicken parm.  There has been a recent renovation which opened up the restaurant a bit, making it less dark and more lively/louder.  It has the feel that it is populated with regulars and has a rewards program to encourage repeat visits. If you are a member, you will benefit from their free lobster offer on your birthday and discounts with your points.  The walls are covered with caricatures of local celebrities and if you dine there often enough, you might get your own caricature on the wall.  The service is warm and you are usually treated like you are a regular, even if you are not. Great touch.  The food is all around of very high quality and delicious. No complaints here.  We had one steak that was ordered rare and came out medium well. It was quickly remedied and the server made it a painless replacement. A free dessert was offered. Classy!  5 guests in our party, all 5 were fully satisfied with the experience. Would recommend, we'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great Las Vegas mural

vTT7ghVHJll_mHORWVD69Q.text: My brother is a local and regular here!5 star place no questions asked! Dutch is one of the best waiters I have ever had!! Megan is an awesome waitress as well (SLOPPY MEGAN)

b-gL0y_OFWcNisMRspK0OA.text: I've been a regular at the Palm in NYC for a while now. While in Vegas, I thought we should try a Western outpost.   We arrived about 10 minutes before the kitchen closed...Tommy the bartender was made us feel like regulars right away. He hooked us up with some Prime Time Bites, which were great. The drinks were made perfectly, can't go wrong with bleu cheese stuffed olives in your martini.  The Palm - Vegas is by far one of the few places that meets the hype.

oJOE91-sbTDsEpwR_zQ7kw.text: My boss kept raving about the Palm in Boston so on a night in Vegas when we had no plans, my husband and I decided to give it a try and boy, were we glad we did! In the year and a half since, we've been back to this location several times as well at the downtown Los Angeles and San Diego location. However, the Vegas location is the best in my opinion, mainly because of the service.Palm has become one of our favorite go-to restaurants.  Don't expect a hip and modern vibe here- Palm is classic old school and perhaps that's what makes it good. Classic food such as filet and lobster- you can't wrong with that. But the the way the food is cooked here and the freshness of the ingredients is what really makes it stand out. Although I've tried a few other things on the menu, the filet mignon is to die for. Its cooked perfectly, a little bit crispy on the outside, moist and juicy on the inside. The Gigi salad is worth trying as well but beware-its quite large and could be a meal in itself. Once again its a simple salad but everything is so fresh, you'll swear they have their own vegetable outside.   If you've never eaten here before, make sure you let them know. On our first visit, we were given a slice of cheesecake on the house. I'm not a cheesecake fan ordinarily but that's a damn good cheesecake. Apparently, its not made fresh there but shipped from New Jersey but I think that's what makes it so good, ha!  The Vegas location is one of the few open for lunch so be sure to take advantage of the business lunch. Its around $20 and is a great way to try out the food at Palm without breaking the bank.  One last note, join the 837 club, you will receive great coupons that make it worth your while such as free entrees. When a filet is $45, its a great deal.

6L4Tv9O-PZNA7rkXsIc_zg.text: Love this place. Great steaks, great vibe. Big fan of this chain overall - this is my favorite location.

k6eEgt2I44lGu10Vql-tUA.text: I love this place....the staff could not try harder...we had a small private party with lots of changes, almost like a test to see how accommodating they are!!  They passed with flying colors.  Larry the manager really went out of his way for us, and, Michelle planned everything perfectly.  The food was perfect, everyone had something they liked, ad, the large steamed lobster tasted straight from New England!  I am a huge fan of the New York City Palm(s) and this is now on my list.  Thanks guys....terrific.  There are a lot of choices in Vegas, but, they try so hard hard, it's like old school, and a staple for me.  Fabulous!!

cahzEXmTBqwgUgxVnegFEg.text: Never a bad meal!  The service is outstanding; on my last trip, the waitress doubled as the sommelier very capably.  The red meat is cooked to perfection (read: not cooked much at all); they get the caprese salad just right, with a thick slice of onion and tomatoes full of flavor; the family-style sides are great and plentiful; the wine is not overpriced; and the desserts are inviting, even if you're too full to partake.  It won't be cheap, nor will it be as much as Nobu.

ziY3LbgPVPE8cVwfnlfNMg.text: No matter what, you can always count on The Palm to do things perfectly.  Service, food, drinks, wine - everything was great.  Again.  We frequent The Palm in Chicago, DC and Vegas and have NEVER had a single problem.  In Vegas, try to sit "outside" and watch the hilarious Vegas crowd wander by.  This may not be the best steakhouse in Vegas, but it is consistently amazing...you can not go wrong eating here,

q7pBP2ZwgHsOO_az0k-CjQ.text: Blah.  I remember going to the Palm in San Diego several years ago and being very pleased.  Here in the Forum Shops, it was "whatever."  The caesar salad was wilted/too warm, the fish was dry, and onion strings and chips were sopping in oil.    If you're in a pinch at the Shops and there's no other place to eat, then maybe go and try to find a good dish.  Otherwise, walk on by...

3WxY4x73lBvKxjGoB5qdqQ.text: A great steakhouse, with a traditional menu, excellent service and a nice atmosphere.  I've been to the Palm in Tyson's Corner VA, which is equally nice, but it was a work event in a private room so it was hard to judge.  So when we realized we didn't have reservations, but the Palm in Vegas could take us for dinner, I jumped at the chance.  It was pricey, but very worth the money.  I had a gut-busting 26 ounch slice of heavenly prime rib - and it was cooked perfectly.  The potatos au gratin were okay, but I like the ones at Ruths Chris better.  We were so full we didn't have dessert, which is too bad, because I've heard they're great here.  Overall a great, traditional restaurant.  If you're looking for fusion-this, nouveau-that food go elsewhere, but if you want an awesome steak (or salmon, which my wife had) this is the place to go.

nuBDd3QqQEvdgK1k4ih4Yg.text: I went here once for my Bday.  I remember the crab bisque was ok but the filet mignon was superb.  What made it great was our wonderful waiter, Dutch.  He reminded me of Tony Soprano so I had an instant crush.  Fine dining and great pictures to look at while you await the final bill....oh, it's gonna cost you but hey, you are in Vegas...Enjoy!

okZbxhFUYe9TGyMFyKdMQA.text: Palm Restaurant will definitely satisfy your hunger. Prices are pretty reasonable to. They have these potato's which are like homemade potato chips, yum! One thing I remembered about this place is that if you order a coke it come in those old school bottles which is pretty cool.

MiNufTpn67L3iDI1R6OppQ.text: The service and food sucks here.... it was good prob 7 years or something ago when the Palms first opened and they had their midnight special but even then.. only the price was good but the food was not sooo good...  drive down the street to get better food elsewhere!

T6uX4Cu6Jz0kklcfFcDCqQ.text: yum yum. You want a great filet? come here. You want a great filet with awesome service? come here. I crave this place. I wish i had some warning though the first time I came here that filets were al a carte. despite this I enjoyed myself immensely all the times I have come here. And in reality they do not make you ponder what else you could of spent your money on. I hate that feeling. Go here. you will be happy.

TqRkbOlXOWNMiW8B-41fwQ.text: I actually really liked the Palm Restaurant.  I had dinner here with my boss and enjoyed my shrimp scampi and pasta.  The food was great, the wine was reasonable and the atmosphere was generally enjoyable.  The waitstaff was lovely and it was actually quite reasonable in price.  I'll be back to the Palm!

TYcvmqZNcvsSOkF2o_E25g.text: My favorite all around Steakhouse in Vegas. Never had a bad meal. Service is excellent and the staff really know there stuff. It is not too pretentious in there at all. You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. However I love the monday night salad.

NC27YrpwVSpeNsKaR4hrqg.text: Good enough but not at all what I expected, I guess I just really did not feel the place (and all those weird drawings on the walls)... Went for lunch and had one of the "specials" @ $25 mmm it was a sort of Seafood platter with soup but I didnt feel it was all that to rave about, its overrated for sure.

Jne4aIqDQfVdw482HbwNww.text: Nice place for a 2 hour power lunch. Went on a Sunday with a friends family and the place was not very busy. The business lunch special is still not a bad deal for $19.50 Service was generally attentive since it was slow I reckon, I had the 8oz fillet and I think I got someone else's steak. Should have sent it back because it was medium well to done but F**K it I was hungry and it was on someone else's dime and didn't want to stir things up. The hash browns and chips they serve are excellent. Some of the desserts they serve up are huge enough for 3-4 people. Not the best experience I've had here but it was OK.

ufuxNUg6Ymw6wVGmMlVQYw.text: First time ever I have been disappointed.  Lettuce wedge was great, other than the white onions (should I say a whole onion) on the salad.  A tasty red onion would have been absolutely perfect!.  The garlic potatoes, without saying, the best, along with the spinach.  When it came to the lobster,  did someone forget it was in the oven?  So stuck to the shell.  If you wanted to eat it, you had to pry it loose.  Our waiter did offer a dessert to compensate for the "toughness" of the lobster.  No thank you, but you could offer to buy me that $24.00 dollar "glass" of wine.

xDMbFn0LUJ6sIglOzeT1dw.text: Not the best steakhouse in Vegas, but consistently very, very good (where others have been hit and miss.)  I usually go with the filet, but have also really enjoyed the Lobster or Swordfish over the years.  Lobster Bisque, salads, and desert are great too.

exJ2XQembAuAfA3_eUuZTQ.text: a steakhouse that's not too fancy or ritzy. it's pretty laid back. the host, server, and even the manager asked if we were enjoying our meal; love the attentiveness. and as for the steak... i ordered my petit filet medium rare, but it was a little more cooked that that, but that's not something to deduct a star on.

MunAN4_W25lRhSaXooGtLQ.text: Absolute amazing food and service.  Highly recommend.  Kelly and Lynn are the best...very attentive and welcoming!

potm9lpz-6qTL4DLQIIXeQ.text: All of the Palm restaurants I have visited including the one in Las Vegas are perfect, excellent food, and served with professionalism??!! That is exactly what you can expect from any of the Palm Restaurant and is by all means a restaurant anyone should experience at least one time and to the level expected from this fine dining establishment.

ifyrDqi4KRtAgu4PGJYI2g.text: It was my first time at Palm Restaurant to experience their Prime Bites Menu at happy hour. After having their Prime Steakburger Sliders, it makes me wonder why I have never gone there before. It's an AWESOME deal!! I came here with Lily D. as she stopped by the Strip for a bite to eat before picking up her friend at the airport. I have to agree with many Yelpers and say that Palm Restaurant has one of the best Happy Hour Menus on the Strip. Take a look at these Prime Steakburger Sliders (yelp.com/user_local_phot...). They were with applewood smoked bacon, lettuce, tomato, and pesto aioli. DELICIOUS!! Now paying just $4.50 for them during happy hour was straight up ridiculous! They're normally priced at $10, but they're even more desirable if you get them during their Prime Time at the Bar which is usually M-F from 4:30p-6:30p and from 9:30p to closing. Lily D. ordered the Nova Scotia Lobster BLT Sliders which contained Nova Scotia lobster salad, applewood smoked bacon, oven dried tomatoes, avocado, and micro greens. They look awesome as well but I was still working on my Steak Sliders. I'll have to try those next time since they were $4.50 for Prime Time as well! Palm Restaurant will definitely get another visit from me in the future as I will attack the rest of their Prime Bites Menu and maybe also to try their steaks as well.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime Steakburger Sliders!  At $4.50 during happy hour, it&#39;s an awesome deal!!

Aeznycj04f3PE_E_eEiExw.text: Amazing food and drinks! Great service. If you haven't been there it's a must while your in vegas. Cheers!

6OufTaWzvevVAk_dvkuVyQ.text: The maitre d was very welcoming then Tony our waiter made us at home. The lentil soup good but was a bit salty.  Ceasar's Salad tasted refreshingly tasty, desserts made the rest of our afternoon. they pride to be the first original restaurant to serve with white table cloth. An awesome place for our power lunch

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The brightness makes it feel like it will taste like heaven!
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waiting for desserts

Nkl3SpgtCTfQWXw23Wyyrw.text: The drinks were nothing special. The steak was good. I had better, but still pretty good.  Big portions. Set up for big parties, but not so much for private events like anniversaries.

HApV5pqA0KPv3DsgsaWGKA.text: It's a while since I last ate at Palm at Cesars Palace.  The last time was for a the World of Concrete Convention. Yes,  you heard it, World of Concrete.   The only thing I could remember was bone in fillet, 9-1/2 pound lobsters, and glasses of whisky. The lobster claw was probably the size of my forearm. I wish I took a picture.  I can't forget watching some colleagues getting up from the table and wobbling to the restroom... Lightweights!

vnMaW-E1aEab33y162if2A.text: We are frequent diners at The Palm LA, so since we were in town, my husband and I checked out the Palm in Las Vegas (In the Caesar Forum Shops). We were greeted by Kelly, the AGM, who was very friendly! We ate at the bar since we were dressed casually and Victor was our great bartender. Totally recommend for great tasting food and drinks! The creamed corn is to die for!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb lollipops w/creamed corn
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Bruno w/mashed potatoes

IOFHIGeO4UYhiSgTBPtVfg.text: I can't remember the first day I tried this restaurant a couple years ago. I hadn't realized there is also a location in Los Angeles (as many restaurants on the Las Vegas Strip) but to this day it is still the best place in the West Coast to get a shrimp cocktail and a 2 lb lobster.  I never get anything else.  I try to go at least once a year.  I have never found seafood this fresh in San Francisco Bay Area.  This reminds me of old school Los Angeles and the service is always top notch.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IPflH7Cy85nIENg76lrrOA.text: Being in Vegas for vacation, we decided to check out Caesar's Palace since that's where Hangover was filmed and just randomly pick a restaurant to dine in and trust me we didn't care to spend the extra money for a great experience.   All the staff were really nice and it does seem like they were making an effort for everything, it just took forever to get our food. We ordered the lunch special where it comes with an appetizer, entree, and dessert and in between each one just seem to takes forever before the next one would come out. So we were done with our soup and awkwardly waited for the main course to come to us, finished with that and just sat there to chat so long that we forgot we still have dessert left, and on top of that we had to get someones attention to give us the bill and it's even longer of a wait whenever you pay in card.   Maybe we didn't order the right thing, but food tasted ok. I understand the whole concept of portions that are meant to be smaller, but rich in flavor, but my food was average. It's all good, all the extra wait time made me forget how hungry I was. It's just funny because we decided to sit inside instead since all of outside were full so it just didn't make sense to me how it wasn't busy in our section, but the wait time were still long.

ir0oBnXUsbNEylco8IjxRQ.text: Stopped in for the lunch special with my girlfriend.  Since I had been sick the day prior, it was important that we were able to share it, which we were informed would not be a problem.  My girlfriend had just bought a large frozen drink for our expected walk down to the Palazzo (before we spontaneously stopped into The Palm).  Luckily, unlike many other places in Vegas, they did not put up a big stink about her bringing the cocktail in.  Our server was so great, attentive, yet not meddling.  Our water glasses were always filled in as needed.  Unsure between the Caesar Salad and Chicken Noodle Soup as our first course (due to some hangover recovery dietary needs), our server surprised us by bringing both!  We got the Chicken Parm, which was good...if anything maybe the tomatoes a little too sweet, as the main dish and the half chips/half onion rings as the side.  It was so much food that I can't imagine anyone finishing a Lunch Special by themselves.  Even with two of us, we brought about half of it home.  The cheesecake dessert was also delicious.

C9GAukofWXBlC94bdxbd-g.text: This is such a classic restaurant. I love going here after a little Forum shopping. I have never had anything bad and the service is always excellent.  My favorite appetizer is the Sesame Seared Ahi Tuna and the Carpaccio of Beef Tenderloin- Delicious! I always get the Beefsteak Tomato Capri because it is my all time favorite salad. The Linguine and Clams Sauce is excellent if you are looking for a pasta dish. The Chilean Sea Bass is also a great choice for a light fish dinner.  For dessert the Key Lime Pie is a must. This restaurant will not disappoint.

XRL7unEo1ikjGA4_22fZKw.text: What a delicious experience!!  This restaurant is pricey, but you know that walking in.  And the food and service are what you'd expect when you pay their prices.  I had the half-lobster (half of a 3-lb) and the salmon (which they even cooked rare for me.)  Both were stellar.  The portions are small, and everything is a la carte, but delicious.  Everyone at our table raved about the lobster (as did I), and my husband really liked the bone-in filet mignon.  They crack the lobster for you, at your table.  Everything was cooked just right, and nicely seasoned.      There are photos on the walls of people who have frequented the restaurant enough to earn them.  Expect to spend a lot of money here for dinner, and expect to enjoy every bite!

9IkRz-Ax2CmJ_f9GYX2q4Q.text: I come here at least once a week. The food is the best, service is 5 star, and the staff are great. The best server is Ana....she's quick, easy to talk to, and your food comes out fresh!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Silver Oak...the best.

z6wpmkYMqQFWkb0YKp1S0A.text: It was a great experience and yummy food. We were seated promptly. I ordered tomatoes bisque soup and salmon.  The soup was very good, flavorful - and it is a big bowl of soup, I was full after it.  Salmon was cooked perfectly - flaky, lots of flavor, very juice.  Nice little salad on the side. My friend ordered linguine clams - was very satisfied with that, said that the pasta was very fresh.  Waiters were very attentive, took a good care of us.  Over all - great experience.

PxYoeTUkJlEcdkqunMcsQQ.text: My employer took us here for dinner and the 4 lb. lobster was amazing ! Our waiters were so nice and informative. Also, it was an employees birthday and they gave us cake and doughnuts plus sang for us. The seafood is amazing as well as the appetizers. Overall, I have zero complaints.

LZnoxyOggRAWvKjyesMzow.text: I went here for a family dinner with a party of 17. It was great that we made our reservation and right as we got there we were seated. The food was ok, but I've had better for the price.  Everyone that ordered the lobster bisque got food poisoning, and it was so unfortunate we ate this the night before we were to head back home to LA. After calling the restaurant to let them know, they just said that it was not because of their soup and insisted it was something else we ate. A simple apology would have sufficed. I mean we were just letting you know how it literally all went down.

73hicx1FMTlfBWMEnTNN7A.text: My uncle treated me, my wife and my cousin to a birthday meal.  I'm torn because yes, the service is excellent, however, my lobster was tough and chewy and my wife's steak was just "ok".  I don't eat beef, so I can only go on what she said.  She said " it wasn't that flavorful".  She ordered it Medium Well and it was anything but well.  More rare and she didn't want to send it back.  The sides were tasty, the half and half and the creamed spinach.  We also shared a ceasar salad that was good too.  My uncle loved his sea bass and my cousin had chicken parm.
