Oh and the chocolate cake was too die for,  Very moist and very fresh and very yum.

JiwIawId9O1YmIAoBTUS-Q.text: Overall rating:  3.75 Stars  Ambiance: 3 stars - a bit dated and musty View: 5 stars  Service:  4-5 stars The service was amazing. The perfect level of attention and recommendation without being invasive  Food:  3-4 I ordered the sol.  It was cooked perfectly.  I got it with lemon, capers in a butter sauce.  The flavors were good.  My friend got the filet it was tender an juicy, cooked correctly.  There was just no wow factor or anything special, yet the food was tasty.

k6hcKoHNs--JBDYJrqHLRg.text: Perfect high energy dinner spot on the strip. My guest requested steak and lobster which made it easy for me to choose the Palm as our place to go. Dry aged steak special was exceptional (one of the best steaks ever eaten) lobster was fresh flavorful and cooked to perfection. Creamed spinach was rich and wonderful. Service is family friendly and refreshing. Ask for Larry Close, Palm's seasoned General Manager and Las Vegas' finest host!

pnuoy0PrqiNOjmJnmC1naQ.text: Such a late post but I can't forget this place! The ambience is intimate and is a perfect place to eat and have a drink. We had our dinner with Expedia 2015 and enjoyed every part of the experience there.  Servers were attentive and professional and food came out on a timely manner.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wine!
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Airline and hotel dinner meeting

D7d0yLwHvC1M_40MVnfK3g.text: Absolutely horrible service by AMANDA C. Waitress, fake smile, free bread is yucky, not Fresh at all...we ordered the crab cake appetizer, small rip off, It took forever for our food to come quess she was to busy to mention anything, the mushrooms-good....peanut butter pie-good again horrible service, this place SUCKS , been there 2 and horrible, how they stay busy with crappy service like AMANDA shocks me to death, go to Joe's stone crab, always AMAZING, we ordered decaf coffee she never came by to ask to refill our coffee, this place seriously SUCKS

5w8A-wnbP400nTUoH57kIg.text: Came here for dinner and I had steak. I wasn't to impressed with the steak it tastes burned and the only thing that made it taste better was adding salt. I thought it was because I order it it to be medium well but someone else in our party go medium rare and even with a lot of pick in the middle the outside was burnt. She too has to add salt to try and make it taste better.   The lobsters were huge and I don't love lobster but it was actually really good. I would recommend the lobster.   The service is pretty good overall

OYdVtI5rviOa7knzBJlUfg.text: service always top notch....  And the food never dissapoints... usually do the surf and turf but this time we decided on the 5lb lobster.... delicious thank you david

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just a 5lb appetizer

CpMKAPG70AuEYd_opMCWFg.text: The service was great!  Ordered a simple burger for lunch, asked for medium, it came medium well, was very disappointed with the dish.  I was expecting a lot more from this elegant restaurant//

u9TE6cIItM2BEgNEIx5ORw.text: Had the $99 lobster for two today. Don't waste your money.... meat was tough. This is not the first time we have had the special over the years and it was just as bad as last time.  Without a doubt there are much better places in town to eat so I suggest you seek that out

2GiBnzXazvcLkeGk7_Ewpw.text: Food amazing, wine amazing, service...DOUBLE amazing!! AJ was our server and he was amazing honestly don't think we would've had the same awesome experience without him!!

J9SVJFpzO1Ojt9Yy7_HU5A.text: One of my favorite places to eat on the Strip, the Palm brings an elegance and atmosphere to your dining experience similar to brasseries in London and Paris. Food is always on point here, whether you go with light fare like a good burger or salad, or you opt for a more complete meal. The salads are excellent and I recommend their fish and meat options.  Service at the Palm is really great, and very unlike typical Strip experiences. The waiters take the time to take care of you and they make great suggestions.   Finally, location location location. Nestled right between Caesars and the Forum Shoppes, the Palm is the best place to stop between shopping and gambling for a drink or a meal or both!

v2I5k8CctSdUSKuXG-HFow.text: Two of us walked up to the Palm without reservations on a Wednesday night and were promptly seated.  Not our first time to visit this location, this visit was yet another example of consistency - great food with excellent service.  The filet was very tender with a great flavor, and the two sides we shared - green beans and regular mashed potatoes complimented the meal.  Overall value of this steakhouse in terms of food and pricing are, to me, much better than the signature steakhouses in most of the Vegas casinos and worth the trip.

0eQpSp30G73GVs-FA2dEHg.text: You can't go wrong here.   The staff is the best. Victor and Kelly at bar, Barry and Tony table servers.   These folks work to make you happy.  The food is great.  Not sure why there are haters out there.  Go off menu   The portions are more than generous.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monday Night salad, shrimp

YhYPyB2QMxjw__WtxB8qVg.text: This establishment in is in a price range I would normally avoid (although I'm not sure why since I don't mind jamming that much $$ into a video poker machine), but my sweet and generous nephew was in town and called to invite me out.  I was initially hesitant since I hate to dress up in anything more formal than jeans and a t-shirt, but I bit the bullet because I was hungry and the family was basically shoving me out the door (apparently I was "in a mood").   So, attired in what passes for my Sunday-Go-To-Meetings, I entered through the self parking lot to discover it was a very short walk just around the entrance to the Forum shops. I already liked this place.  And I needn't have worried. The seating spills out onto a patio area that basically renders it into a food court, and the other patrons were dressed in styles ranging from very casual slacks and shirts to suits and sequins. Just depends where you were earlier or where you're going later, I guess.  On to the food: Crab cakes were delicious, possibly the best I've had. Long ago I resigned myself to the fact that crab cakes were made of shredded meat from the ankles and antennae - where else could you get such miserable, puny strands? Not here. Actual lumps of sweet, juicy meat and delicious sauce. The lobster bisque was probably the second best- old TJ's at the Hilton was my fave, but I had no complaints about this version. And no doubt about it - the prime rib WAS the best both Sugarmarine and I have ever eaten. We were too stuffed to actually finish, but that did not preclude us from ordering some tangy. delectable key lime pie.  And the leftovers? The waiter packed them up for us, and we discovered that part of the meat had been made into sandwiches for convenient dining later that night. Or on the car ride home. Or the elevator.

Jb4qgzacc2sSyunVCjLVWw.text: Food is fairly priced for an upscale menu and always spot on. Every time I go to the Palm, I always get the Nova Scotia lobster. This is probably my favorite place to go to satisfy my lobster cravings . The bone in Ribeye was nicely prepared, and went well with the lobster truffle butter that we ordered . I loved the garlic mashed potatoes ! The service was ok. I mentioned that we had a bday at our table, but the lack of communication from hosts to server was disappointing. We received our desserts with no candles and so, awkwardly we had to ask for a candle so that a bday picture could be taken . It just showed an apathy on their part. Rafael, the Busser was awesome . He was attentive and went above and beyond to make sure we were ok. He was probably the only positive looking person here. Most of the staff seemed like they just didn't want to be there today. I probably won't go here to celebrate special occasions anymore. It's more of a place that you can go to splurge a bit and casually dine. All in all, I still have the yummy taste of the Nova Scotia lobster in my mouth! Very happy!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UNxlqiiRj-6B_3TEbdrN_g.text: The restaurant seemed like it would be a nice delicious place to get food, but it wasn't. The restaurant looked as if it was trying to be a classy, upscale place to eat, but if only the food lived up to the look of the place.   The waitress was okay, didn't get her name but it seemed like she didn't care to give us great service, probably because we were a bit younger than the people who dined here. They took about 45-50 mins for our entrees to come out, and the waitress didn't really check on us as much either.   We ordered a good amount of food and we were disappointed. My bf had the steak, some mash potatoes, and the lobster Mac & cheese. I got the chicken parmesiana and the lobster bisque. The mash seemed like it was instant mash potatoes, the Mac & chz was eh. His steak was alright, a little too charred but it was okay. My chicken parm was gross. It looked so messy and as if they just plopped some fried chicken filet with some cheese and sauce. The lobster bisque was so salty and there was like 2 little chunks of lobster in it. What a joke. Looked like some damn diner food in my opinion, not an upscale restaurant. Which also is ridiculous since the prices for the food are crazy high for the bad quality it was. We knew how much the food was going to be, so money wasn't a big issue until we tasted it. I didn't even finish my food, I took like 5 bites and was just done. My bf only finished his steak and that was that.  I don't recommend coming here if you have taste buds and are expecting delicious food.

g6SkiHrtuqFigjYK1W1CFQ.text: First time here. Stopped by for the coconut-crusted sea scallops appetizer, salads and glasses of red wine. With the free bread basket, this makes for a meal. We sat out in the front and watched the people flow by.  Waiter was a champ. Even though we weren't dining extensively, we still got attentive service by him and staff.  The vibe is good...we'll be back with more of an appetite.  Enjoy!

o79YRVqcjM8JCUC7O2yVKA.text: What a disappointment! Come here often over the years and was introducing my son to one of my go to's. High hopes but the food quality was severely lacking. All of our steaks absolutely had no flavor, the Brussels sprouts were under seasoned  the fries limp and cold. Service was good.

857OCLwBRjH4DsjwFCpk_A.text: Came visiting from out of town with a few colleagues. Greeting was prompt, drinks always filled. We began the evening with lobster bisque which was absolutely exquisite. Our server (Kirk I believe) was perfectly present, not absent not frequently lingering. As we continued I selected the 12oz filet as did 3 other members of the party, and one ribeye. The ribeye was bursting with flavor and perfectly cooked. I requested my filet medium rare, another was suppose to be medium. Plates were misplaced as my steak was medium rather then medium rare and vice versa. We paired our steaks with a lobster truffle butter which I would highly recommend. As we began to enjoy I noticed a pungent vinegar taste reoccurring throughout my filet. I tried the others and they didn't not acquire this off putting taste. I was happy everyone enjoyed they're meal but I was quite disappointed and barely finished my dish. Overall I would award Kirk 5 stars for the service but 3 stars for my pungent filet. Brussels sprouts lacked flavor as well as the "duck fat" fingerlings. Mushrooms were excellent!

Znr0vwJRSc8T2hKwINU8yA.text: Stopped in for lunch while I was attending a convention. Service generally just didn't seem to care or were extremely dismissive of myself and other diners who were dining alone. They weren't very busy but still slow (after almost 20 minutes of not seeing my waitress to try and order, I almost got up and left...which I should have done). The menu on OpenTable is not anything like what is actually available at the restaurant either which was very disappointing.   In general, the servers were just very unprofessional for a "high end" establishment. A small group of them were gathered in the corner (maybe 6 feet from me) and were doing nothing but talking trash about people well within ear shot almost the entire time. Not cool.   The food itself was barely edible. She asked me no less than 3 times how I wanted my burger cooked (med-rare/med). It came out as well done+. Since she had disappeared for 20 minutes and I was running really short on time at this point, it was a bit of a lost cause and I ate part of it since i was starving. Eventually the manager(?) came over and tried to make it right and he was very nice and apologetic. He was really the only positive part of the experience, everything else just plain sucked.   I had to ask the waitress for every little thing which was super annoying. Silverware? Ketchup for my burger? C'mon, amateurs shouldn't be working at a place like this. Presentation was lackluster as well. Then it took at least 10 minutes to get anything. I was there for 1 hour+ and just disappointment to show for it. There's too many other great dining options nearby to bother with this place again.

Pa3fZxwqonA1rwunPwI7Gw.text: This place appears as a mirage amongst the millions of high end stores all around in Caesar's. Lobster bisque was one of the best I've ever had, steak done to perfection and service was wonderful. Couldn't have asked for a nicer lunch spot on a hot Vegas day.

cxXVjt7A8yvp81Xdx-mEjw.text: A nice quick lunch while shopping at the Forum. Service is very attentive. I think they filled my ice tea after each sip.   Very nice bread basket placed on the table (I love that!) good selection and not crazy overpriced for Vegas.   I had the chop salad with blackened chicken. Generous nice portion, I couldn't finish (thanks to the bread). I'm pretty particular about my chicken being cooked well done and they were very accommodating and it was cooked perfectly.   I'd come back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blackened chicken on the chop salad

v67OZ95hLB067gJIfhLeAw.text: An amazing lunch at The Palm! Had the lobster BLT and it was so good- lots of lobster meat and a TON of sweet potato fries. Great service from Ambar!

tITHI-HW0wrWKuJmfA52wA.text: We went to the Palm for my husbands birthday.  Our server "Issy", was outstanding.  My husband had the 18 ounce NY strip steak and said it was the best he ever had.  I had the lobster tail and it was wonderful.  The Lobster bisque was the best I've ever had and crab cake appetizer was outstanding.   The  3 cheese au gratin potatoes were just sinful, creamy is just the beginning .  OMG, thank god I can't eat those everyday.  Desert was on the house, cheesecake wonderful, the table was festive and gave my husband a birthday card.  So glad, there is one in Los Angeles because I'm going to visit again.   Great place to celebrate special occasions.

jk-z4-01etkIu2erXxFJsQ.text: Like a few others that reviewed this place, my girlfriend and I stopped in spontaneously after shopping at Caesars.  It appeared there was some special at the bar between 3:30-6:30 ish for $3.50 appetizers.   Sounded great and they were.  I had the mini kobe beef burgers and she had the crab cakes and both were PERFECT along with some delicious beers on tap. The bartender was EXCELLENT.  She established a friendly connection with us (much unlike the P.U.B. at the Aria) and she provided superb service.  If we were staying closer we would have gone there every day!

aj4zVoHqDUBP3_PHave-8A.text: I didn't realize that this was a conglomerate of other Palm restaurant...as the one in Dallas... Delectable appetizers: the calamari frittis of course and the generous crab meat cocktail... one sure to be try is their famous Hearts of Palm salad- an Agassi fave ;-) Of course their selection of fish , meat and pasta sure to cater to every -vore around... Warm friendly service :-)

Bqa4kpHPuoNANOV5yA_sGQ.text: 837 club customer service was the rudest person on the phone today. Love the restraunt but sure put a bitter taste in my mouth talking to her. I asked her if dropping my 837 club and Palms  was my only option and she said it was my option. Never ask to check my account.

5FBV2IWNUmqjcDSczZ7HPQ.text: LOUD!!! not a place for an intimate, candlelit dinner. This is a place for drunken carnivores.   I have been to The Palm three times now and I can safely say that I do not like their steaks. They promote simplicity but I think that they seriously discount flavor. The veal chop, on the other hand, was outstanding. It now gives me something to look forward to if I am drug in here (again) against my will. The three cheese potatos were very good. The waiter was fully capable of handling seven drunk, hungry almost 50 year old men. You could tell this wasn't his first rodeo. Only gripe about the service was that when it was time for the check, he disappeared for about 10-15 minutes (why do waiters do that?).   If you want the testosterone fueled steak experience, this is your place. Upturned face.

h1K8F-YE_x_Rk3N7ZKTXVg.text: This was a perfect experience. Everything about it was just awesome!   We had the best waitress, as well as all the other support and management staff being excellent and fantastic food in a perfect setting.   I prefer The Palm to upscale steakhouses. It feels a bit less like the kind of place a bunch of dudes with bravado and too much testosterone go to have big steaks and talk about all their money, cars and pretend women. Something about it is a bit more muted and the vibe is just right.   The initial basket of bread is excellent- I love the raisin bread. Also, through September, they are offering 50% off wine bottles on Sundays. Quite a good deal! I was in the mood for an incredible burger of all things and decided to go for it and it was the real deal. Fantastic! The manager came over and shared what cuts of meat go into it and made sure we were having a good time. We also had crab cakes and the wild mushrooms. Everything tasted great and the 50% off wine was a great and unexpected addition to a great meal.   Definitely worth your time if you are looking for an intimate and relaxing version of the steakhouse type experience.

ueZLMsNp1Ym1UsgTXtGofg.text: In town for business, friends and I decided we wanted a good steak dinner.  We were very happy with the Palm  Excellent service, excellent food. I got the bone-in rib eye and it was just right.   Recommend it for anyone that's looking for a place to bring a group or even a companion.

y31wjJjWKJztGAeQeTR-Yg.text: The Palm has been a secret amongst Las Vegans for years, the pri fix power lunch will beat any steakhouse lunch out there. One of the few open for lunch, but since it's in the forum shops it has to be. Order the 15.95 lunch and you can choose from a small steak or piece of fish, and a couple other items and with it you get potatoes as a side and veggies and coffee at the end. Add a glass of wine and for under $25 bucks you have the most decadent lunch.  I have not been here for dinner, but sitting inside with a friend having a long lunch is one of my favorite things to do at Ceasers. The staff is incredible and made a lunch with my mom extra special not too long ago. Two thumbs up, and I will continue to go again and again to this place!

6bNdRgyD7QJNn1Jm0eAOgQ.text: Three and a half stars for The Palm.  I met my wife here for lunch one afternoon while in Vegas for my conference.  This restaurant is located right inside the Forum Shops via the Caesar's Palace casino.  This is a chain restaurant that we've been to before when we were in LA, so we thought we'd give it a shot in Vegas.  The Palm is a steakhouse, but they do offer several other things.  We were some of the first people to arrive, so we got a nice spot outside the restaurant where we could people watch.  It's a fairly pricey restaurant for lunch, so if you're dining on a budget you may want to skip this place.  My wife and I both ordered the prix fixe lunch.  It came with salad or soup, entree, and a dessert for around $26 per person.  We both ordered the Caesar salad, mine was pretty good, but my wife had some brown lettuce in hers, so that was a bummer.  For our entrees, I ordered the two 4 ounce filet medallions, while my wife got the salmon.  I thought both were quite good.  For dessert my wife got the flourless chocolate cake, while I got the cheesecake with raspberry sauce.  Again, these were a very nice portion and were good.  All in all, there wasn't much to complain about.  Our service was good and we were in and out of here in less than an hour.  As I said before, it's a little pricey for lunch, but then again, so is just about everything in Vegas.

bY3KcRCLs5irCanVUsSwpg.text: Had an excellent dinner last night!! I could have made a meal out of the bacon wrapped scallops!!! The NY Strip steak was cooked perfectly, I could have cut it with a butter knife, Wait staff was very attentive and courteous!!!

bFXAGHp72NAHGi0BjW8K3g.text: Myself and 4 coworkers had lunch here last week (July 2013). Four of us had salads and one had a chicken sandwich (and the wrong one from what he ordered).  He ended up being the lucky one because after over a one hour wait for our food, the next day the four of us with the salads all came down with terrible cases of food poisoning.  This lunch was Thursday, we all are finally feeling about back to normal on Tuesday!  I will never be back.

tHh_9SUilbr-fBiW9yk9MQ.text: So overpriced and unsatisfying.    Believe me, there are so many better things to blow your money on in Vegas than on the Palm's average food, mediocre wine and inattentive service.     We ordered the mixed greens salad with a painful amount of vinegar.  We both got the 9 oz filet mignon.  Both were supposed to be medium rare, but mine came out dry and medium well.  I was dying for steak sauce to give it some flavor, but thought it might be rude to ask.    We paid an insane amount for wine that probably cost no more than $8 at the store (at least that's what it tasted like).    Next time we'll hold out for Nero's.

c0KkKAVk4GjHWDmLjsPvXQ.text: Attending the National Concierge Association Conference and was impressed with the service delivery and the attention to detail. The service - spectacular. The cuisine - stellar. Go here if you want the best of both.

ba4G7bppZYm_FXpeKrxECQ.text: I would give three and a half stars if possible. This place is has good food and good service. I had a fillet, wedge salad, goat cheese mashed potatoes,creamed spinach ,hash brown and donuts for desert. All were good but not exceptional. I would definitely  go here again but mostly for convenience of being close to the Colosseum.

EqVBWP7IO_0kmJSGwjtv5Q.text: Good food. Great service. Restaurant was a little loud. We have eaten here a few times through the years and they always get it right. Location is not the fanciest on the strip.

7Mg2c_5TA9qkMWl2Ckc33g.text: Last night a group of my friends went to what will become an annual tradition, the Summer Lobster special. The special for two includes 4lbs of lobster, a starter and two sides for $99. Great food, great deal. I'm sure others will comment on the food quality (excellent), but I  must compliment our server, "Izzy" and his team. They were amazing. I've  eaten around the world and this was top notch, well worth the price. Run to get this special before the end of the month and try to get one of Izzy's tables.

CqJU-_afcFB0G7_wAZMc8A.text: Excellent dinner here.  Little pricey but it was worth it.  They took us right in while Nero's wanted a 45 minute wait.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

j-9X_GVjItaOTx_tf6pS5w.text: Felt like I was eating in a Mall Restaurant.  Service was fine but food doesn't compare to any of the steak restaurants at the Venetian.

qmrZBZX_CUuWznVI9FqSww.text: You'll never have a bad meal at the Palm. It's rock solid. However, when in Vegas, I want something to thrill me. Stroke me. Let me feel revel in my debauchery to the fullest of my ability. Turns out the Palm is just stuffy. No eye candy. Just meat. Which is fine when I'm home but not when I'm dressed up trying to get into some trouble.

bQrZhPvuB86DUWikJcf1IQ.text: OMG!  My brother and I went there for dinner one evening.  We were having a bad day and were very cranky.  After receiving our steaks, we started to complain that all you get on the plate is the steak.  No decoration, sides sold separately, nothing great.    As we are complaining, we bit into our steaks and an E.F. Hutton moment overtook us.  From "I hate this place" to "This is one of the best steaks we've ever had, EVER!"  I can't say enough how great it was.  I like the location since it's near the forum shops as well as the casino.  Stop there for dinner when you plan your trip.

mPbDyOsg8obnpZ3T0aYUYg.text: F-- avoritest dining spot in Vegas. I-- wasn't expecting to like this place as much as I did. V-- ery impressed with our waiter Coyote. He's Fabulous! E-- xperienced top notch service  S-- o, I ordered the lobster to share. It was 4 lbs and so yum! T-- hey gave us lobster bisque soup samplers which were good A-- te tons of their bread pre- dinner. It was so yummy. R-- eally liked our 'bus girl' who tied bibs around our necks! S-- uper great service. We mentioned we were tired but still wanted to hit up a club.  The waitstaff brought us out free espressos with rock candy sugar to keep us awake. Could not have asked for a better meal.

r6awxW6RpXv3-oSEs1r2Zg.text: Yes since we were staying at Caesar's Palace this restaurant is located in the shops downstairs. Thank goodness our party picked this restaurant as the thought of walking in heels to another hotel was frightening.   No doubt this restaurant is consistently good with excellent service. We were a group of twelve, our table was set up in the back dining room. From the moment we sat, the service and attention we received was outstanding. What I love about this place so much no matter what city you are in, although it is a high end restaurant, the waiters are not snobby or uptight. The total opposite, they are funny, knowledgeable, and a True delight!   They were running a special for two people which was Lobster with two sides. Everyone at our table nibbled on calamari and other appetizers. I was busy socializing and drinking Honig Cabernet Sauvignon. Great little Cabernet Sauvignon for the price. I adored our waiter who realized very quickly I was enjoying the wine the most. He never ever let my glass get below half. Who really knows how many b bottle's I myself had because it was a very very long dinner. We were there over three hours. whew, yes I needed to drink.   Hubby realized he better get some food in me quickly. Our lobster arrived with a side of spinach and mashed potatoes. Hubby took my shell off for me so I could enjoy my lobster. I am not a huge fan of lobster, can take it or leave it but wow this was amazing. It melted in your mouth with a sweetness of pure delight. It was one of the best lobster's I ever ate. Yeah, they made me a fan of it. Everyone at our table enjoyed their entrees very much, some of the steak dishes made me a bit jealous.   My sister and her husband were dining on the other side of the restaurant and they asked their waiter to play a trick on me. It was comical and he did a great job playing along because again these waiter's are a blast.   From the moment we arrived and had a few drinks at the bar with friendly bartender's, the food was awesome, service impeccable, this is a must visit if looking for a great quality restaurant. At least you get consistent great food and service unlike a couple of other high end restaurants in Vegas that are a ripoff.   Much thanks for a great evening, you were all wonderful. Highly recommend.

-Ppb7ReTsiV4BwzgGBnHTg.text: We made reservations through open table on the yelp mobile app. No issues, we were seated right away. Unfortunately, I made the reservation for 7:00 and then we ended up eating lunch around 3:00, so we weren't very hungry when we sat down for dinner. Everything was so good, I wish I had room for more sides or maybe a dessert.  I ordered the 14oz filet even though I didn't think I could eat it because it was only about four bucks more than the 9oz. It was huge. No way was that thing under a full lb. I ordered it medium expecting a perfect mid rare and that's exactly what I got. Tender, juicy, and delicious. It ranks up there with the best steaks I've ever had. At just under $50, it was almost a bargain when you consider that you normally pay $30 for a filet half the size. The sides are served family style, and the only one we tried was the au gratin potatoes. They were the best I've ever had.  Service was excellent. Friendly, fast, and very professional. I'd be happy to come back to this restaurant.

Q1pW0CP4ULiPYql1eaav-A.text: I've been here many times in NYC.    Expected way more. NI got a salad it was pretty good except for the soggy tomatoes and chicken I had to put to the side. It was dry and tasteless.  For a place that prides itself on excellent service. The waiter could have inquired about the pile of chicken on side and ask if he could get us something else.  Someone else had salmon filet and sent it back to kitchen for the fishy taste.    I expected more.   Perhaps next time I'll stick to shrimp that originally came or steak.

1YMPMdPGm-sbzHK9E510_w.text: Fantastic restaraunt.  Attentive and friendly service.    Great food (like a prix fixe lunch for $25 with ample beef filet perfectly cooked and seasoned and a massive cheese cake desert that I couldn't even start at lunch because of all of the food with the first 2 courses).  Looking forward to future shopping trips to the Forum Shops so I can work in another lunch.  Even though they are connected to a fancy restaurant group - this place realizes its in a mall and keeps a relaxed atmosphere - come as you are and enjoy a nice meal.

gag2IlLDk34HwluHv7GI7Q.text: Filet mignon and a side of creamed spinach is all you need with s nice glass of merlot .. NUFF SAID :)

oBYt5Q66Jb2c3sCrVGUY1Q.text: Ok, so what do you do if you have girls in a group and they like to shop for Prado and LV and random lipsticks that have 1 color only, yet takes 45 minutes to get that lipstick....well you get a brew here at the Palm Restaurant in the The Forum Shops in Caesars Palace. (just kidding ladies)  Yah, definitely it kills the time to have a nice cold Sam Adams or any other choice for that matter. Great ambiance too. It's a dark bar here, no purses, or shoes or lipsticks on sale here. Just food and drink.  It's a little pricey, about $9 a pint, but hey, I would rather pay the $9 pint so I can sit down and not think...really...not think for a bit. I mean there might be random distractions in the restaurant but nothing to swerve you from your non-thinking.  I also like the random caricatures on the walls. Not sure what it means, maybe if you eat here long enough, you do get a caricature of yourself there as well. Who knows, but it did provide me the entertainment during my non-thinking moments.

eUbayiZmepQUV8wq0KKddw.text: The Lobster Bisque has a new classy presentation. The bowl is placed in front of you with lobster chunks and creme fraiche in the middle. Your server pours the hot bisque in a swirling motion around the lobster centerpiece and fills the bowl. The bisque is velvety smooth with a rich, hearty flavor of lobster. The creme fraiche makes the bisque creamy and luscious. Add a couple of grinds of fresh ground pepper and you're good to go. Thumbs up, way up!  The 18 oz. New York strip was cooked to a perfect rare and had optimum seasoning. Its juiciness and char-grilled crust really seals the deal. The lobster tails were cooked to perfection, succulent, and sweet. The drawn butter brought even more sweetness out of each tasty morsel. Thumbs up, way up!  The Brussels Sprouts were perfectly cooked. But it was a little too heavy on the lemon. It definitely needs to be toned down a bit or else sprinkle lemon zest on top for a nice zing.    The French fries are topped with parmesan and garlic. These fries are da bomb! It's made with fresh cut potatoes with a light, crispy outside and tender inside with a hint of kettle chip flavor. The parmesan garlic seasoning is perfect. Ask your server for a side of ranch dressing and you're set. Their ranch dressing is so good! Thumbs up, way up!

DLJVhHlFu7W9P4zgam4eFQ.text: Food was good. Standard for a high end steak house. Nothing overly special to make our $300 bill worth it. Service was ok - could have been better. Waiter ignored us most of the night but when it came time to deliver the bill he was overly friendly. Feeling guilty and working the tip.

6EKAysol03OHIRZ6jkDInw.text: I like their outdoor patio for people watching in the Forum Shops.  Tony gave us warm & genuine service for lunch.  And i thought the power lunch which inclued Filet Medallions with peppers & onions, some Cottage Fries, a Caesar & Key Lime for $26 is an amazing value.  Only problem is steak was ok, Caesar was overdressed, and Key Lime was not good.  Too bad.  Will not be returning.

HihTQeVkOadiIP7aQbs34A.text: Worst wagyu beef I've ever had - the meat was fatty and bright pink (I had ordered medium).  I would've said something to the waiter but we were on a tight timeframe. Thankfully, the chocolate cake was huge and very good.

-J3NnNGIQlIStlaAKF30Sw.text: The food is good but the noise level is deafening. Impossible to hold any sort of conversation!  I won't come back.

kCz1qDIA85J3da1KnZweng.text: As per usual the food was spectacular!  Located inside Cesars Palace, this is an excellent place to enjoy a meal and people watch in Vegas.   The staff are fun and personable (not stuffy like some fine dining restaurants). They willing sat us right away once we learned that some of our party would not make it.   For an appetizer I had the ahi tuna with seaweed salad. The tuna was seared beautifully and the salad was very tasty.  For my main entree I had bone-in ribeye (its huge) cooked medium rare with no added sauces. This was BY FAR the best steak I have ever had. The Palm just knows what they are doing. Add a side of brussels sprouts and I was set.

4waHKdz-I2yI2TV6iRTL5g.text: We could not get reservations to any restaurant we wanted to go to, so we decided to go shopping!  Palms was the first restaurant we saw entering the Forum.  I love eating at this restaurant in NY, so we figured we couldn't go wrong with this choice.  The only thing was would we be able to get a reservation and YAY!!! we did!  We returned here and we were 30 minutes late (my fault, SUE ME i'm a girl)  We waited 5-10 minutes, and were finally seated.  We were stressing out since we had to be at the ABSINTHE tent at 9:30 and it was already a little past 8.  As soon as the waited came to the table, i got straight to the point.  I told him listen, we're on a time schedule and we need you to work with us.  He understood and can I tell you, he did an absolutely AWESOME JOB.  Isreal = best waiter EVER!!!!! and he even gave us his card since we had to skip on dessert and said next time dessert was on him.  How freaking cool is that. :)  We started off with 2 stoli elit martinis, and ordered a bottle of pinot noir.  The waited used a decanter, I was pretty impressed.  We ordered the shrimp cocktails, and clams casino for the appetizers.  The shrimp cocktail NEEDS the horseradish inside the cocktail sauce....seriously was freaking AMAZING!!!!!  The clams casino had the bacon on the side, I thought it was amusing that not 1 had a piece of bacon on top of it.  (def didn't bother me)  and I went along and dipped my bread in the sauce (yummmmmmmmay)  I stuck to the good old 3 lb. lobster.  and we ordered asparagus for the side.  The girl who helped de claw the lobster also pulled the tail out so I had nothing to do, which was excellent bc i was NOT dressed to be pulling out no lobster tail.  He ordered the rib eye medium w/ a baked potato.  You didn't need any type of sauce or extras bc the steak was perfectly cooked.  Overall, the food was pretty perfect and the service was EVER BETTER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I would say this experience was better than the one i've had in NY.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3lb lobster
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pinot noir
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp cocktail

coThHvyc0jUIN65btmKXKw.text: Went with my wife to have happy hour drinks and appetizers. Our waiter just wasn't good. He didn't write down the order, so of course, he got it wrong. He seems to have all the time in the world to chit chat with us (even though we really didn't want to talk to him), but when it came time to take an order, see how we were doing, or correct his mistake, he always had to rush off.  Maybe if you are spending $100/person on dinner you get better service, but we will be avoiding the Palm in the future.

33ZydTnjLjsdYqSAFcSr-g.text: Steak way overcooked. Karlos the server was a first-class upseller; WOW what a talent he is at trying to get me to order a $20 shrimp cocktail.  He forgot to put the calamari, in; announced steaks coming out in a sec, then remembered calamari, and had steaks under heat lamp. All were overdone and for $52 per, it was a problem.  Very overpriced.

10ypBOjvWFOJvVJCDVHPiw.text: Yes another steakhouse review, how can I resist?  The atmosphere is typical old school steakhouse, wood floors, hard wood chairs, etc. I'm kind of done with this but oh well. We had reservations for Del Friscos but had to switch to the Palm due to a scheduling conflict. Del  Friscos atmosphere is more gentlemen's club, polar opposite of the Palm.  Once our whole party arrived we outgrew our table. They were able to move us to a larger table on the spot.  The service was very attentive to start but as the place filled up it became a bit less attentive. The appetizers arrived very quickly but the pause for the entrees was about 25 minutes.  When the steaks arrived they were cooked as ordered and very good albeit wet aged as I prefer dry. Wine selection worked well and we had a reasonably priced Malbec, actually many of them.  There are so many steakhouses in Las Vegas even multiple ones in the same hotel. I would probably skip this one and try another or just go back to Del Friscos.

OB9xrp8rX-IhBR3vNtLXug.text: Great service horrible food lobster was a bouncy ball and steak had the texture of Plato

cTUEjAf0KzAIMT_z_uNypQ.text: Our favorite steakhouse along with stk but completely different. The Palm is more traditional NY style cuisine and atmosphere. Great food and great service in a classy atmosphere. Gigi salad, shrimp Bruno, clams casino, are all excellent. My NY strip is the star. Best ny I've probly ever had. We shared a grilled 3lb lobster which was also amazing. Martini w blue cz olives yumm. Only thing I'd like to see added is a new trendy homemade steak sauce like some of the other trendy places in town. Awesome bar, great place to start w a cocktail before sitting. Derrick the bartender is awesome, been there since the place opened. Def be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gigi salad and martini w bleu cz olives yumm!

HbP6a2UpBSSASC5T6vG2Zw.text: Actually one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas. We came in for lunch. Seated promptly. Our server was very nice but also formal. I had their burger and my husband had the philly cheese steak. I loved their bread that they bring out before your food. We both liked our food. My burger was my favorite, fresh and abundant in meat. Descent lunch for about $45 including tip. The restaurant is on point! No wonder they have been around for a while. Says a lot about their quality of food and service. Unlike the new restaurants in Vegas who screams for attention with their overpriced mediocre food, Palms restaurant is one of the old school restaurant who everyone needs to follow. Thank you Palms! I had such a great lunch!

XvMJlQDkCgFuAnTbAjRanw.text: By far, hands down this is ONE of our FAVORITE restaurants in Vegas. The atmosphere is friendly, the servers Dutch and Ms. Lynn always take really good care of us. And the food is always incredible. We're members of the 837 Club so we enjoy the specials year round. The lobster dinner for 2 is the BOMB! Have cocktails at the bar with Kelly. Very fun! Makes an evening out with friends and/or clients memorable.

-IGDwrnCKNn3nlVJrJN6nA.text: This place is outstanding! Very convenient inside the forum shops at Caesar's.  We enjoyed the special 2 lobster tails 2 sides and 2 starters-$89!!!!!  I had the lobster bisque - absolutely delish! Our sides were the half and half....half homemade potato chips & half thinest onion rings ever, cooked perfectly, plus our second side was mashed potatoes with goat cheese- I say wowsa! Terrific service too! What more can you ask for from a top Vegas restaurant! Important note - you will most likely have leftovers - if you take a to go bag and are attending a concert at Caesar's, they will not allow you to take the food in. They check inside your purses too. It must be hidden in your coat, sock, bra whatever! Just wanted you to know so you don't get disappointed!

J2briCnIocwIuRdIlOVn1g.text: Having been here before with very positive experiences I took a friend out to dinner for her birthday for whom it was her fist visit to Palm. The dinner started well and we ordered cocktails with both of us deciding on an appitizer, filets cooked medium rare and some sides. When the food arrived everything looked great and my filet was perfect. My firend's filet was overcooked to more of a medium well. Disappointed for her, I suggested we tell the server and send it back but she insisted didnt want to ruin dinner. I suggested a few more times but I also noticed the server did not check on us through dinner. My friend mentioned she will just give feedback since they should know at least know there was a problem. Well after we were finished, the server finally came to the table to ask if we wanted desert. I had let Palm know of the occasion in advance and at this point my friend proceeded to politely let her know that her steak had been overcooked and a bit dry. The server asked if she wanted another steak and of course the answer was no as my friend did eat most of the filet and clarified that she just wanted to let her know. I was hoping at this point that the birthday desert done at Palm would salvage the experience. The server left the desert menu with us but shortly returned with the check stating that since there was a problem with the filet, they removed the charge in lieu of her birthday desert. ???? First of all my friend didn't even know about the desert since she had not been there before. Second, we didnt ask for anything to be done and they should have asked if that was what we wanted. We didnt even elude to a credit request. Essentially, feedback was provided and the message to us as customers was to leave.   How horribly rude of Palm and also very embarrassing for me since I recommended the establishment.   Being locals to Vegas and having plenty of favorite spots and first class service restaraunts in the area, we will not be back. We will be sure to steer recommendations of friends, travelers, business associates and family elsewhere.   Shame on Palm for clearly showing that your customers do not matter.

i_DvPrGyqQoIcC_wA2zyfQ.text: I only ate lunch here and perhaps I would have experienced something different if not elevated.  Having said that, the Palm was good.  It is located inside the Caesar's Forum Shops and has that outside cafe feel due to the wonderful mall design.  The staff was extremely helpful and friendly.  I probably need to return to get a steak.

NR8qmfMmR9O1VH-32nGrcw.text: Overall:  The steak is cooked nicely and the wild mushrooms side dish was delicious.  It's a chill, old-school style steakhouse to hang in, and very casual.  Although I've personally had a better experience in other steakhouses, Palm Restaurant still has its own character and provides a finely cooked steak.  I'd still come to this restaurant if a friend wanted to go, but I wouldn't recommend this place to others.  NOTE: My friend and I came here because we had the Amex $50 gift card which basically gave us a free steak.  I still consider overall value (price paid vs food & service received) from the total check price.    Setting: Spontaneous dinner to take advantage of the $50 Palm Restaurant gift card from Amex, Monday 08/29/2011.  Thumbs Up: Filet Mignon, cooked medium (chef cooks the steak to perfection).  Wild mushrooms side dish was delicious.  Thumbs Down:  Service staff not knowledgeable about the pairing the wines w/ their steak.  A merlot was recommended that tasted bleh w/ the Filet Oscar, but good w/ the wild mushrooms.  Black peppercorn sauce is not worth it, as it tastes just like spicy brown gravy.  DO NOT get the Half and Half side dish (basically potato chips and shoestring onion rings) because they don't cook it well - oil wasn't hot enough so the chips and onions basically absorbed too much of the oil, making it taste extremely greasy.  Creme brulee is too thick for my taste and the burnt top was too thick.  Tip: They offer a lifetime club for $25, but you get it back as a gift card.  It's worth it if you like to frequent this place.

pNBh2x3rfUe9FXH3FgdBdQ.text: We LOVE The Palm and LOVE JR as our server!!  We always order lobster, as it is the BEST in town!  The service is outstanding, JR treats us like royalty and the food is sooo good.  Since we frequently this restaurant at least 4 times per year, we decided to sign up for the 837 Club, which gives you points and $$ to spend on your birthday.  We cannot say enough great things about The Palm AND JR.

dDDlYp8KZrzCGvZSuTlz2Q.text: You can't really go wrong when you walk into a restaurant order a beautiful bottle of peppery Zinfandel and a decadent meal with all your favorite things.  I was dazzled with my dinner choice comprised of a petite file mignon topped with crab, drizzled with a crab mignonette cream, goat cheese whipped potatoes, asparagus fritti, sauteed wild mushrooms, and brussel sprouts sauteed in pancetta, lemon, and browned butter.  Not to mention that I had the best key lime pie yet! Simply flavorful, simply quality, and simply a great choice to satisfy my craving for steak.  Hats off to the Palm!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wild mushrooms and asparagus fritti
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petit file mignonette topped with crab paired with goat cheese whipped potatoes
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

P4pWuoZx6Nj9WE1-O0TfVg.text: I ate the most amazing 5 lb broiled lobster along with a nice cut of filet mignon. Oh my gosh.  I highly recommend it to anyone that has a taste for fine food!

RtIkT9rDH0SARAa8HpxALQ.text: Stopped in last minute for a lobster.  As always Larry had a table for us.  Usually we ask for Dutch but he was off tonight.  Larry sat us with Israel. Izzy as he is known.  Great service and great meal.  Ask for Izzy next time you are there.

7x1CqVaNgQio5ijPZl5IPw.text: My coworkers and I went here for dinner. We had the filet mignon and ribeye. They were both cooked perfectly and had great flavor. We also had the family style sides lobster mac & cheese, potatoes and broccoli. They were all very good. My wife and I will be back in a few weeks and we will be eating here.

5w1YL8J39cszi32iK3SELg.text: 3.5 stars...but I bumped this up a half star because of the impeccable service I received when I came here with my brother.  Our waiter was fantastic at being both personable and attentive without being obtrusive. He explained things clearly and even made small talk.  We walked in after scouting around the Forum Shoppes for a not-very crowded restaurant, but also one where we could sit and talk for a while because we were waiting for our parents to get out of the Celine Dion show.  It had a nice old-school steakhouse feel with dimmed lights and deep mahogany, but also had some cartoon caricatures on the wall for fun.   As for the food, I was semi-impressed.  First off, the drinks looked impressive, but overall were just expensive.  It was $3 for a little glass bottle of Coca-cola! Cute.....but pricey.  My brother ordered the Chicken Parmesean (which was HUGE....like the size of my head!) with a side of Spaghetti Marinara.  The chicken and pasta were pretty good! Unfortunately, since I had a much smaller appetite, I decided to order two appetizers instead of a full meal.  Big mistake! While the portions were outrageously large, the food I ordered was just mediocre.  I had a Caprese Salad (which featured 3 HUGE super thick slices of bland flavorless tomatoes topped with big gobs of also flavorless mozerella cheese and no basil in sight) and the Calamari (nicely battered, but a little over-seasoned).

tPWcWT2m2vjHNl4Et5F6Iw.text: I still try to re-create the West Coast Gigi salad on a weekly basis; succulent shrimp, avocado... it's heavenly. Branzino entree, mmmmmmmmm. Seafood cooked to PERFECTION.  Use your expense account -- VERY expensive for the quantity and types of food that are on the menu. It's like a Gucci bag, you're paying for the name. Can definitely get the same thing for the same quality for much cheaper at a better looking place.... but cmon, it's The Palm! Barry the waiter in Vegas is great, a legend.

035oJ2pu3A3P0gey326sFw.text: Warm, attentive service, and tasty thoughtfully plated dishes.  Robert, our server was professional but funny, charming and personable.  We felt comfortable and thoroughly enjoyed our dining experience.  Great value, especially considering the area.  We'll be back next time we're in Vegas!

09E6ASCZ5cpxK5QCF6k4Fw.text: The service was quick and satisfactory. I order a swordfish steak that was dry and no flavor. I believe they can do a better job with the seafood.

tO0NZoyMiY-CdG83akSJ1w.text: While in Vegas I always stop here. The type of wine and items that I order from the menu vary depending if I am winning at blackjack or not :) The spinach dip is insanely delicious and comes with a variety of breads for dipping. The service is always top notch and I like that I can get very dressed up, or roll in with jeans. The 1 near Staples Center is not as good in my opinion. I just stick with Vegas baby!

ZS8j1pI6LgA0Nojv5nfqUQ.text: My group had a great time. Our waiter, Barry, was amazing. Knew about everything on the menu well and made excellent recommendations. He even took our group outside to take a picture, which turned out perfect. The steaks were thick and cooked perfectly. I had the strawberry fields cocktail and it was light and refreshing. Would definitely go back.

R54yOw4GrBBbPxIEKuy67A.text: Just great.  I had surf and turf and both the filet and lobster tail were succulent.  Had a Caesar salad as an app and it too was good.  Wife had chicken fingers from the lite bite menu, great as well.  Shared an order of half and half, also great.  Service was friendly and efficient.  Really couldn't ask for more.

_hINX5Tab0B4bHtJYUFP3A.text: Food:  2 Star Service: 2 Star Ambience: 3 Star  As a Palm "frequent diner Club" member, I have to say this is probably the worst meal I've had at any Palm, and it does pain me to say that.  Greet times at the hostess station and at our table were slow for a late lunch (1:30 on Memorial Day Monday).  We ended up sitting "outside" in the Caesar's promenade area because there was a larger party just breaking up inside.  Only four other tables on the patio.  There was just an overall lack of energy, lack of enthusiasm, lack of attentiveness, which is quite unusual for a Palm.  Maybe after a long Holiday weekend everyone's energy level was a bit down.  We went with the Businessman's Lunch special -- my usual go-to meal option.  The Lobster Bisque was beyond salty.  I mentioned it to the server, and she offered to replace it.  I didn't want to bother at that point, so I kind of blew it off (not knowing what was to come).  Had I known, I would have send it back & requested a salad.  Ended up drinking 3 - 4 glasses of water to compensate for the LV parched air and the saltiness in the bisque.  Second course:  NY Strip steak -- both of us ordered med-rare.  Mine was cooked properly (it was a tad thicker than my hubby's) in the middle (edges were overdone), but no flavor and had a mealy consistency.  Hubby sent his back once, and should have sent it back a second time.  Poorly cooked, poorly seasoned, unimpressive steaks.  We each ate less than half of our steaks after picking through them & trying to find more tender tasty bits.  Definitely the worst steaks I've ever had a high-end steak house -- maybe the leftovers on the holiday Monday?  Server ended up talking (and talking and talking . . . ) to the table next to us about a common interest while we were sitting there with obviously "finished" plates, and we waited for our plates to be cleared . . . .and waited to order our desserts ("to go" because we were fed up)  . . . . and waited for our check  . . . . and waited for its return.  FWIW - the key lime pie was nice, but the cheesecake was spot-on as usual!  We took them with us back to the Bellagio & ate them in the Sports Book while watching day baseball.  That was the best part of the meal, even though we had to bum silverware from the bar in the Sports Book because our server hadn't put any silver, napkins or the usual "to go" packets.  Overall, not an overwhelming experience.

bPt6yB48lULWcThDxjetGw.text: We had high expectations for this Palm restaurant because of the Vegas location. Sadly, our experience was mediocre at best.  The steaks were on the dry side, despite being cooked as requested (medium). We ordered goat cheese mashed potatoes but they gave us regular mashed that were on the cold side and stiff, like they had been sitting out for a long time. The server did offer to fix the potato order but we canceled before the fresh batch was brought out.   The energy and quality of the food is so much better at the DC Palm (and other locations, I'm sure).

P7AZH20Xqa0s7CNlhnWYAw.text: The business lunch special is an awesome price for a wonderful piece of steak. You can't beat paying less than $20 for a filet that would go for $40+ at dinnertime. The service at the Vegas location is beyond amazing. The wait staff are fabulous. I've also tried the lobster salad, which is also delicious if you're not in the mood for steak.

DA09_h0zB8_1uANdGNc_rA.text: When in Vegas you have to visit Caesar's and when you are there you should have a meal at The Palm. It is Vegas. It feels like Vegas should from the location to the food to the staff to the paintings of celebrities on the wall.  We (12 of us) started with fried calamari, a crab/shrimp/tuna and a BACON appetizer. All three excellent. After a few rounds of mojitos we started into the main course. I had the Bone-In Filet which was charred on the outside but cooked to a perfect medium. It was devine!  For desert we had donut holes. Trust me, try one!

ZD4Q9EpB6fTgsHHjJ5tUzQ.text: A good steakhouse located in the forum shoppes at Caesar's. The service here was top notch our waiter and servers were super cool. They were friendly and really personable. Helped us out with all our menu questions etc. I have been to quite a few Steakhouses in Vegas now, and the Palm was one I didn't know about to much.   Our experience was a great one though. Was here for the weekend to celebrate with family. The pricing is pretty standard for the filet Mignons, ribeyes, prime ribs etc. I ordered the Wagyu Bone In Ribeye ($60) medium well. The food does take a while to come out, but our server also did warn us ahead of time. All the sides are family style, enough to share with your party. The Ribeye I had was very delicious. Not too salty, cooked the way I ordered it. I prefer the bone-in for the Ribeye and it was good. My favorite side was the creamed spinach, it pairs well with the meat. I have to say give them a try. It's a low key spot that doesn't pop up first in yelp, but it is definitely an above average steakhouse. Food was a 4. Service was a 5. Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Juicy Wagyu Bone-In Ribeye! ( ^_^)b

SDbdeIrnqqmLhbMz_k4heA.text: I took my husband here for his birthday dinner.  We were pleasantly surprised how wonderful the food and service was. The restaurant is easy to get to as you come into the Forum Shops. It was cool to see all the members character portraits done on the walls. The waiter's name was Barry, and he was outstanding. He had a great personality, and very attentive to our needs. We started off with cocktails, then order crab and shrimp appetizer. It was delicious.  Our entrees were Steak & sea bass with sides of asparagus and the lobster mac & cheese. We tried the cheesecake for dessert. Every bite was tasty.  The wine list was amazing. All of my favorites.  I highly recommend The Palm Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

S-8f8SfIluawI7IOYejrJQ.text: For a weary traveler that needed a calm and friendly place to hole up for some work before hitting the town - THIS place was perfect!  Victor - the bartender behind the bar made me feel extremely comfortable in letting me just sit in a corner with my laptop open while I finished my customer interview call.   I only ordered the burger, but man was it juicy. Honestly surprised at the level of service and quality of food here.  Will not hesitate to go here again

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EmLwn7PGiQ9Pesj17oE5Iw.text: The Palm restaurant never disappoints. Whenever I need to meet clients for my web design company Lifestyles Media, The Palm restaurant is ALWAYS my go to spot. All the food here never disappoints, the service here is incredible, and I always leave satisfied. The Lobster is perfect every time and Michael always treats us like family. Whenever you find yourself in Vegas, I would highly recommend this place, you truly can't miss out. RJ Lifestyles Media Group (rj@lmgnow.com)

GKL9fJ0ubwAAxMN67qwSQQ.text: What can I say other than tres magnifique! The food! The service! The ambiance! The price - lunch special! A definite dining experience to be repeated. Did I say the food?! The breads are delightful, the steak was perfect, the kids could only eat half of their burgers, the chicken parmigiana was off the hook! Such attentive service from beginning to end! Thank you very much to the staff for a great afternoon.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eSM526jJFJ0QiIokk24dSA.text: My wife and I had dinner at The Palm last night. Their Summerfest Lobster Dinner. As usual, amazing. We were seated promptly per our reservation. We requested  waiter Ruan, and our request was granted.  The lobster was huge and succulent. We added a 12oz Filet. It was cooked perfect. Really delicious food. The manager seating us is a pleasure. He checked on us often. Our waiter  Ruan just makes the whole experience enhanced. He is attentive and makes you feel as if its his pleasure to make you have the best dining experience possible. A  great waiter! We cannot wait to go again to this fine restaurant.

bRHi72tNeVluLocpdTV7wg.text: I've been dining at The Palm since I was a child, my parents thankfully would take me with them. Always outstanding service and quality food.  If it's not broke...:) Over the years I've been a customer of their various locations: all NY locations, Orlando, Chicago, Boston, and Miami.  Yes, it's about time indeed I wrote a review. I will state this, I always order the baked clams oreganata and creamed spinach since I was a child. Decadent steaks, as well as delicious scallops and other seafood. All on The Palm menu are prepared impeccably. The service, old school- can't get better than the staff at The Palm. This location does have a 'patio', no not an outdoor one with a sky etc. however, this 'patio' is the Forum Shops.  Trust me, window shopping and people watching. The casino floor is in eyeshot;) Don't hesitate in the approaching New Year and deprive yourself. Simply go:)

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yz9TyxX_jV6khhttllZQXw.text: We were here in Las Vegas to visit family for the holidays.  Our anniversary is January 1, and since there are fewer places to go where we are living now, we decided to celebrate here. The Forum Shops  at Caesar's is also one of the first places we went when we first met so it was extra special to go back.  We haven't been to the Forum Shops in ages so we walked around and looked at all the shops. Things have changed a lot since we were here last. I was sad to see that FAO Schwartz closed but so many new shops have opened. It is a fun place to window shop. There are high end shops like Cartier, Tiffany and every clothing designer, it seemed, but they were almost all empty the night before Christmas Eve. Guess Santa did his shopping early. Though there was a bit of a crowd at a store that had Mike Tyson signing autographs. It was close to our reservation or I would have checked it out.   We made it back in time for our reservation although there weren't very many dining and some came in without reservations with no problems. They've remodeled and opened up the place to one big room. It used to be more closed in which also gave it an old time vibe (in a good way). The ambiance is still good, though not really as good as other Palms restaurants.   We had a nice comfy booth with a nice view of the passers by without being out on the patio to eat. We ordered drinks-I had a Prosecco and my husband had a Cabernet-and they were both very good. Our server, Tae, as well as the other staff, were very helpful and attentive.   They brought out a bread basket which had a good variety of breads-pretzel bread, Asiago baguette, pumpernickel and walnut (sweet, dense bread) and a white chocolate and toasted nut (which wasn't very sweet but had an amazing flavor). My husband loved the chewy pretzel bread and I loved loved the white chocolate-although all were wonderful.    They had a special appetizer with 3 of the chef's favorites. A crab cake, a bacon-wrapped scallop and a shrimp in a creamy mustard sauce. Our favorite was the crab cake which was mostly crab with just enough binder to hold it together. They were all delicious although I'm not a big fan of bacon-wrapped anything (I know) because it just overshadows the other but my husband liked it very much.   We both ordered the Maine lobster. They have 2,3 and even 4 pound lobsters. And for a side, we ordered the small (but still huge) half & half which is half house made potato chips and half shoestring onions. The lobster are very fresh with had amazing flavor and the half & half is delicious.   With the bread and appetizers, we were full and needed boxes to take home leftovers. Then they brought a big slice of New York Cheesecake with a sour cherry sauce and whipped cream for our anniversary. We couldn't not eat that so we ordered coffee and enjoyed. The cheesecake was very good. A perfectly dry and dense cheesecake which is my favorite kind. Such a nice touch.   The Palm is a perfect place to celebrate any special occasion as well as a great place just to go for spectacular food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You can judge a place by their bread. This is good!
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Anniversary.  This marks a table with an event.
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

sAcRIDnSfadRmx1uFCK9Gg.text: I eat at The Palm about 3 times a week. This is an amazing dining experience. I would suggest you sit in the patio and ask for JR's section. JR will take amazing care of you. The food and service is always awesome. The patio is the best people watching spot in Las Vegas. Friday and Saturday they have unbelievable great Prime Rib.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fillet and lobster

3Ywv-0APgHgkCzBknLniow.text: During conference my coworker and I decided a nice lazy meal was just the ticket.  I had the ahi and she the salmon. They were both amazing! The wine pairing suggestion was spot on!  Service was a above and beyond from calling for reservation, our server and the people filling water. Palm service is exceptional.   I will be sure to stop here whenever in Vegas and cannot wait to take my husband here. The only disappointment was we were too full to try any desserts. :).

EABfJelYohGFJaI_OZ5PMg.text: GREAT ribeye, ordered the 4 lb lobster as well. Manolo was our server and he was so nice and extremely attentive. We will definitely be back. This is one of our new favorite restaurants here in Vegas. We are in love. Thank you for the excellent service and food.

LLtarOyXlXmt9q_HTknEew.text: I've been going to The Palm Las Vegas for 25 years. It was always a favorite for special occasions and drinks.  Recently we went back after not having been in a few years. My entire family was disappointed. The service was actually wonderful but the food has taken a turn for the worse. We ordered a medium rare New York that came out medium, flavorless and stringy. Our green beans were over cooked seemed like a poorly executed afterthought. With so many great steak options in LV I doubt we will return.

M0v9WJG2Ho3ouSJ7AI0DFA.text: Located in the Forum Shops inside Cesars Palace. I will start with the spectacular and attentive service. My server was absolutely delightful. The food could have been awful and I wouldn't have cared. But that is not the case. The food is wonderful as well. Just see my picture of their bread basket, and you will see that they are not fooling around. This is well worth a special occasion or just a treat yo self event. Either way: Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Steakhouse Burger!
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Release The Kraken! It&#39;s The World Famous Lobster Bisque!
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Now That&#39;s What I Call A Bread Basket!

X0cr9PTWy7NB9pZlWPxFZA.text: I'm a Vegas local who dines on the strip every single weekend. Our dinner at The Palm is the worst experience I've ever had. This restaurant is advertised as fine dining, but this is not fine dining.  Examples of fine dining in the strip: Picasso, Twist, Le Cirque. The Palm comes nowhere close to these restaurants.   We made a reservation on Open Table. The hostess told us to wait because there were 3 parties "checked in" ahead of us. I have absolutely no problem with waiting, but I'm mentioning it because I've never experienced a wait with an open table reservation--especially not when the restaurant has at least 10 open tables (I counted). We were seated about 10-15 minutes after our reservation. Service was friendly but super slow and awkward. For example, our appetizer plates were removed BEFORE the order for our entree was taken. We sat with nothing on the table for a while. We had to ask for our waiter more than twice.   Food was equally disappointing. I had the baby kale salad. It was greasy, full of stems and flavorless, as the pine nuts and dried fruit all sat on bottom. For my entree, I ordered the 4lb lobster. Staff asked if I wanted help cracking it open. I said yes, and staff proceeded to crack my lobster for me WITH NO GLOVES. When I asked for a seafood fork, he pulled one out of his apron pocket- which was full of pens...  I don't understand how The Palm got so much wrong on this night. We will not be returning, but I hope they get it together for future diners.

Dib9Fs77l3nq-brEaH5vFA.text: It was a busy Saturday night for the Palm, there were many large groups and a very lively crowd at the bar, but my boyfriend and I got seated right away. Being that the Palm is our go-to when we are in Vegas we knew what we were going to order. Once we sat down we were greeted by a very lovely server who took our order, every 10 or so minutes she checked on us and apologized for the wait.   About an hour later, we finally got our meal, except our medium steak was rare, Luigi Perez, the Assistant manager then stepped in, deeply apologized and had the steak sent back for a quick re-fire. Unfortunately it still came back rare. Considering we were there to celebrate my boyfriends birthday, this was very upsetting to us.   Luigi was so determined to make our meal perfect, he stood in the kitchen until the steak and the sides came out perfect (which it did). And to top it off, the entire bill was on him! The meal started off quite rocky, but it was saved by Luigi and our fantastic server. Thank you both for all your efforts and for saving that very special night!

TBJidcUx-j37_5EHaEiMBQ.text: Let's start by saying this is probably above something I would choose on my own based on price range and the fact that I'm usually a simple "Meat & potatoes" kind of guy.  I was there as a guest of my generous employer, and I am glad to have experienced this establishment.   Now that that's off the table let's talk about what was on the table this restaurant was amazing.   Meat... 14 oz filet mignon Appetizer... thickly cut Maplewood bacon. Potatoes... augratin potatoes (also known as the potatoes of the gods?)  The Bread Basket had about four different kinds of bread. I only enjoyed the pretzel bun and the sourdough but they were both fresh, I could have been happy with just the appetizers, bread, and the cocktail but then they brought the full layout with potatoes and that gigantic fillet it was life changing!   The young lady next to me ordered surf and turf with a crab stuffed lobster that was over a foot long!  One of the boys that was with us ordered the seven layer cake and four of us ate from it had more than enough!  I visited on Halloween and it was sort of funny that I saw a guy dressed as Richard Petty going into the back room. I thought that was a great costume until I saw Richard Petty the next day at the SEMA show and realized it was really Richard Petty going into the back room!  My reviews always go back to the simple fact that I know we work real hard for her money and if I value and establishment it's because I feel like there was value provided.  If you're looking for that one spot to sum up your Vegas experience with a very nice meal and a great crowd make your reservations early!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner with my co-workers &amp; customers on Halloween

Tvf1Yvo7bxLq-1KziCRmZA.text: Hidden Gem within the Caesars Palace. At a conference last week we were looking for a new spot to have a nice dinner. The "hot spots" were all taken and we were in the area of Caesars'. With my trust app Yelp at hand I was able to find this place and it took us into the resort to hole in wall type of restaurant. We enjoyed some great cocktails and variety of bread-sticks to start off. The  waiter recommended the daily special of the Parmesan Veal Chop. We knew it was going to be a big meal when the waiter came by to extend the table out for us. WOOOW is all we could say the sheer size of it was incredible. The veal chop was not just a big portion but had excellent flavor. One of my favorite veal chops that I have tasted. A great spot in Vegas that is not well known but a very great place to enjoy! A must try is the Creamed Spinach a great side with any meal you choose.  Will try it again at my next Vegas business trip.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monkey Sour Mash

V5mYLRxhsANO3NvKUfi5gw.text: Had some time before a show so we grabbed a couple of appetizers at the bar.  The flavor was great and the bartender was very nice and attentive.  Definitely would do a sit down dinner there next time I go.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari was plentiful and just the right texture.
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster bisque was a little too creamy, but it had chunks of delicious lobster.
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Clams Casino was awesome!

JtUuKs7Ci8IVuxT74qD27A.text: The food, bomb! We had Pellegrino to hydrate while Tay went over the menu. Then, while selecting out lunch we picked out a wine and starter. Lunch was a two course power lunch that consisted of mushroom soup followed by a New York. Tay was beyond an amazing server!!! Her knowledge of the menu, restaurant history and customer service were enough to draw my partner and I in to be regulars if we didn't live in CA. The birthday spread she put together was great and followed by afternoon cocktails that started this vacation off perfectly!!! Thanks girl!!!

qYTHnGx1lN_16UVHbV5Scg.text: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our visit to this location of The Palm! It was NY meets LV, very comfortable and welcoming!  Just as our visits to other locations, this did not disappoint. Food was superior and service was excellent. We shared a lobster and a steak and all was cooked perfectly.  Don't hesitate to go! You'll love it!

DndNVgxhyjQmfB3IlsFX0A.text: Went here for celebrating late Christmas dinner but felt super awful about service. Every table had their breads from server, only us didn't get breads till we asked for the breads, the server, Lopez, replied you guys wanted some, would give you some. Well... Very uncomfortable to hear the answer from him, he should have served us breads before the meal.  Never ever come back this restaurant again!

EY5VmLLM5vcZXF5O-4RxYQ.text: Lobster has always been consistent. So yummy. I still have yet to actually try lobster from the east coast. My frenz tell me there's nothing like it.

W--MNtSik0qHZG5OryHVdQ.text: Not going to give a big review here.  The Palm is a chain restaurant, so it's sort of basic.  It's of a higher level chain than your Cheesecake Factory in that they have a smaller menu with better items.  They are mainly good for steaks and seafood.  For seafood, they have a 3 pound, 4, 5, and maybe even 6 pound lobster.  You may not find that at too many places.  The food is of good quality.  If you think of restaurants on a scale, and there is a line down the middle, I would say that The Palm is around the 75% range.  Not the greatest, but better than the median range.

J7CoJPLNN_lKf8AflYoZCw.text: Being from Philadelphia and eating at The Palm regularly, we were reluctant to head there while on vacation. Thankfully, we were wrong. The Palm was A+. Top 5 steak. Great venue and people watching. Lopez took care of us and was great. Put this in the Vegas rotation

PlX64YaIZtWopHmOFR3tjw.text: This was one of my grandpa's favorite places in the city- I really love coming here because the food is spectacular, and there is no real rival to it. Sometimes I even dream about it!

eXCjuHPu2_dNSusm4bJj6Q.text: The food is Delish and the staff is amazing....with the exception of the bar. unfortunately one of the bartenders rather flirt with the male customers than taking your order.   I am going on the rant about it because it has happened very OFTEN. I am annoyed that she ignores her customers at the bar when she is engaged in to flirting and conversation with a male customer, she wont even turn to see if a new customer has arrived to the bar.  Literally it will take her about 10 to 15 minutes for her to turn her head.  When she finaly decides to give you attention  if you are a lady she is not friendly at all...her attitude is bad. I dont think I shoul be screaming to try to her her attention after all is her job to be aware of new customers arriving.  She continues doing the same to the day.  I work at the mall and I eat there bery often now I just avoid the days she is there delivering poor service and making the restaurant look bad. I commented it with other people that frequently eat there surprisingly they have experienced the same treatment from the same lady. The mall work force is small and we all know eachother. People talk about the good the bad and the ugly.

3GDD2BRtKAm3Qn-P4uP4vA.text: This place deserves 5 stars!!  I had a reservation for 12 on a Friday night for my company holiday dinner.  Walking in, I noticed the place was a bit on the crowded side (not people crowded, but everything close together crowded).  I wish the restaurant was a bit bigger so there's a bit more walking space.  Anyway, on to the food!  Appetizers: - Calamari 2 orders:  Crispy, tasty, and perfect bite sized. - Crab Cakes 5 orders: AMAZING!! They don't bread it so it's all real crab.  The mango salsa and hollandaise sauce just makes it even more amazing!! At $14 for one it's a bit on the pricy side.  Entrees: - My main dish was the 9 oz. Filet mignon. Rare.  The meat literally melted in my mouth.  It was cooked to perfection.   - Salmon: Coworker ordered this as her main entree.  I didn't try it but she said it was tender and good. - Surf n turf:  Coworker ordered this and they brought out a huge tray with the lobster and steak.  The waiter cracks the lobster tableside!!  It was a generous amount too!!  Side items: - Goat Cheese Whipped Potatoes:  This went away quick!  It was just perfect.  The perfect amount of goat cheese and it was creamy and flavorful. - Asparagus Fritti: Typical steamed asparagus, complemented my filet nicely.  Deserts: - Bag of Warm Doughnuts:  They literally come out with these dougnuts in a bag and shake em for you.  Served with chocolate and raspberry sauce and whipped cream.  It was so good!! - Creme Brulee:  I'm a huge fan of creme brulee, and this did not disappoint! Served with various fruits.  Delicious!!  Throw in 6 bottles of wine and various drinks, our dinner experience was just fantastic.  Our waiter, Meemo (sp?) was great!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bag of doughnuts
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brulee
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon. Rare. Melted in my mouth

9xONLM3nZ15Jg3GMlI9sxw.text: I have always loved Palms since I was a kid, but I had the best experience this time. Our waiter was JR and he was AMAZING!! Seriously, sit outside and request him. He gives the best recommendations and knows how to take care of you! A table of six and we all got the Chilean Sea bass and ate every bite!!
