vefB0TdDHQpSqQTekAS7eA.text: This weekend we were in Vegas and the hubs wanted a steak.  There are a LOT of steak options in Vegas, but we came here because we were in The Forum Shops.   Our food was pretty standard for The Palm.  The hubs steak was BIG.   The server was a bit off.  I think this happens to us because we don't drink alcohol.  So it's basically, "Here's your food."  That's cool.  I get it.

4BmqJMkl5ATNZxBLVSscsg.text: Our waitress here was seriously so cute and sweet! Excellent service. Excellent food!   We both got petite filets with the creamed spinach and brussel sprouts. So good!   We got a bottle of Fogdog Pinot Noir that was the perfect compliment to our meal.   I definitely recommend this Palm; It's right in the Forum Shops. Such a yummy dinner before seeing Absinthe!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petite filet, creamed spinach, brussel sprouts.

IBWQ9d3zmdWZROzMzUOD6Q.text: Great food. Nice environment. Superb place to people watch. The staff was friendly. A little pricey but it's Vegas. Would recommend.

Et4t3aKhgUcqblE9xwPRiA.text: My new favorite restaurant in Las Vegas! Anxious to come back for another meal! Our waiter, TJ, was incredible- authentic, passionate about food- truly made our experience memorable. The food was also really great and the price was surprisingly low for what they have to offer! I may make a special trip from Atlanta just to eat dinner there when I'm really hungry and craving a juicy bone-in prime rib steak and lobster! The creamed corn was also out of this world! The Chilean sea bass was like butter in my mouth! I'm salivating just remembering all the deliciousness. Can't say enough good things about my experience here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A feast fit for royalty!
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-in Prime Rib, 4lb lobster, Chilean sea bass, creamed corn brûlée, garlic mashed potatoes- OUT OF THIS WORLD!!!!!!

99vH-F3NgDi5B-Uafh-BOQ.text: Wow.. Been to the palm many times and have been Impressed every visit. Lobster is the best I've had.... Anna..... Greatest server ever!!!! I'll be back

VG686DJUBbtz1JIjktxQYQ.text: I am writing this review due to the poor service my mother received at The Palm in the Forum Shops on Friday, Sept. 8th, 2017. She has been a loyal customer of your establishment for many years and has always received great service which is one of the main reasons she returns time and time again. But to her surprise, on above mentioned day she was at the receiving end of some very poor service. I feel it is important that you be aware of the behavior of one of your employees.   My mother, Elsy, travelled to Las Vegas from Matamoros, Mexico in order to celebrate her 66th birthday with her brother and sister. On the said date, she chose to have her birthday dinner at her favorite Las Vegas restaurant, The Palm. Unfortunately, she and her siblings were mistreated by a very rude waitress. Her disagreeable and antagonistic attitude was felt the second she greeted the group. My mother kindly asked her if the restaurant carried a "House Wine" and the waitress responded in the most antagonistic manner by asking: "What do you mean House Wine? Do you want red or white? Do want a bottle or a glass? I don't understand what you are saying." A lot of restaurants have some sort of "House Wine" on the menu and my mother innocently asked if The Palm offered one. The response from your employee was demeaning and made my mother feel like she was asking an absurd or nonsensical question. This is completely unacceptable and condescending behavior from your employee. My mother, furious and on the verge of tears, then said that they needed time to look through the wine menu. The waitress rolled her eyes and walked away. They would not see her for another 15 minutes. When the waitress returned she showed a severe lack of interest. My uncle proceeded to order a bottle of Marques de Caceres Gran Reserva. The waitress took the order, left and returned almost 20 minutes later with a bottle of Marques de Caceres Reserva (not the Grand Reserva that was ordered). My uncle told her that this was not the bottle they had ordered and she defiantly said that it was. By this point, all 3 guests were irritated by your employee and asked for a new server and to speak to the manager. She said she would tell the manager on duty, Kellie, to come by the table. Twenty minutes passed and no one had been by their table. They finally decided to leave the restaurant.   One of your bussers (possibly another server) approached the group as she could see that they were all visibly outraged and had been disrespected. She notified my mother that the Manager on Duty was a lady by the name of Kellie Endraske and that she should approach her and tell her what she had experienced. The Manager was at the Front Desk greeting other customers. She was attentive to my mother's complaint and told her to please write her an email. My mother does not have an email so she kindly asked me to write one on her behalf. I sent an email to Kellie and the General Manager Lawrence Close on Sept. 14th. I did not hear back from either of them. I sent a follow up email on Sept. 21st and have heard nothing. I understand that this mishap occurred on a Friday night and your restaurant must have been very busy. I too am in the restaurant industry and know this from experience. However, this was her birthday dinner and you asked the Manager on Duty asked my mother to "write you an email". If I was in her shoes, I would have asked them to stay at their table and told them they would be sending a new server. My mother might not have been clear when she spoke to the manager, but she wanted to stay and celebrate with her family at The Palm. They did not give her this choice. She did not want any comps. She just wanted a welcoming and friendly server.   My mother was humiliated, ignored and mistreated on the evening of her 66th birthday.  I am appalled to hear that your waitress portrayed a large amount of incompetence and a terrible attitude towards my family. I request you to kindly investigate and take action against her. I trust this is not the way The Palm wishes to conduct business with valued customers. I would welcome the opportunity to discuss matters further and to learn of how you propose to prevent a similar situation from recurring. I look forward to hearing from you.

MAX7pOWTmz02_Eh48LZasg.text: Every time we come to Vegas and do some shopping at THE forum shops we stop by this restaurant. The atmosphere is so relaxing. They have the best 3 cheese potatoes (definitely my favorite). Everything on the menu is really tasty . Great service !!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Palms restaurant Lobster bisque so creamy and tasty !!!
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster , 3 cheese potatoes , and filet mignon !!! So delicious!!!

d0RJQmckeWM3S2JtN06HMg.text: Unbelievable Service! Unfortunately, I arrived late for dinner and an acquaintance had a few too many drinks that the waiter was more than glad to serve her (serious liability issue). When I informed her about the drinks the waiter stated, "oh, she's ok!" I must say I've never seen wait staff so unprofessional and desperate to make money. The acquaintance joked about Lobster and the waiter took advantage and ordered it for her minus the utensils to eat the Lobster. I had to request that they give her the appropriate utensils. When the waiter checked on our table he only addressed my intoxicated friend about the quality of her food. For those who are not aware of the Las Vegas Service environment, most establishments don't appear to be in control of staff behavior. The staff are left to figure out who has money and who will be served professionally. His behavior overshadowed the excellent food! If it were not for other waiters we would not have received some of the correct utensils, menu or dessert menu! My intoxicated acquaintance was so happy about the waiter's attentive behavior that she said goodbye to him as he stood outside the restaurant talking to patrons who had exited the restaurant. He kindly yelled back to her "Thanks for the generous tip!" For the first time in my lifeI worried that I conducted business and paid with a debit card at a restaurant. I later contacted the Assistant General Manager who informed me that my acquaintance had no problem with the service! She was intoxicated, so I guess not! tripadvisor.com/ShowUser...

rSLg6WzAYY2QNaKlMfT-mg.text: The Palm is still as great as it always has been. The ambiance is great. The staff is professionally trained and they know their craft perfectly. We had the Chilean Sea Bass and the Filet. The Sea Bass was extraordinary. It is difficult to cook Chilean Sea Bass all the way through without over or under cooking it but this was cooked to perfection. I ordered it blackened which added another depth of flavor without being overly spicy. My friend ordered the filet medium well which many would agree is overcooking the meat but to each his own. Unfortunately, it had to be sent back twice to get it to the preferred degree of doneness. Our server agreed that it was undercooked and had it re-fired in no time. We shared some New York Cheesecake for dessert and it was as good as you can get anywhere, including some famous New York delis. The Palm is a special place but is affordable enough to go to regularly and not just for special occasions. This was a five start experience.

DKlgYMydOGsk5uyYdr1H0g.text: Amazing. Ah-mazing. Here's what you need to know: Jumbo shrimp cocktail  Coconut crusted scallops Filet (melts in your mouth wow!)  Lobster mac and cheese Ask for J.R. You will have a great dinner. Sit out on the patio and people watch. Our new favorite place, sorry Joe's! PS this location is well ventilated and not hard to breathe because of smoke.

oUhjZ769wliq0nat5Td7_Q.text: Had a wonderful meal here. The waitstaff was very knowledgeable and attentive, and everything was spot on. My wife and I had a 24 ounce bone in Ribeye That was cooked to perfection. We paired that with a creamed spinach side dish that was also wonderful. Prior to the entree an assortment of fresh breads was offered, along with a small complimentary appetizer. All in all, it was a very pleasurable evening in the midst of the hustle and bustle of the C.E.S. (Consumer Electronics Show) which brought 175K people into LV.

woph0hb5YnKCe24Du0_Ktg.text: What an amazing dinner we had! The service was spectacular! Our waitress Anna went above and beyond at every step. The food was excellent from the beginning to the end! I can not recommend the Lobster bisque any more then I do! It was my favorite part of the meal!  Excellent wines to accompany the deliscious steaks! We loved every part of this meal!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

droR5bZ29dOHUZsoh5DGjg.text: Palm, one of the long time establishments located near the entrance of the Forum Shops. How could I not expect a lot because of its prestige, reputation and price point. And to be quit honest the food was "okay," but the service was superb. My family came for Saturday lunch to celebrate my dad's birthday and parent's wedding anniversary.   To start off the bread basket was obviously from a supplier and not baked in house. It was nothing special and was just sliced up rolls of bread, something they should work on. We asked for water initially and surprisingly they didn't ask if we preferred bottled or tap, I guess since we're Filipino they already knew to serve us tap. Hahaha!   I ordered the 3 course Power lunch special ($26). Pretty good deal I must say. I had the clam chowder, nicely done and crackers were served on the side. For my main entree I had the filet mignon medallions which was "okay" not the tastiest but edible. I was expecting a lot since this place is known for steaks? I should of asked for the sauce to be on the side because it was taking the spotlight. I was disappointed but oh well what can I do? Finally dessert I had cheesecake to go because I was so full from everything else. When I ate it at home it was delicious and it was on the "lighter, fluffier" side in comparison to most cheesecakes I'm used to.   In addition to what I order I tried the crab cakes, which was my mom's entrees. And this was not good because it was made with curry?! I like curry but didn't expect it to be in the crab cake which in my opinion unfortunately made everything all bad.    I probably won't be back because I've had better steaks from places that are cheaper. This was a nice experience to splurge and indulge especially since Palm is known for having their patrons eat in the outside area of the restaurant while mall shoppers eye and droll the food as they walk buy. To give them some credit, the service was on point. Our waters never hit below half. Our party ordered a 5lbs lobster and was opened by the busser at our table. Not sure if he was a busser or our server's assistant because he was so good and on top of it. I don't remember his name but he was an older Hispanic gentleman in his 40s or 50s.

bHhM7rdqvCZRk64zog37tA.text: What a great place! I had dinner three times last week at the Palm and drinks a couple of afternoons. The place is awesome the staff is second to none. The young lady that seems to be the manager Kelly was so sweet and accommodating. I had different servers from Elaina, Barry, Dutch, bar tenders Ashley, Kelly, Vic,(yes there are 2 Kelly's working there) all of them were fantastic. I had the veal parmigiana chop one night and sea bass the other both where fantastic. I actually went back a third time just to have the sea bass again (blackened or broiled, both ways were great). I recommend this restaurant. The lump crab cocktail is great too. I recommend the asparagus fritti as a side.

OTq7TO2JK16tRMm5qHj6FQ.text: My Husband and I actually got Married at the Original Palm in NYC back in 2012, since then we made it our tradition to celebrate our Wedding Anniversary at the Palm every year on March 3... we recently moved to Las Vegas and we were overjoyed to know that there was a Palm Restaurant here in town so we didn't have to fly to NY each year...this coming March 2017 will be extra special however, because it will mark our 5th Wedding Anniversary and our 3rd year celebrating at the Palm in Las Vegas, and we have yet to be dissapointed! The food is always outstanding, the service is always a breath of fresh air and the best part is- that the staff will make you feel like family and that means Everything to a True New Yorker-- trust me! LOL ...hopefully u guys have some great upcoming specials because we are Looking forward to spending our special day with you this March! Keep up the great work!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hY1eU7hGO2sJ5vuq_y7Sjw.text: So I came out to Vegas for vacation and was craving some steak . I was lucky enough to stumble across this great restaurant while walking through Ceaser Palace. The staff was wonderful. They were very helpful and noligable of the menu both food and wine.

CrgUh_bPMYbuUXve_gepYA.text: This place is the best!!! Ruan was fantastic and made the experience even better. This place is located just outside the casino in the Forum Fortuna Terrace. Come here for the power lunch special! Best burger I've had in a very long time. 2 HUGE meals, great service all for under $30.00!

OUbpTouE4Df1j1Q05xerDA.text: I love coming to this restaurant. I make sure I come every time I come to Las Vegas. I also go to the location in Charlotte a few times a year, but I absolutely love the Palm in Vegas.   It's so nice to sit in one of the seats on the outside area to watch all the people walking by in the Forum. They have great food here.   This trip I got the 9 oz Filet Mignon and the Whipped Potatoes. The steak was cooked just right and the whipped potatoes were awesome.   I was also on a big time crunch, so my server made sure I got my food quickly and he got me out in plenty of time.   Definitely a good place to come when you're in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Basket of Bread they bring to the table.

SIinA2nqd6Q90Wt_3aPPQA.text: This restaurant has the BEST crab cakes!! We had great service and again, those crab cakes are amazing. My mom had the shrimp cocktail and they were good sized shrimp. She said it was really good and hit the spot.

wYiZ-AHB-xunxHkbgPBXsA.text: My buddy and I looked at this place a couple times in the past and never got to it. We finally ventured in today. Both of us went for the power lunch option on the menu. Soup of the day was Chicken Noodle (Awesome). We also tried the Atlantic Salmon Fillet (Awesome) and New York Strip (Awesome) for the second course and a couple of sides.  All in all a great place to get some good food in a classy and relaxed setting. I generally don't put a price on good food but it's worth noting that this place surrounded by a bunch of overpriced casino restaurants is a fresh breath of value.  Service - 4/5 (AJ) Food - 4/5 Ambience - 4/5

Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable of the Day
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half &amp; Half

zE9DlL2wqW6oMkbDWxmNow.text: I've eaten at the ones in Philadelphia and New York's Tribeca and the West side. What can you say? Don't F* with the classics. Still great prices for exceptional service and quality of food. This is a classic steak house to a tee. But the best part is also  the steal of a lunch menu prices. Come eat and drink a bottle of wine with a classic Chicken Parm and a beautiful medium rare steak. Have at it.

RVyYDinwyL0RWKbP6tPy0A.text: The best steak we ever had! Amazing food and great service. One cocktail was surely enough for me since it was super strong. I believe We had a cosmo and a martini. Rib eye was so tasty and exactly the way I wanted. Juicy pink inside. On the other hand The fillet mignon was over cooked. We had to request them to return it and give us what we ordered, which was medium. They did it quickly but we had to start with rib eye in the meantime. Was a Great memory in the sin city

Vv3mckmyxX1aZ8UqOWY_gQ.text: We made reservations for Date night since my boyfriend is always talking it up when he takes his clients all the time. Once we came in there was no one at the hostess desk and once assistance came he had to walk up to the podium/desk, no one asked how many people or if we had a reservations. We then were sat and our busser Juan really saved the whole  experience. Our waiter came and he wasn't too friendly. Asked about his preference/ recommendation on the menu since I've never been and he just said that it's all good and should try anything.  He wasn't as attentive as expected for this caliber of restaurant  . The salad and break was good but Our main course took over an hour, reservation were at 8:30 and didn't eat until almost 10. We had the sea bass which was good but his steak was just ok. When it was time for dessert we just received  our bill and had to ask Juan for a dessert menu since we had already received our check from our waiter.  Not sure if the service was lacking since they had obnoxious patrons towards the back of the restaurant who were standing on tables/yelling and all or because cause he wasn't in with one of his high roller clients but I was very disappointed since he has loved this place for years. He did state that this was not the norm just disappointed we didn't get the same level of service and food he usually receives but it was ok just not was I expected at all.

-jqUmp6SJcUpolI5QLTCkw.text: First time making it to this newly renovated steakhouse and so glad we went. Lunch is a great time to go because they have a 2 course $24 option and even with a drink, dessert and a side per person it came out to $50 per person for lunch. Ive been to Joes Stone Crab many times and have yet to truly enjoy it. Theres always a wait and thats if you can get a table. The Palm really blew me away. The server was really atentive, the steak and accompaniments were all tasty and the price was reasonable. I wanted to try everything on the menu. On a sour note The Cobbler drink which looks great in photos doesnt taste that amazing for $13 and my friend couldnt stop saying as much. It was very flat in taste for such an expensive cocktail.   I'd like to say this is more of a steakhouse where as Joes Stone Crab is more of a seafood restaurant with steaks on the menu.   We cant wait to go back!

fMtLN5l0Nk9-rM7AsVPyTA.text: One of my best experiences at a steak house here in Las Vegas. Service was fast, friendly, and very attentive. The lobster was perfect and the ribeye was cooked exactly as aske. Definitely the experience I was looking to give my daughter. It's gonna be hard to top this one.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My daughter&#39;s half of a 4lb lobster and ribeye dinner.

FsROKHflkX67ci2GkzdpWA.text: I've only been here for work lunches, and I am always satisfied with the quality of the food, the ambiance and the service.  The prices are good for the Strip.  There's hardly ever a wait, unlike Joe's at the other end of the Forum Shops.  It is a short walk from the self park garage and the Forum Shop valet.  (Note: the Omnia valet near the self parking garage is for guests only. Don't bother trying.)    I know caesar salads are boring, but they do it well here and is a huge portion.  They also have a well-balanced lunch menu to choose from.  As many times as I come here, I never feel bored of their menu.    Definitely one of my favorite lunch spots.  I will come for dinner one day.

byrmpcL8Mwoly2CruPxEQA.text: Oh my GAWD!!! The Palm, located in the Forum Shops attached to Caesar's Palache (Palace, sorry I couldn't help it), has the best lobster in all of Las Vegas! This is legit, huge ass lobsters, yo! No exaggeration!   We brought my husbands Aunt from NYC to dinner and a show for her birthday just before Christmas.  We told Titi, to order anything she wanted.  Sooooo, she and the hubs ordered steaks and a "side" of a 5lb lobster!! What??!! Yep, they shared that $99 side. We sure got our monies worth with that 5lber! The claws there seriously the biggest we had ever seen.  I mean, we have traveled the world and this lobster takes the top spot!  Let me take a moment to share how great the staff is at this restaurant. They are a bunch of "cool dudes" who know their shit! They are friendly and beyond accommodating! I'm not a pain in the ass but hey, I like what I like! I was going to have chicken parm but then at the last second I said I didn't really want all that cheese (wtf, right). So cool dude, waiter said "would you like chicken milinese?" That's not even on the menu! Hell yeah, that is actually what I wanted.  He asked if I'd like a side tomato salad with greens. Of course I wanted that. I was afraid what I was gonna be charged for this side salad. To our surprise, it was included with my cutlet.  We also got a side of fresh cut fries.  Now these babies are way too expensive and you will be like, wtf? $15 for a side? Just get the damn fries. Yeah, they are expensive but they are soooo good! The 3 of us shared them (sorta) and there were some left over.   The drink selection is great, meaning bomb ass cocktails! I will say, they charge per soda as it's served in a small bottle. I'd prefer free refills but wtfe.  Vegas has a lot of amazing steak/seafood restaurants.  I'd go on record and say this place is in my top 3.  Food is always prepared how you'd like it. Even if you like to kill your steak by ordering medium well/well. They will do it.  They may stink eye you but alas, you get what you want! Whoopeeee!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday girl with her steak and lobster (incredible)

iOnG9R9pa_Zl2JtwrhblLg.text: Was at Palm in Dallas years ago. Great service and good food. Pricey but what you expect for a place like this. Ordered the power lunch special for $24 pp and chose roasted red pepper soup, French fish of the day and coffee/tea.  Soup was excellent and well seasoned. Had a specialty cocktail the "sapphire and flowers". A gun based drink with floral notes. Tart and clean on the palate.  The fresh fish was flounder in a Mediterranean preparation. Nicely cooked and light on flavor but filling.  Solid service too.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted red pepper soup.
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flounder
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sapphire and flowers.

rBLiChhiadAV1WjZIra4PQ.text: This will remind you of a French or New York bistro.   Food is delicious and service was great. I sat at the bar and it didn't seem very busy.  Great selection of steaks and drinks.  I would suggest this place for a nice lunch.  It's a little hidden inside Caesars, but a great place to get away from all the crowds.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LgJ3QHtVH4Brbqtm7ZgMTg.text: Location :excellent setting within Caesars Palace not far from 'Fountain of the God's.' Inside:murals great. Sat on 'patio.'Laid back relaxed-background sounds /music from mall.  Drinks menu:bit overpriced-good combination of cocktails & liqueurs.  Decided to try a'softer' beer-told it's locale -Vegas-chilled and went down well.  Starter :salad -Kale -nor up to scratch -overdone with dressing -returned -not charged :-waiter gracious re-same.  Main:Linguine-seafood :2-3stars -firm linguine though have had better-clams etc left much to be desired seemed prepacked version used. Potatoes us gratin -great Asparagus grilled-tops-best of meal. Desserts:Decided to forego as nothing unusual -nothing to capture imagination.  Service:waiters -interesting ...1st waiter unable to take order for alcohol ..guess was the age thing.  2nd ( main waiter ):friendly -good service-attentive.  Overall -have found better places.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H8chSR6SsJ5O6oM_bUT6oA.text: Wonderful service by all staff members  Our apps and entrees were prepared to out exact requests  Remember what our parents told us " I think your eyes are bigger than your stomach " We had leftovers for 2 days Great night out with my wife and friends.

RmKVxTMwuqRs6GYn0ugyag.text: This place was great! We stopped in when we were hungry for lunch. Their lunch prices are fantastic compared to their dinner, half the price if not more! I ordered the salmon Cesar, it was so good! And my mom got some soup. Our waitress was the sweetest lady, probably some of the best dining experience from a restaurant we've ever had. Just so kind. Would come back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ozPLyiC3bDrVj1lD6hKi0g.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas.  However, I was sorely disappointed when I traveled there from Chicago to celebrate my niece's birthday.  She and her husband drove in from Menifee, California.  We had our taste buds set for lobster, but we were told that Nova Scotia didn't ship or ran out of lobster. We were both sorely disappointed to say the least. Our dinner was good, but it's disappointing when you really have your mind set on your favorite foods.  The service was excellent as usual and the wine choices are great.  Still crying about my lobster.

Zh8ceoD36G9k_0QOobyN7A.text: Best steamed lobster In Vegas! The Caesar salad is to die for! I love comming here the service is always amazing!

MxUPH5pgGRQM0B3De_wEBg.text: Went to dinner last week for a birthday dinner. Food was yummy! However, I felt some gaps in the service we received:  To start, I felt that it took a little long to see our server to order appetizers. My boyfriend and I were sitting talking and looking around for a bit, trying to kill time waiting for our server. Then, during our entree with the Surf N Turfs, no one informed us that someone will be breaking the claws for us. So, we were left a little confused as to how we were going to enjoy it especially since no tools we left our table. It wasn't until about 5 minutes into our meal, our waitress said "Oh, no one is here opening your claws?" After that the busser came over unprepared, apparently, since she had to leave to grab something a few minutes and then come back. Which I didn't mind, but just to point out for future service correction. Finally, when it came to the conclusion of our meal, we had full plates of au gratin and brussels sprouts left, which or server didn't even care to ask if we wanted to take home. I had to make a point that I would like to take the brussels sprouts home since they were the best brussels sprouts I've ever had. I felt a lack of consideration there.  Aside from service, the corner booth we were in should be closed off or renovated into something else. The pole in front of the booth was a real inconvenience. A REAL INCONVENIENCE. Who would want a large, black structure obstructing his/her view of the restaurant and tv's? I would not wish upon anyone to sit there.  Definitely wished we received a more personable service. Server made no attempt to ask us if we were doing anything else after dinner for the birthday, etc. She was only straight to the point, minimum confrontation.   P.s. the wine glasses that were on the table were not polished well. Very spotty. Not very presentable for something you'd expect from a fine restaurant.  Another thing I was skeptical about was parking in valet since the restaurant "only had a limited amount of passes they give out." I don't want to know they have passes available, park in valet, finish dinner, come to find out they don't have anymore passes and that I now need to pay for valet. It would be pleasant if someone called to inquire, that person can then reserve a pass, and everyone else who asks in person would be first come, first serve since they were expecting to pay for valet anyways.  All in all, thus the reason for three stars. Great food, moderate experience.

Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf n Turf
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inconvenient pole

G_BzmSAkTERSLYQDp4VB7Q.text: Consistent - consistent good service, consistent good food, consistent quality. The main reasons we keep coming back.  The place is a bit more open after the remodel and sounds a bit noisier, but the good and service are top notch. Filet Oscar style always been perfect. Service is attentive and spot on.

mCo72D2xfeDuPNXS4CQxdw.text: Great food. Drinks. Hostess. Workers. The big, SHA-BANG! Been coming here every year since I've been coming to Vegas for the past 4 years now. Always treat us like our first time. Always a welcome back when we go :)

8dY7w5Td21NwfSfZeAIgHg.text: I came here with a group to celebrate my friend's birthday. First and foremost, I appreciate that they were very accommodating about my friend's birthday. We thought it was adorable how they decorated the table with confetti, a birthday card, and gave us a free slice of cheesecake at the end.   However, I should also outline factors that contributed to this relatively low rating: 1) The location was a bit hard to find since there are 2 buildings to Caesar's palace and the restaurant is inside one of them, so there was no store front that faces the street. Google Maps directed us to the other building at first so we were late, but they were nice about saving our reservation 2) The wait for food was quite long 3) The presentation of the food was not only very uncreative but even disappointing. As seen in the photos, my dish had the meat and a single piece of cilantro on a large plate. When the food arrived, we did not even feel compelled to take photos because it was simply not appealing. Usually, I'm not picky about presentation, but for a dish at their price point, I'd expect to get the whole package 4) The filet mignon was a bit dry. It certainly does not stand out from other filet mignons that I've tried in the past. Perhaps it would have been better with sauce. My friend's sea bass had a beautiful texture and fresh taste, but the sauce that they paired with it was overpowering. Their mashed potato had large pieces of garlic in them, which made the consistency and smell weird. Not to mention, it's rare to find people who enjoy biting into large piece of garlic. Lastly, their cheesecake was delicious, but the strawberry sauce was way too tarty and sour.   Overall, the Palm demonstrated a lack of creativity in their presentation and lack of thought in the taste of almost all of the dishes that we tried. Although the customer service was good, I don't think I would come back here again. We expected more due to the price point and other ratings.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon

EnueqktPYgNvoeaGV_4Asg.text: The Palm is where my family goes to celebrate big events. Birthdays, graduation, weddings, you name it. Last night we came for my birthday and left happy as can be & stuffed to the gills!  For drinks I had iced tea & my dad had a couple whiskey sours. Rest of table had pop. The iced tea was so refreshing and my dad's whiskey sour was awesome! Perfectly balanced, with just the right amount of whiskey (Maker's Mark for those wondering).   Our waiter brought out a bread basket with butter. I highly recommend slapping some butter on a slice of the raisin bread. We started with the Gigi salad and it was huge! All the ingredients went so well together, but the highlight was the shrimp.   For entrees I had the ribeye which came out a perfect rare. The outside of the steak had a nice char, and when I cut into it I saw beautiful red meat. It tasted phenomenal! Tender, delicious, and juicy; it was everything steak should be.   My girlfriend had the chicken Parmesan and I can honestly say it was the best chicken parm we've ever had. We shared the lobster Mac & cheese as a side and were not disappointed! It was such a rich, filling meal but was packed with flavor.   The rest of our table had veal Parmesan, veal martini & a kids chicken Alfredo. Sides were Brussels sprouts & creamed corn brulee. Both veal dishes were awesome, and the side dishes tasted good too! I didn't get a taste of the chicken Alfredo but my sister said it was some of the best.   All in all, we've been coming to The Palm for years and will continue to come for years. Why? It's consistently great food and the service is second to none. They'll do whatever it takes to make your experience special.

JqPNDL_cAzf7Iy8QgUSIZw.text: If I could give this place 0 stars I would. We went here for a farewell lunch for a co-worker. The host was nice as she greeted and seated us promptly. The waiter was less than pleasant but worst of all, the food was definitely the worst I've ever had. I ordered the filet mignon topped with crabmeat, asparagus, and mashed potatoes. The filet was extremely dry and the crabmeat had zero flavor as well. I've had better steak at Outback. The mashed potatoes couldn't be fixed no matter how much seasoning I added and they even messed up the asparagus. My meal was over $60 and as soon as I returned to work I threw it all up! I would never return nor recommend this restaurant.

-qniUXM9_yui94_qi7LFJw.text: While this is not my favorite steakhouse in Vegas, I have to say they gave us great service and the food was damned tasty.  The football on at the bar didn't hurt any either. I love playoffs, especially in mixed national company while traveling. Half the bar is rooting for one team, the other half is rooting for the other team. Creates the perfect tension for watching football and drinking too much.  The DH and I shared a hearts of palm salad (my favorite thing at the Palm) something else and then a 14 oz filet mignon. The steak was cooked perfectly, although my favorite salad was a hair overdressed.    Ultimately I took off one star because when I think of 5 star worthy steakhouses in Vegas, I cannot help but think of SW steak, my HG steakhouse.

OExOOdUIEkQcCqLVJ5fCTA.text: Palm Restaurant seems to be one of those places that, every single time you mention the name, someone who's been there goes "Ooh I love that place, you need to try the _____, they have the best _____!!! Oh my god, it's sooo good!" Every time I've heard that, it was a completely different menu item. That's how I knew Palm had to be on my list of places I absolutely have to try. So the other day, on my birthday, I finally tried it.   I don't even know where to begin with the list of reasons I love this place. I guess I'll start with the decor, since that's the first thing you notice. The place may not seem like much, being in the middle of a high volume shopping area. But it's a high dollar, high volume shopping area. So at least you know it's not gonna be like a mall's food court or something. I chose to eat inside. The place has a nice old school restaurant kind of charm to it. There are drawings all over the walls but the servers are dressed nice, mostly the customers are all dressed at least somewhat formally as well. I don't think you'd necessarily be out of place if you were dressed down a bit either. Even though I wasn't seated near it, the bar seemed pretty cool. I had a good enough view from my table to keep an eye on the score of the Jets game (Bonus Points, but really, Go Giants!).   Now on to the next thing you'll notice; the service. The service at this place is outstanding!! Honestly, outstanding isn't a good enough word for the service. I'm just too lazy to pull up my computer's thesaurus, so I guess, just deal with it. These people hustle, old-school Vegas style! Glasses were never empty and everything was prompt. It may be because they knew it was my b-day, but they were like extra awesome to us. I got a personal handwritten birthday card, they made it rain birthday confetti on my table (I swear I'm not making any of this up!!), and after the meal, I got a giant slice of this phenomenal cheesecake along with a few cups of pretty good coffee, all on the house. How awesome is that?? The busboy was from New York too; being all New Yorkers, we B.S.'ed quite a bit about back home. Just even more personal touches on top of the others. Good things, good things. The server on the other hand, had a very thick asian accent; we couldn't understand her very well. It still wasn't bad enough to even take off a half of a star, which is good, because I can't technically do that, even if I wanted to. Moving on..  So I guess even phenomenal service wouldn't earn a 5-star review if the food wasn't top notch. In this case it was pretty damn close to top-notch. I got the bone-in ribeye and their french fries. If I had never eaten Firefly's incredible fries this place would have taken the title of my favorite french fries in this town. So Palm will have to settle for second place in the fry department. Now as far as the main dish; Palm made the best Ribeye I have had in Vegas so far. Dry-aged (expect nothing less for $40 or so) and cooked to perfection. It was juicy on the inside, and seared wonderfully on the outside. It had a great flavor as well; not overly seasoned but seasoned just right. I don't mind getting a $40 steak when it tastes that good and is that filling. I was stuffed. It was a struggle to even put a dent in that cheesecake afterward. And this boy can eat!! I swear I must be 400 pounds on the inside somehow. Or maybe just in another life.   So there you have it folks. I finally tried one of the like 10 steakhouses that I hear people rave about in this town. And I happened to love it.   Oh by the way, when anyone asks me about Palm my response is going to be... "I love this place, you need to try the bone-in rib eye. They have the best rib-eye!! Oh my god, it's soooo good!!" Yea, I guess I drank the koolaid too.

nWr5WnaKq4n3IQoVXQ3QaA.text: If you are into tradition this is the spot.   Let's start with lobster bisque. Creamy, luxurious and rich with flavor. Just a short stop to Maine. Follow up with "Clams Oreganata". Small clams topped with just the right amount of garlic, bread crumbs and lemon served hot and crisp.     This could be Lago Bolsana.  Finally a "Monday Night" chopped salad with anchovies. Tangy would be the word. Sort of reminds you of the 70's music and Donna Summers or Gloria Gainer. Topped off with a "Duckhorn" Sauvigon Blank and double espresso  with a hint of Galliano.   Give me the good old days anytime.

TNyVbDwriu-oSvATm_FPtw.text: Had luch there and the food/service was very good. I had the Tuna Steak and I must say that I will be back for their Tuna. I was very impressed to hear the our waiter has been with the company for 35 years. He also shared with me that the Palm is still family owned and has been around since 1926.

MFT-Oim_k5wI1NGfkCxSag.text: We called last minute for a reservation on the holiday and were pleased to find out there was an opening.  We were asked a preference on indoor or "outdoor" seating which REALLY pleases me so I don't have to look like a snob asking for a table that was not offered to us.  The food was fantastic with the only exception being an over-parmed beef carpaccio.  Our steak was cooked to perfection, our sides seasoned perfectly, (fried asparagus being a welcomed surprise), and our caprese salad was plentiful.  The only reason I would not give The Palm a 5 star rating is because our service was a little "cool" and unmatched to the higher price of the menu.  Service was pleasant and acceptable but not exceptional, which I had expected with the higher price tag.  I would definitely come back to the Palm, just maybe not for a "special" occasion.

gRKcBk_ZWCSTrQJv_JRmEA.text: my husband was a huge palm fan but it closed in Miami years ago, so when we walked past it in the caesers shops. he immediately knew he wanted to eat there.  the service was ok. the waiter really was exceptionally good at invading personal space. lol. it was weird. he would hover over you to take your order and place your plate in front of you!?  we shared the calamari, a burger, and cheesecake for dessert. everything was very good.

LgUi4uReuHIIvV8IaZFwOw.text: Another bad experience at Palm.I often dine at the Palm in LA,this location always drops the ball. Had reservation for 8 for two, waited 30 minutes to be offered a table that was open the entire time, and was being used by people in the bar to rest there drinks. After I asked if we could wait for a better table he told us no than offered us a table that everyone was crowding around trying to talk to the hostess. Clearly they didn't want us to dine here, overall I just think they treat customers poorly at this location. If my client had not requested this restaurant I would of never came back.  Overall bad experience and was embarrassing to be treated so poorly. Only good part was the bartender who poured our glasses of wine.

8DS8hykbOQOQ8UBSiFl9CQ.text: It starts with terrific service; genuine attention to the customer experience.  Full marks.  Ambiance was contemporary American Steakhouse; bar area had TV screens and was up-tempo.  Outstanding food: NY strip, cooked to perfection, Lyonese potatoes were cooked perfectly.  Shrimp and crab cakes to start.. also great- crab cakes were very meaty, not much filler.  An otherwise standard U.S. (Vegas) steakhouse experience, save the service... which stood out above everything else.

D8IYApC4V-d7_l1ac-N8qg.text: We had a large table of 8, and it was a very nice experience all around.  Typical Las Vegas steakhouse prices.  Also, in typical fashion, the room was rather loud.  Food, service, and ambience, were all very good.  We will return.

ChkVzeiTq4c38BkqBM5-Dw.text: Wanting a good steak dinner while in Vegas, my boyfriend and I decided to give the Palm Restaurant a go. We reserved a table through OpenTable and got in right away. It was a perfect mix of upscale and casual; our waiter was down-to-earth yet polite and the dress code was just "no swimwear." We got the fancy dinner without the intimidation.   There was a lobster special going on (I'm not a huge fan of seafood but it was very clean and quite tasty) so we paired it with steak. We asked for "medium" steak, but it came out very rare. Overall, we prefer SW Steakhouse at Wynn any day, but Palm Restaurant was worth it.

j-y5WytNeYrXBsjYCtOLqQ.text: Great old-style New York steakhouse.  Lobsters are their specialty and they do not disappoint.  Available up to six lbs in weight, these folks know how to cook one to perfection.  The steaks are outstanding, too, and so is the service.

yS5hZtP4ovNrAptgDp0Bnw.text: Great steaks, excellent service, good wine list.  Fantastic people watching on "the patio"  837 membership is the best deal in town!

c82utn5ozo2Bn7t3XVl31w.text: The prix fixe lunch may be one of Vegas' best kept secrets! A bowl of clam chowder (or Caesar salad), 10 oz. strip au poivre with mashed potatoes and a side of veggies (I got the delicious garlic sauteed asparagus) and choice of dessert (flourless chocolate cake or key lime pie) all for under $25.  There were mutliple entree options with this menu, including a steak salad with the same 10 oz. strip steak, or salmon. Coupled with the chewy fresh pumpernickel raisin bread and sourdough, you won't leave hungry.  Service was chummy and casual, but attentive. Food came out a bit slow. The soup and au poivre sauce was salty for my taste. Classic steak house feel with the celebrity characatures on the walls gave the place old school charm. Food was above average, and portions were huge.

5QAwiIp28RqPlR3K1ALEYw.text: If your looking for a great steak house, this place is great. Atmosphere ams service was outstanding. A bit costly for a steak but all worth it.

MS2_UUVTW47IPqeefokuWA.text: There are so many Steakhouses in Las Vegas that it is very hard to for one to differentiate between them all.  The Palm is a solid eatery that will never let you down.  Yes, it doesn't have the hip atmosphere of the others nor is it located near a popular night club or off the Casino floor of a 5 Star Resort in the area, but what it lacks in "coolness" it makes up for ten fold in quality and service.  This New York legend has been seamlessly transplanted to Las Vegas and it bares the same food quality and service of their flagship restaurant on 837 2nd Ave in New York City.  Every time I am in Las Vegas I make a stop for their Business Lunch (best deal in town: salad, entree and dessert for $25.90) or for Dinner (I highly recommend the NY Strip).  I've never had a bad meal here and I've always been satisfied with the product delivered.    If you're looking for a Steakhouse to impress friends, attend a business meeting or simply have dinner with a spouse or date, look no further than the Palm.

7ZH1E32Pq3rNwo2rx1XasQ.text: We decided on the Palm for restaurant week.  We took advantage of a three course menu for $30.  Note: there is a business lunch menu offered everyday - 3 courses for $26.   The seating process was very nice as they asked us exactly where we would like to sit.   Our service was good, not as detail oriented as I had expected.  A few missteps, but we left happy having gotten everything we needed.   The food was mediocre.  Steakhouse food doesn't tend to be revolutionary or exciting but should be high quality and executed to perfection.  We all had the lobster bisque which was buttery, creamy and dreamy.  The bread basket was a winner as well.  Three sorts to choose from including pretzel bread and the butter was whipped and spreadably delightful.  My filet was tasty and the portion was hearty but lacked excitement and luster.  Hubby's NY was way over cooked from the rare he requested.  You expect your steak to be cooked correctly at a steakhouse - especially a Rare request.   The desserts were tasty and decadent.   Definitely A-OK and we weren't disappointed for $30 each but it wasn't anything spectacular.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster bisque

kZJN5UmjsOp8eVBieXs-pA.text: The Palm is not a restaurant I would normally choose to go to. I went with others who chose it. It's a chain, and I'm not big on chains. That said, I did enjoy my meal here.  I started out with the caesar salad. It was a good one. The croutons were nice and crispy though probably of the packaged variety. The romaine was green and crisp and the dressing was tangy and tasty. A nice salad overall.  For my entree I chose the surf and turf special which was $54. I dont order much lobster but it seemed like a good deal since it included the salad and a side in the price. The lobster tail was supposedly 6 ounces and the entire lobster tail, including shell may have touched six ounces before being cooked but I doubt it. There was about two ounces of meat, tops. But it was two ounces of VERY PERFECTLY cooked lobster. The tails so often end up chewy but this was anything but. Maybe the best lobster tail I have ever had.  The filet was supposedly seven ounces and I'd say it probably was but it did seem small. For a steak house it wasnt looking like much. This was a simply grilled filet, not broiled, and it lacked the thick char I expect from a steakhouse. The meat was of good quality and again cooked to an absolutely perfect medium rare but it was the least favorite part of my meal. It was underseasoned and just average in every way except for the temperature of the meat.  My side was the three cheese gratin potatoes and it did not disappoint. Straight up delicious and there was actually plenty of it this time.   Overall, for lobster, steak, salad and side at $54 it seemed like a pretty fair deal.   The service was ok, nothing special. Our waitress seemed a little intimidated, almost like it was her first day or something.  I would go again but would pick other steakhouses if it was up to me. If this is a special meal and you dont eat at restaurants of this caliber frequently, your money could be better spent elsewhere.  Still four stars since I really cant find anything to complain about and some stuff was excellent but I wish I could give three and a half because only the lobster was anything much above ordinary.

snc0oR2EEMKNx2QLqDLABw.text: I wanted lunch on the patio but was pushed to the bar. I hate that tactic for single eating. So once seated, I almost left. But the bartender Mary was excellent. She turned the experience around. I had a prefix lunch menu. It was generous in size and delicious. Salad, side, steak, key-lime pie.  It was very good and I'd highly recommend the place. I will be back but hostess station needs to hear the clients request.

XnQgN01yRku9NOFVI4Is5Q.text: So here's the problem with this place. Friends take me there for my birthday at my request. Food is really good again. Service is good. We are then blindsided by a bill that includes a charge for $90.00 for my three vodka tonics! Now I'm being treated to dinner by my friends but I discreetly pull the waiter aside and ask him why so much. He tells me because I ordered my cocktails in a tall glass they charge for doubles and that's the way it is. I don't wish to complain at that time so I send the restaurant an email the next day saying I think that was wrong to do. After no response, I send another two days later. Never even responded. Seriously, $30.00 each for a vodka tonic? And trust me, if these were doubles I would have had to be carried out of the place. I guess they need the money more than me or my friends as repeat customers.

Ivdt9snVOz8Nz4pPryIW-Q.text: This was by far the worst steak for this classification of a steak house. Prices are comparable to Ruth's Chris but if you're expecting a Ruth's Chris caliber of steak you'll be sorely disappointed. Very noisy atmosphere as well. Hard to recommend this restaurant

VJ2RExys0e_bMqNUrn2B6g.text: The Palm gets five stars for the rare combination of excellent food, great service, and management that shows an interest and cares about their customers. The food was excellent and the bartenders knows their stuff. We had a problem with one of the steaks not being prepared to the right temperature, but instead of being a negative, The Palm Las Vegas and their GM differentiated themselves from competitors and made it right. Let's face it, things happen.  It just can't always be perfect no matter how hard everyone tries. The True test of a really well run restaurant is how they respond when it doesn't go 100% and this place is both fantastic and honorable.  I would highly recommend The Palm for a fantastic dinner.

5iJBYpBCv3wsxSjElio6kA.text: Tried this Sunday's special Lobster fra Diablo.Lobster...claims...shrimp... Calimera...spaghetti...in a spicey tomato sauce. My new 2d favorite...behind Chilean Sea Bass. Switched to the Caprice sliced beef steak tomatoes and motsorella cheese...chuck blue cheese and vinaigrette and olive oil dressing ...on the side. Of course who can pass up the flower less chocolate cake with whipped cream and vanilla ice cream. Spelling does not count.

KZWxU5INPp1TQIEyjh-zZA.text: BEST LOBSTER EVER! The deal for a 2 person lobster for $99 is amazing! It comes with a lot of sides and it's all delicious! However I did order the lobster Mac and cheese and was not impressed but the corn was AMAZING! The lobster was insanely buttery and fresh! The staff went around with their biggest lobster Giovanni and let people take pictures with it! For dessert I had the donut holes and they were pretty subpar nothing too special. However, I had a great time at Palms and will definitely be back for the 2 for $99 deal!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster

dlIBVnH993KdDX9_aH2QHg.text: I came in with few friends for a bday celebration and absolutely enjoyed every moment there. I give 4 and 1/2 stars on the food, 5 stars on service and 3 stars on ambience.   Food: 1. Crab cakes: it was pretty good but I had better else where. I didn't care for the seasoning of the crust.  2.Calamari: it's not bad at all but I haven't had any bad calamari in a long time lol  3.Lobster: it was sooo yummy and fresh! I love it !  4.Chilean sea bass with tomato and mushroom sauce(special of the day) : fish was very fresh and sauce was light and flavorful. I like it a lot. 5. Sides: I like saute mushroom and saute spinach. Cream corn and creamy spinach were just okay.   We also ordered a bottle of red and champagne. Don't remember the name but both were very good. Total overall experience was awesome besides the ambience. I think it was quite noisy there and I was not a fan of the decor inside. If we have to spend $1000 on a meal, I would expect the place looks little bit more upscale.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilean Sea bass with tomato and mushroom sauce( special of the day) yummy !!
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge lobster

KC6k5hxEWrNYCRwj9zc0aw.text: The chicken parm is a classic and sooo delicious   I had Johanna as a bartender and she was polite efficient and made my trip to the Palm perfect. Thank you!  And you gotta go if your in Vegas !!!.

cQXmrS_7Cudjqn3HIDX5XQ.text: It was our last night in Vegas and I wanted to have a great dinner before heading back home. We were exhausted so I chose a place near our hotel. I always like to try different restaurants since there are so many terrific restaurants to choose from.   We ordered the bacon wrapped scallops for our appetizer and it was delicious. For our entrees we ordered the veal martini which is one of their specials. I was disappointed with the under seasoned and over cooked veal. My other half ordered the linguine in clam sauce which was also under seasoned and lacking clams.   This is being added to my over priced do not return list.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Under seasoned Linguine in clam sauce...where the clams?
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Over cooked and under seasoned veal martini

zuWRNb67GCEtxohjwurGFA.text: I have eaten here many times in the past. My experience dining here as a single patron was far from what I expected from a restaurant with the price tag it comes with.  I went to the palm at just before 4 pm. I hadn't had lunch and wanted an early dinner. I was seated promptly.  My waiter left much to be desired. David E. When he found I simply wanted a glass of wine and a full entree--to the tune of $61.00--he seemed to lose interest in me since he couldn't get me to upcharge with additional items.  My food came promptly and my waiter left--I mean I didn't see him until he arrived with the check---but a second server came to check on me a couple of times. My server never offered or brought bread to me---with a dinner entree--the servers were not busy the restaurant was relatively empty.  I asked the second server and he did bring me bread----I noticed all other tables were offered bread.  My waiter returned when I had about 1/3 left and placed he bill on my table. I was not finished---he said nothing. I continued to finish my meal and again, before my glass of wine was finished or my plate was cleared he tried to take the check which I had not addressed. He clearly wanted to free up the table...... Now mind you only three tables in the patio area including mine was occupied.  Servers need to understand that patrons want to get adequate service---you notice I didn't even mention the food---his bad attitude overshadowed my meal----the palm will be a miss on my next trip this spring. With so many options it seems that restaurants should offer their patrons polite patient service especially when there is no wait and no reason he should have been rushing me...

rxYS_0knNswc3p4IqN4Uog.text: In town for the final four and stopped by my favorite restaurant, The Palm.  The food was great and with JR as your server, it doesn't get much better !

VtpZe1EgKE1nhdHcz_Z0DA.text: We had an event in a private room at the Palm Las Vegas and every aspect was excellent. The meal exceeded our expectations and the wait staff did a terrific job leading our needs. They even put together a nice multi dessert platter for our group.

OQraRZGpi7TCwUO8QXpGqA.text: What a lovely restaurant.  We started with the beef carpaccio which was so tender. Caprese Salad as an appetizer and we each had a New York strip which was cooked medium as requested and quote flavorful.    I enjoyed a Paloma which was perfect.  Key lime pie for dessert.  I would definitely recommend The Palm. We will be back.

xR_Dp-jkSmLn7D5L1DrzcA.text: Such a bummer. We always eat here when we are in Vegas. Members of the club, and my brother had his wedding dinner here many years ago. Sadly our experience was not favorable last night. Place was not busy on a Sunday night. Service was sub-par. I had to ask server what specials were when our order was being taken. Iceberg salad was great. Bread was different then it used to be. Not a good thing. 6 people in our party had steak. All but one disappointed. No flavor, no presentation. 1 lamb, very fatty. Sides were good. No vibe in restaurant since remodel. When you spend $ like this you expect more. Might give the place one more shot next trip. Might not.

K7YdfYdbpqUbn3c4KG0sNw.text: We came here bc of the good reviews, and We expected a lot more.. Sadly we were disappointed.. The the complimentary bread basket was promising, with a variety of different breads to nibble on with butter... When the food arrived, it too was promising... I ordered their wedge salad and Brussel sprouts (trying to eat my veggies!), and that was pretty standard.. My wedge salad was huge and tasted just fine. My husbands prime rib looked delicious.. But it was too undercooked... He ordered it Medium, and it was definitely more on the rare side, he's a steak lover, and unfortunately he lost his appetite after trying to chew a few bites and only ate about 1/4 of it... Overall, everything was ok.. Just wished I loved it more... May have a better experience finding a steakhouse off the strip.   Otherwise, our server was attentive and friendly...

oEucEYaHTc9G727OPdMA-g.text: Stopped by here while checking out the shops last weekend and it did not disappoint!   I had the chicken sand which, sounds simple enough right? WRONG! Apparently they order the cheesecake from New York! Sooooo good, this restaurant is a must try!

All staff members were very accommodating, however, Shaunte went well above excellent in taking care of us and I'd say she was superior! p4oHMqfahqWdKqjRz7oajQ.text: This Palms has a great Bone-In Rib-eye. We sat out in the lanai. Great for people watching.   The service is excellent and the timing of food between appetizers and main course is done right.

wcJsPFfhTOy9dHyUoWRXfg.text: This ranks with the best steakhouse dinners I've had in Las Vegas.  We came here before the Elton John concert last night.  I ordered a New York strip (a 12 ounce steak) and my wife got the 9 ounce filet.  We got an order of fries as a shared side.  The bread basket had a nice variety but I didn't want to fill up on that so I had two small slices of two kinds.  The steaks were both cooked perfectly.  Mine, blue, was cool and red on the inside--just perfect!  The fries were nicely seasoned although I didn't taste much garlic as I had expected.  For dessert, my wife had the seasonal berries and I went with the single size portion of carrot cake.  I would like to see the double portion for sharing just to see if it needs two people to carry it to the table.  Service was excellent!  Lopez was our server and he was very personable, polite, and efficient.  I never asked for an iced tea refill.  It was automatic.  Next time, we'll sit on the patio and watch the people walking by in the Forum Shops. We found that the air conditioning inside was quite cold and it was a bit warmer on the patio.

WydnlccIpELIHSvKU8Ot-Q.text: Have been to the The Palms restaurant in Beverly Hills and loved it there. So when we saw there was another one in Cesar's Palace we decided to give it a shot. It was the lunch menu but they still had a lot of yummy things you could order.  We ordered the Lobster Bisque which was one of the best I have ever tasted.  We also ordered some Chicken Parmigiana and the Nova Scotia Lobster Mac 'n Cheese.  Both were delicious and very filling. I ended up sharing it with my husband which was perfect! They also had a good assortment of fine wines and beers. Great place for a nice lunch, great service and even better food!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch at the Palms Las Vegas

itD5_87P4FXzKIgZCKKQ2g.text: I frequent the Palm in my hometown Tribeca NYC.  The manager (didn't get his name) was very accommodating, asked him if they could do the burger they have on the lunch menu for dinner, he said yes with no hesitations.  The meal was fantastic as always from The Palm

ZHNC3ebLMW84tx5v6PgnRg.text: AMAZING, SPECIAL AND MEMORABLE, EVERY SINGLE WAY!  I have eaten at the Palm chain over a dozen occasions in both NYC and Vegas but I must say this was by far the most memorable and even touching experience. The food was impeccable (go for the gigantic lobsters they have, come early and they will have an extra big for you) and the service too. There was a small hiccup in the beginning but both our server and the manager (Alissa) went above and beyond to not only make it right but to make it a very special dining experience.   While I have been here before, it was my parents' first time eating lobster. They have enjoyed it immensely and made a special remark about how impeccable the service was. My stepdad had his birthday and the chocolate cake with a candle, the special birthday table decor and the little hand-written birthday card were all an evidence of a restaurant that truly provides a wonderful, special, memorable and one-of-a-kind experience.   I can't thank everyone involved enough for the wonderful experience and will be sure to come back in the not so distant future.  Thank you!!!

CDYVCFDp2v1SE6Ny3hjI8Q.text: Exceptional food, amazing service, great ambiance. A couple of the quality's you receive when you dine at the Palm at the forum shops in Vegas.  I have been dining st this Palm for over 15 years. I have watched the team change. I have seen the restaurant be remodeled but the one thing that has not changed is your opportunity to have a fantastic night of food and fun.  To ad an extra level of fun and 5 star experience, ask for JR. He is the best.  Thanks for your years of fantastic food, service and fun.

haJJyuEJa5bY0UNdrdqVdg.text: The Palm is the epitome of romantic meets fresh seafood. The servers are wonderful and the food was even better. We got the July special; 4pound Nova Scotia lobster. It was truly one of the best lobsters of my life and I grew up on the east coast! I paid an up charge to get the watermelon burrata salad. It was perfectly drizzled with a balsamic glaze. My husband had a wonderfully cream lobster bisque. The three cheese potatoes augratin was sinfully good too. As if we needed more (we were beyond stuffed), my husband ordered the flourless chocolate cake. This is one of my very favorite dessert and it was among the very best I've ever had! Just wow!

cywLw8bveIfF9fDXhuo73Q.text: Situated right in the forum shops is a NYC staple in Las Vegas, The Palm. The Palm is all about steaks and seafood. Or if you are like me and go for lunch the light salad options with some decadence on top. I had the Nova Scotia Lobster Salad, it was full of fresh greens, tomatoes, avocado and obviously lots of cold lobster. They certainly did not skimp and honestly for such a nice restaurant in a perfect location the price was surprisingly on point. If you are shopping in the Forum Shops or just looking for a good option that is better than a food court I would recommend stopping into The Palm.

jUdO8DyXeYduGDdYTCbcEQ.text: As locals, my husband and I come here about once a month out of convenience when we're at the Forum Shops and hungry. Reservations are readily available on open table and we usually request Brian who is an excellent server. We also look forward to the 837 club special cocktails.   This past Sunday night we had reservations for 8:15pm. Brian was not in so we were seated with Shaunte.   Shaunte was fine, she very nice and she didn't disappear and was readily available but it almost seemed like she was new. We didn't get much of a greeting or a how are you doing. It was very straightforward to "what can I get you" which is fine. When she first asked what kind of waters we wanted I had assumed she was a food runner because she didn't introduce herself as our server.   We also felt a bit rushed. We ended up ordering different drinks since the 837 cocktail did not sound appealing to either one of us. I got a seasonal mule, my husband ordered a cucumber gimlet. Both drinks were good.   We skipped appetizers (the bread and butter is more than enough) and ordered two 9 ounce filets,  whipped potatoes, and creamed corn brulee. Now that I'm home I see I was charged for wild mushrooms instead of the potatoes but I'm pretty sure the price is the same for both so I'm not concerned.   One thing I've noticed consistently about The Palm is that steaks are ALWAYS over cooked. This time we ordered medium rare and they came out medium, a tiny bit longer and they would've been medium well.  We ordered them medium rare because we were looking for medium so I guess it worked this time.   All in all, it was fine. We came in at 8:15, we're finished by 8:52pm. There are so many choices in Vegas though. I don't know when we'll come back with our last few visits being so sub par.

isTE4__OWmWkZAQ0oey8-A.text: Maybe because it was lunch it did not meet our expectations...,IDK. I had crab cakes & my husband had the lobster BLT. The crab cakes had a lot of crab but were totally over seasoned and the jicama slaw it came with was a soupy flavorless disaster. The BLT was just ok. One part of the lobster still had a huge piece of cartilage in it. Thank god my husband didn't choke on it. The sweet potato fries it came with were the highlight. Fabulous! For me this place is a  pass.

zZzqGBDyHohvluQu5tBAbQ.text: The palm...Excellence, Service, Experience. Do it at least once in your life. Do it twice...damn...    After wanting to try the palm for years im so happy we got to give it a try this last trip. We both split a 5lb lobster, and i added on an aged ribeye. Sides were ceasar, potatoes au gratin, brussles, and mushrooms. Desert was a creme brulee.    Holy shit wow...the service...the food...started with great service, offer of water, drinks, menu explanation and specials. Atmosphere was light, casual, and hip. Our table was immediatly graced by the asst general manager on shift. And visited frequently by bussers, waiters and management at every turn of the fork.    Ceasars csme after the bread, and were on point. With house made dressing. Then came the lobster..steak and sides...whoa..ive only seen bugs like this one in pictires. And need i say cooked perfectly? With butter for dipping, and a medium rare rib eye to boot...all sides were mouthwatering. My steak was perfect, and my claw was over a pound..so much mouth watering roe, i was amazed.   The drinks kept coming, and we were feeling pretty good and ready for desert. The salted caramel creme brulee was a decadant joy of taste to finish the meal with. I ordered a cappuccino with desert...i mean i cant do it justice...perfect in every way. We will be back...

x7HYhrQndA9s9xjjpQEqVg.text: I love a classic steakhouse and my usual order is a    Wedge salad, medium rare steak and creamed spinach.   The Palm is a trusted standard and always delivers.  The salad, steaks and desserts are good but I prefer creamed spinach prepared simply with a bechamel sauce so their preparation isn't for me.  We ordered a giant lobster which was almost scary.  Obviously we realized it would be big but our large group was unable to finish it and it was somewhat undercooked.  Understable as it is so much bigger than the standard size but still disappointing.

IuZXDw5QRaCu_PAc_4wVFQ.text: Very pleasant experience had a wonderful waiter David L who's been there for 20 years. Place was very contemporary, bathroom clean and modern. Would've been 5 stars however we received our food very late although out reservations were at 9:45, we were on time, but they bitched the order and it took another 10 min or so to receive it.  Lobster was delicious, Fillet mignon was tastefully cooked medium well, and the potatoes, perfection. Would recommend, however make your reservations a bit earlier to avoid any delays .

U0dJxM1QpR4vRgn1Y9YfRQ.text: My boyfriend took me here tonight for my birthday and we both had such a wonderful experience! Located within Caesar's, it's very convenient to all the shops.   The service here is impeccable. The waiter we had was so sweet and helpful, he really went above and beyond to make my birthday feel extra special. We were checked on often to make sure everything was perfect.  The food is also absolutely outstanding! The ahi tuna steak completely melted in my mouth. The taste was so savory, yet simple. I appreciated how it wasn't over-spiced.  The lobster Mac and cheese is absolutely and completely worth getting as a side! It is so cheesy and the lobster meat is so tender.  Kind of pricey but so worth the price for a nice dinner. The Palm is so perfect for a nice occasion- I even got a free cheesecake slice for my birthday! Thanks so much for making my birthday feel so special!

Hh7Osv2Tpn8K2vVTiZhCxQ.text: The Palm Las Vegas has effortlessly moved right on up to one of my favorite places to dine at for special occasions! My best friend decided to treat me to a dinner here for my 30th Birthday and I couldn't be any more pleased with the level of fantastic customer service and quality of food! We made reservations via opentable and arrived just a tad bit later than we put reserved and the hostess was more than understanding about it! Unlike most places, I was able to still be seated prior to my best friend arriving so I could start the ordering being that I was starving!  After being seated, our AMAZING sever Barry came over and gave us the run down about the menu and even made some great recommendations! I love when a server goes above and beyond to make sure I am happy and Barry did exactly that! We loved him!  Started out with some drinks that were concocted from the bartender featuring some whiskey and another round that had Jameson mixed with Coke! Yum!   Appetizer included a trio with Jumbo Lump Crab Cake, Bacon-Wrapped Sea Scallops and Jumbo Shrimp. 5/5  Dinner Entree's:  5lb Broiled Jumbo Nova Scotia Lobster- 5/5  22oz Prime Bone-In Rib-Eye Steak- 5/5  22oz Prime Bone-In Rib-Eye Steak "Oscar Style" w/ melted blue cheese sauce - 5/5   Overall this was one of the best meals I've had and worth all $400 spent! What made it even more special was the fact that the manager came over personally to wish me a happy birthday AND took our picture to add it on The Palm Las Vegas Instagram page! Like what?! That was so awesome I will be back for SURE!

VUflD3G9Bv-uQoD6qG1Q8g.text: Their New York Strip was great! The seasoning was on par and the waitress was polite and informed the details on what food options to choose. I liked the sides and the environment was a bit loud but overall it was a great experience.

AbYFud7wSu2ntQPWIgZJFw.text: We went here for dinner on New Year's Eve. Good thing we made a reservation because the mall was closed that night and you couldn't access any restaurant in the shoppes without checking in with security to confirm your reservation.   FOOD The food here was amazing. We have three 4-pound lobsters. They were really good and were perfectly cooked. I had the lobster bisque, again, and it was pretty good, a little salty but the presentation was spot on.   SERVICE Laura, our server, was excellent. Waters were always full and drinks kept coming. She has been working there for 15 years, and it shows. She is on point despite the fact that it was super busy. She was very nice and I will request her section next time we go in.   WINE The Palm permits you to bring your own wine and their corkage free is really reasonable, only $35. Most places usually charge $50 in Vegas.   Overall, I highly recommend coming here and ask for Laura's section when you make your reservation.

Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon Drop

pYhrNA1x3Wid-p-eT75q4g.text: I'm really surprised I haven't reviewed this place before, considering we go here every week! I guess I'm too busy eating here, than thinking about reviewing it!  My husband and I have been regulars here for the last few years. We are absolutely obsessed with the food. I've had every single thing on the menu from appetizers to dessert. We like to sit at the bar because it's very comfortable, and since they did their beautiful renovation, you get a nice view of the restaurant while facing the Forum shops.   It's hard to say what my favorites are because this is one of the cases where I really and truly love everything. If I have to pick a few, I usually get the crab cocktail as a starter. It comes with huge pieces of king crab, and something called atomic horseradish, along with their in house cocktail sauce. Atomic horseradish is not for the faint of heart! I absolutely love spicy food, so it's definitely for me. But it comes with a warning from the bartender not to use that much until you get used to it. It's nothing like anything I've ever tasted!   Other favorites are the Beef Tenderloin Carpaccio that comes with arugula, lemon, black pepper, olive oil and shaved parmigiano reggiano... so so good.   I love the Fried Calamari The portion is monstrous, it's always cuts perfection and never gummy or over chewy he comes with my favorite tomato (San Marzano) marinara sauce.  We almost always get the Baked Clams Casino or Oreganata, my husband's fav!   Once in a while, I'm in the mood for a salad, and when that moment arises, I get the "Gigi" Salad. It's huge chunks of chopped shrimp, green beans, tomato, onion, bacon, iceberg lettuce, roasted pepper, egg and avocado tossed in a garlic vinaigrette. A good tip is to order the salad dry, then ask for blue cheese crumbles and blue cheese dressing on the side. Trust me on this one.   The steaks.. well they're perfect    I could literally write about every menu item and make this review longer than anybody would ever want to read. The bottom line is to try this place and say CJ and Nikki sent you! We go so much our picture is on the wall!   And I don't want to forget to add the amazing staff! Bartenders Derrick, Vic, Kelly are fabulous, and they're lead by Larry who is an amazing GM, and his AGM Savanna is one of the best restaurant managers in town!   Enjoy this place! It's my favorite!o
