My friends and I got a table and we ordered some yummy delicious appetizers and had multiple plates!  At $3.50 each, we were living it up!  Kobe beef sliders, calamari, crabcakes and sandwich.  We were full off their appetizers!  OMG, it was absolutely perfect!  A wonderful start to kick off the weekend. The place wasn't crowded and it's located right at the beginning of the Forum shops when you enter from the casinos.  It's the first restaurant on the left hand side with the indoor patio.  it seemed like we found a hidden gem right there on the strip!  We each had a glass of white wine, riesling, to pair with our appetizers.  Our wine was full price but absolutely worth it with the value of food we got.  This place is known for being a steakhouse but this review is based on our visit for their Happy Hour.  Let me just say... you have to sample their kobe beef sliders!  Yummy! The wait staff was adorable.  They were all so friendly and helpful any time we ordered additional appetizers, drinks or help with taking pictures of our group.  My friends told them it was my birthday and they came out and sang to me and brought a cheesecake slice with candle and additional forks to share.  They took pictures with me as well.  They really treated us well and took care of us.  If I am ever there Monday -Friday, I'd definitely hit up their Happy Hour.  I plan to go back and try out one of their steak dinners though too.   My final comments on this restaurant: GO!!!!

uF33YsOSGFkgWRr27GEEPQ.text: My family has been eating here every time we make a trip to Vegas since around 2007, when we made the diaspora from the south side of the strip to the north side (we had been eating at Gallagher's for as long as I can remember and my parents were looking for a new place that served slabs of beef on a plate in a dimly lit room)  We start out usually with the seared ahi tuna (which, in my opinion, is average, but well prepared), and more importantly, CLAMS; it's a must to order both clams casino and clams oreganata. Just thinking about them make my mouth water. Juicy, buttery, creamy, garlicky, and crunchy all packed into a little morsel of bottom-of-the-sea mussel gift from Poseidon himself. What's left on the plate is a swirl of oily golden nectar, perfect for taking Palm's fresh bread slices, seeping up the juices, and inserting it straight down your throat. It's hard to not get full before your tray-tray comes (that's what I call entrees)   I used to be a sole prime-rib-only type of child, but started eating filets when we began to frequent The Palm. The problem is that when you order a Palm filet (or any filet, for that matter), you really need to add sauce or reduction because there just isn't that much flavor to the cut of meat, it's all tender, melty goodness (which is far from a bad thing). More recently, I've been eating the ribeye which is just packed with delicious meaty goodness, like a cow jumped right into your mouth and rendered it's fat and juices right on your tongue. If you don't like my imagery, it's a nice, tender, and juicy cut of meat with excellent flavor, well seasoned.   The sides are a whole 'nother ball game, large and perfect for sharing. For a party of more than 3 people, it's necessary to order the three cheese potatoes (creamy, heavy, and perfect), wild mushrooms (earthy and garlicky), the hand cut french fries (crisp and golden brown with great seasoning), and I also get a baked potato for myself and myself only (the baked potato is an ordinary, oversized steakhouse potato, but it's always necessary for me to have one at a steakhouse, weird habit)  Now for zerts I've never gotten anything else from here for dessert other than their gazillion layer chocolate fudge cake. it's one of the best chocolate cakes I've ever had the pleasure of experiencing. Moist, rich, dark, and sweet...it's incredibly difficult to finish when you eat everything that was mentioned above, but if you push yourself hard enough, you can finish it, and feel extremely guilty afterwards as you walk back to your hotel stuffed with hundreds of dollars of food in your belly thinking about all the hungry people in the world.

EdId_euSX6M47612Vy-Psw.text: Yummiest New York Steak sandwich! It's a little spicy because it has fresh dijon and wasabi. The Brooklyn cheesecake is the best cheesecake in the world. They literally fly the cheesecake in from Brooklyn, NY.

g7EjNNAKDh4hwXd-zNMiHQ.text: I had a great time at Palm!  My 'Fiance took me here because it's one of his favorite's because the food is constently great.  Went here for my birthday and sat out on the patio area.  The service and food were both very good.  Love the atmosphere out on the patio.  Ceasars is already one of my favorite Hotels - I will definately be going back to Palm.

EBDrX06OPoMYa3adQqnIlQ.text: I know Palm restaurant food. I went to the Palm in NYC as a kid in the 60s so trust me. I've been a regular for forty years. The lobster bisque was tasty but too salty. The tenderloin was very good, onion rings great. Cheesecake fantastic. Service was good but kitchen was slow. It took us 40 minutes from the time we sat down at 1.15pm for lunch to get our steaks and the place was only a third full. But a three course lunch for $23 is ok by me for this quality. This location loses points for slow kitchen and oversalted bisque. L.A. location is good but busy. NYC is still the best but even busier.  The Palm is known for lobster and  New York cut. The prime rib is ok but sort of tasteless to my mind. For goodness sake, don't be one of these people who go to a steak and lobster house and order a sandwich. I can't vouch for the quality. Nobody does everything well. The Vegas location has one big plus going for it, it's not pretentious like the L.A. location.

OmL1IqCINZcZoMYePuuXRA.text: If food were a spectator sport. Then you outta know I'm a fan of MEAT. I love beef. I even love driving by farms and cattle and watching them and anticipating end products of skirt steaks and cuts of prime rib and  bone in ribeye. Yes that's what I got. Becuase I love meat. Of all the places in the mall to eat. You would never expect  a great quality piece of cow in the Forum shops. It exists in the Palm Chophouse. Belive me the size made me quiver in my panties if I owned any. Just like any other steakhouse, everything is pretty a la carte. Some people won't admit to gluttony because it's a sin. Well. I live in Vegas. Sin City...and what happens here stays here. So screw it. I'm a sinner. Meat is good. Veggies with your meat will make you feel better about yourself. But overall yes expensive and you will pay for quality and nostalgia. It's a really cool experience given the wait staff is...well you'll see :)

TVFpcMDwSfSCwAGlCqTWkg.text: Rarely do I give a bad review for food.  However, my lunch at the Palm was so bad yesterday, I thought I should write about it.  Actually, there were 3 good things about the lunch:  the Caesar salad was way above average, pretty much excellent.  The half bottle of a great Napa Cab was an unexpected gem on the wine list.  And my server was terrific.  The bad part was the chicken parmesan.  Okay, maybe I wasn't thinking right yesterday, and I shouldn't have gone to the Palm for anything but a steak.  But this chicken was so overcooked and bland, it more than brought down the better parts of the meal.  The half and half chips and onions were equally bland and lifeless, almost stale.  And of course the linguine served with the chicken was soggy--though the sauce was okay.  I had an excellent meal at the Palm II in NY last year, so I won't give up on them completely.  If only Rao's had been open at lunch yesterday . . .

PO4jzbvwtNenRUdWUYgzqA.text: I expected more, but for the price, I guess it was ok.  Hubby and I like to have at least ONE fancy meal when we hit Vegas, and the Palm seemed like it would fit the bill.  We each had the $49 surf & turf special, which was very high quality food, but a bit bland.  Service was pretty bad.  Our server was quite friendly and outgoing - with EVERY other table BUT ours.  I was willing to shell out $$$$$ for several glasses of wine with my meal, but it took so long to get glass #2, I didn't want to invest the time and ask for a third.  Once we were ready for the check, it took him about 20 minutes to return....seriously? NOT OK.  I will not return nor recommend.

O2jn9CR4qeVF8KcVV7CWpA.text: Every time my wife and I are in Vegas we eat at the Palm.  The food at the Palm is consistenly excellent and service is always quite good and friendly.  Their business lunch specials are a good value.  Try their hearts of palm salad when you are there.  It is a great salad.

i-icW6iMS7nLooRP2xbUtQ.text: The Palm was the restaurant that we finished our Las Vegas trip with. I wish we started there. The service and the meal were excellent. A wonderful closure to a great trip.

pYh4AsjcS3aYAB2xKOWL9w.text: Great Happy Hour here. The prices go from "eeeesssshhh" to "ahhhh" during this time. We ordered one of everything on the bar's HH menu and were pleasantly surprised by the decently sized portions and reasonable prices. Our favorites were the Crab Cakes, Veal, Kobe Sliders, and the Chicken Strips. Really the only one we weren't fond of was the Capri Filet Mignon. Cold steak doesn't really appeal to me. Our bar tender was excellent. She had a full bar top, was making the entire restaurants beverages and still had time to refill our rapidly disappearing waters (105 out that day). Next time maybe I'll splurge and go for the full meal deal!

xk3T_MQSgu28nQe_KuJVEQ.text: I have been eating at the Palm forever. Tonight ranked as the worst meal ever. Started with the half & half which came so greasy that it was inedible. We ate here in November and the Gigi Salad was as good as ever. Tonight it was underdressed. Most surprising was the mushy lobster tail and tough tasteless filet. We picked this for a special family dinner and we were all disappointed. What a shame to pay so much for a mediocre meal.

T3_HEKqIIXqLqKcJhIkurw.text: One of my favorate places to eat in Las Vegas! Awesome food and atmosphere.

N1Odm6_FPh8a2xNBVtGskA.text: Every time we are in Vegas we eat the business lunch. Great price. Great food. Wonderful service. The tea is great also. Located in Caesars palace makes it a great stop after some shopping.

fd_dvG4Jl3QEVzZAME7i1Q.text: Last week I visited Las Vegas-my friend and I decided we really wanted some good seafood. Upon pulling out my handy dandy Yelp app, we came across Palm. Granted, neither of us are under 21 but I guess we still look pretty young. We ordered a bottle of the Pinot Grigio. He automatically carded us. I guess I'm not at the age where I appreciate being carded yet.. especially at a very fancy, expensive restaurant. What did he think? That we were two 19 year old girls getting dressed up and wanting to spend over $100 each just to get some booze?! I found it to be pretty tasteless since usually nicer restaurants are not supposed to do that. The thing that made it the most tasteless was his sarcastic attitude.    We ordered our main course (filet with lobster tail) and calamari as an appetizer. The calamari was way too greasy for me and the marinara sauce it came with for dipping was very bland. My friend and I both agreed on this. The main dish was delicious, we split a filet and lobster tail.   Overall the positive for me was the main dish (it was a pretty small portion since we split it). The service and the appetizer were both very average. I realize that almost everywhere you go on the strip is going to be overpriced, but damn.. this place was really overpriced! After a bottle of wine, calamari appetizer, and one entree, we ended up spending about $115 each. I would not go back.

0SVzrZezPNX88AwIQjuvig.text: I always forget how expensive this place is.  In any event, this is an annual stop for me at my Vegas trade show.    Service is always top notch and the food is good.  This time around I enjoyed the prime rib, and a shrimp cocktail.  I washed the food down with two Kettle One dirty martini's, which were made to perfection.   The cost prevents me from giving 5 stars.  As an example, my colleague and I had a drink in the bar before catching up with our party in the restaurant.  Two drinks with tip, a tad over $40!  Welcome to Vegas.

qchqaDfalywxJHjyWLV1SQ.text: This is one of our go to place in Vegas.  We like lobster here.  It is always good.  I am not too crazy about the veggies here.  I wish they would offer better choices.  One day I said this to a waiter and he suggested we try creamed corn.  Since then, that's what we get.  It is not on the menu but ask for it, they will be glad to make it for you.

aDFPwgn5DTcxzfHOG4dtLw.text: We went for the wonderful late night happy hour, except it starts at 9:30 and in a town like Vegas, they're already trying to close shorty after.  We walked in at 10:15ish on a Friday night and were told the kitchen was closed.  Come on!  I asked them to serve us and found out that the kitchen was actually open, she just didn't want to serve us (she eventually warmed up).  I soon realized while trying to enjoy some food, that the staff hates their customers and endlessly bitches about people coming in late (but they were seated so the restaurant was obviously still open).  One server was so angry that a table kept ordering bottles of wine and food.  He'd rather go home 45 minutes (too) early than make a $100-$200 tip?  Silly boy.  The happy hour food menu was $5/dish and that's amazing!  We had 3 Angus sliders, 3 very high quality lobster sliders, and 3 crab cakes all for $15!!!! Wow!  The crab cakes were shamelessly small but still worth the price, burgers were good quality but nearly bite sized, and the lobster was fresh and tasted wonderful.  I'd go back if the timing was perfect, but I'll lower my expectations about the staff and their vocal chatter.  Too bad because this is The Palm, not some crappy chain restaurant.

_e4ci4FXFBwfx0X3Zi7wjw.text: This place was wonderful. Starting w service, our server was knowledgable, timely, patient and fun. We also had a great conversation w the host.  Our food was excellent, seasoned and cooked perfectly.  There was an array of bread in the basket, the butter was wonderful, the bread I chose was good, but not my favorite. Only other complaint is the bacon wrapped scallop was slightly tough, but still wonderful. The shrimp appetizer was delicious down to the sauce. The crab cake possibly the best I've ever had, and I used to live in Baltimore, no fillers. My friend had the veal Marsala, said it was amazing. I had the ahi app as my main course, it was perfect and the wasabi was so fresh and spicy! We got the wild mushroom side, a little buttery for me but also very good.  We'd definitely go back if we didn't want to try every restaurant in Vegas!

S2TMh6N14M5mM00RUgr_yQ.text: Superb! Nice feel in this finely decorated Restaurant. Service was perfect. Thanks Charles! Every morsel of our Dinners was done to a perfection. I had a Monday Night Salad. This best perfectly chopped Salad I've ever had. My entree was the Seared Ahi Steaks and were perfectly prepared Sushi grade Ahi Steaks on a sliced cucumber ocean salad. Amazing. With a side of Brussels. I was in Heaven!

2b4tW8dLU27RwknT01uNhQ.text: Ahi tuna was amazing. Linguini with clam sauce was perfect. Palm margarita was awesome. Service was great. Will be back next time we are in vegas.

dbZ6mQJD6JSkRyZ2_MKi5g.text: I love great service and Palm Restaurant definitely offers that!  The lobster is fantastic and Lobster Fest (the month of August) is a great time to visit.  I love that they are so happy to split everything for those that are sharing.  I do believe that they have THE BEST caesar salad in Las Vegas, oh my!!  The lobster bisque is an incredible way to start your meal and you will probably want to lick the bowl.  Fantastic selection of wines.  The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is due to the lack of fantastic side dishes.  I always expect them to be amazing but the description always makes them sound better than they are.  Skip the side dish and have the caesar salad, lobster bisque and lobster!! That's where it's at.

xghEZ9lRGr4NoaJ4VCCFtA.text: This was a disappointing experience for our group.  We selected this restaurant as it looked like the menu had many options as well as thought it would be a nice dining experience.  Our server was so frantic, rushed, seemed annoyed by our presence, and had absolutely no input or anything to say about the menu or things that we were debating between.  His assistance was the only real saving grace for the service (wish I knew her name).  She was friendly, actually took the time to take a photo of us (the server would have not done this I'm sure), brought us additional bread, etc.  The atmosphere itself was completely chaotic with the staff racing around the restaurant like crazy people.  The noise volume was off the charts which made it hard to have conversation without feeling like we were shouting across the table.  It was definitely not what we expected.  The food was ok.  My filet was cooked perfectly and was delicious as a stand alone as the sauce I selected (brandy peppercorn) was salty and just plain gross.  The asparagus was bland and flavorless, the goat-cheese mashed were good although not off the charts, the mushrooms were disgusting - they were sent back.  The chicken parmesan was pretty good although it was covered in sauce and the presentation was lacking in most of the dishes.  If you want something mediocre at best, than it would be fine but it is not a restaurant that I would recommend and definitely won't be back.  There are so many amazing places to eat in Vegas and I'm seriously sorry we wasted one of our dining experiences here.

jPxO-XMcn2c31Ynbw3khnA.text: OK, this is my new favorite restaurant!  I've been dying to try this place for awhile, but I knew it was pricey.  Everytime I walk through the Caesars Forum Shops, I always glance over and then look away, not wanting to tempt myself but always saying, "I want to try that place."  Tonight, I did.  The restaurant had a sign out front advertising some sort of happy hour menu, so I went inside to investigate.  They call it "Prime Time," and it's a menu of 7 items normally priced around $10-$12, but from 5pm-7pm and 9pm-close those items are only $3.50!  I tried the filet mignon capri sandwiches per the bartender's recommendation, and they were delicious.  Three slider-style sandwiches on a bed of homemade potato chips.  The waitress also sold me on getting a couple of $2 shrimp cocktail, which were monstrous and I would say the best I have ever had.  Other items on the cheap-o menu include kobe beef sliders, "ultimate" chicken strips, mini broiled crab cakes, veal parmigiana sliders, "Point Judith" calamari fritti, and prime cheese steak.  They also have oysters on the half shell for $1 apiece.  Unfortunately, my appetite would not allow me to continue eating, but I promised the bartender that I'd be back.  Speaking of which, the service was fantastic.  The bartender's name was Jax, and she made up for the last few days of poor service I've been getting elsewhere.  I also signed up for their membership card -- it costs $25, and you get points for money spent at their restaurants.  When you sign up, they give you a $25 gift card, so it's essentially free, as long as you plan to come back a second time, which I definitely will.  The card apparently also gets you some sort of food specials, depending on when you come in.  I peeked at the full menu before leaving and all I remember seeing is the lobster for 2 special that's listed at the top of the Twitter page.  I thought it was a few dollars cheaper, but $90 for a 4 pound lobster, 2 salads, and a side.  When Restaurant Week is over, I'll be trying this one.  Did I mention that this is my new favorite restaurant, yet?

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Prime Time&#34; menu
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My &#34;Prime Time&#34; menu selection: $2 for each shrimp, $3.50 for 3 filet mignon sliders, and $12 for a glass of wine.

33DlTjT6k0m1jPsdCX7k9g.text: Love our server, Ruan (spelt with a R). He was incredible and so fun! He earned the extra star! My Cobb salad that he recommended was one of the best ever once he suggested their house blue cheese dressing. The dressing that was on it originally lacked a bit in flavor. My other half had the soup, and it was a bit salty. Ruan could tell he wasn't crazy about it and brought him another without us even asking! The other soup was also a bit salty. Delicious bread brought to our table. 2 on the soups, 4 on the salads. Would come back again!

whLVubf-RqyeGGzqoK-s5g.text: This place deserves 0 stars! They refused service to my family on Christmas Day for dinner because we had kids. Even though I made reservation on Opentable at 4:30 pm, they claimed that they can't take us since they are full. They kept saying Opentable made a mistake and we should not have been able to make the reservation. When I looked in more than half the restaurant was empty. This place is evil!!!

mbkc2doUT0NOjit4ra2gMw.text: I had lunch here today and it was the worst salad I have ever eaten and the service experience didn't make it better. I ordered the lump crab on romaine salad. I asked for the dressing on the side. The bar tender took my order and told me that she would bring out some bread as well. When my salad came out,  no bread had been served.   I looked at my salad and although the dressing was on the side, the plate was swimming in oil. My salad was also supposed to have goat cheese. I told he bar tender and she promptly brought me the cheese. When when brought me the cheese she gave the excuse that the kitchen staff was just waking up and that is why my order was wrong. Also,the cheese the kitchen served had started to go bad. When the bar tender came back, she never asked me how my food was when it was clear that I had picked all around my plate to avoid the oil and the spoiling cheese. Never going back.

Si2caHxVPqt7pzHE54pjdw.text: Great ribeye  and bread.The steak wss 1,000 Times better than my recent one at Berns Tampa!

RLirO_vTuoLNYTBUI0-tlg.text: Bryan is amazing! As a server myself, I always unknowingly and unfortunately critique how people serve me when I'm out at restaurants, but Bryan completely surpassed my expectations! I aspire to serve like him. The food was amazing and the drinks were better. I highly recommend this to people who want to have a good time. Ask for Bryan!!

9ub1Bwhv17raS9EMtVLeGQ.text: How do you describe perfection, excellence, and professionalism??!! That is exactly what you can expect from the Palm Restaurant in Las Vegas!  This is a True 5 star establishment!  My family and friends traveled from 4 different states to celebrate our daughters 21st birthday.  We chose the Palm Restaurant to host our daughters birthday celebration.  Before I give any details please keep in mind that the manager of the Palm Restaurant, Lawrence Close, kept a close eye on our party, making sure everything was perfect!! On a whim, the night before our reservation, I stopped by the restaurant around 6pm, to see if I could pre order some wines and appetizers that would be on the table when my guests arrived.  I was told to ask for Adrianna because she is the person who takes car of large parties.  Adrianna came down immediately and gave me her undivided attention!  I was so impressed!  I did not hake an appointment but she sat down and took the time to meet with me!  This was above and beyond as she had another engagement to attend to but still took the time to meet with me! By the way, Adrianna is phenomenal!  She knows the menu, and as a former wine director, knows her wine! She helped me choose delicious appetizers and affordable wines to have on the table when my guests arrived! Her suggestions were phenomenal!!  The wine and apps were amazing!  We had oysters orenganata, clams casino, scallops wrapped in bacon, and the fried calamari. All were spectacular!! The clams were phenomenal! The calamari was so good, not bready at all, just a light coating that was delicious! BTW...the marinara that accompanies the calamari is soo good!  We asked for an extra serving:)!     Our wine was 5 star!  We started with Prosecco to make a birthday toast.  I loved what Adrianna suggested! Our red wine was Dona Paula Malbec, and our white was Winter Hill Sauvignon Blanc.  Both were excellent and paired perfectly with our food! Before I go on, I need to recognize our server Elaina!! She was THE BEST!!  She has been with the Palm Restaurant for 14 years and knows exactly how to run a perfect party!  She knew what time to bring each app, salad, entree, and dessert!  She also timed drinks perfectly with the food!  She is definitely  the server to ask for!!  The dinner was beyond exceptional! My daughter and I split the 6 pound lobster! It was phenomenal!  The lobster was from Nova Scotia and was excellent! Very tender and so sweet!!  The men ordered steaks which they are still raving about!! We ordered all of the sides, creamed spinach, wild mushrooms, mashed potatoes with cheese, and brussels sprouts.  I spoke to my niece earlier and she was still raving about the sides! They were just that good!!  When it came time for dessert our wonderful waitress Elaina, brought out an enormous piece of chocolate layer cake with a candle on it for my daughter! We all sang happy birthday and willingly helped the birthday girl eat the delicious cake!  The attentive and professional manager, Lawrence  Close continually monitored our party making sure we were raving fans - which we were!! I can't say enough good things about my experience at the Palms Restaurant!!! The food and drinks were amazing!  The customer service from the manager and staff were the best I have experienced!  I compare them with my visits to Peter Lugers, Capitol Grille, Smith and Wollenskys!  The Palm Restaurant was superior in every way!!    It was wonderful  seeing the smile on my daughters face!!! Knowing that every person in our party was a raving fan of the Palm Restaurant tells us that this restaurant truly earned all 5 stars!!  Thank you again Lawrence Close!!!

GXKOj6ZK8sg3PzsVHSOxzw.text: Worst "premium" steak experience I've ever had. Flavorless and tough filet, and guest had a ribeye that was pure grizzle.   After telling the server, she offered to rectify it with a free coffee... Which was slightly more flavorful than water... Then brought a $200 lunch bill to the table.   Would never go back... Go to Prime at Bellagio or Capital Grill.

wZrIjXPypBg7gNhh4v-DTA.text: LOBSTER, LOBSTER, LOBSTER....READ ALL ABOUT IT!    Okay I've been meaning to write this review for awhile, but keep forgetting.  My hubby took me here when he was trying to impress me and I was SOO craving Lobster. He kept raving about the steaks here, but I my first Love is Seafood particularly Lobster and then steak.  Well I had some other things here and he had the steak, which I remember tasting delicious, but the One thing I do still dream about was the fresh 6 lb lobster.  Yes I did say 6 lb Lobster.  We got there a little late and we asked about their lobsters, they said the smaller ones were all gone.  Let me tell you, I ATE Every Morsel of that heavenly seafood God.. MMM..MMM..MMM.. so foodgasmic!  And the cost of $120 for it was WELL DAM WORTH IT!...Now will my hubby be taking me out there for lobster again?..Heck No..Thank god I was able to experience this when I did, because these days our budget eatings cut in half..lol

FjZHJty7uKpXADVbNeugmg.text: While I'm glad we went and sampled the wide variety of fare, I felt the poor service left us with a bad taste. Typically Vegas service is top shelf but this was a mess. Waited forever to order. Then another eternity for our food to be served. And the topping on that was- our order was wrong. Find was good and fresh just won't do it again.

nJzt-M-4FlAtVxmtJH1-BQ.text: Bravo! Excellent food and a wonderful service Max and Lopez were incredible servers, they made our evening relaxed fun and delicious! The sides were fresh and the steak and crab(my wife had the Fillet with Crab) were spectacular and at a great club 837 price of $40. each what a great deal!! Mario Battalie should go eat at the Palm then close up shop at Carnevinos, comparatively his restaurant was an embarrassment!!! Go Palm!!!

UTwSkpZ98ef-__ly6sG99A.text: Uber expensive but what isn't in Vegas? I had the 24 ounce Ribeye and it was the bomb. Not $49 worth but great for Vegas. Good service, nice time for 8 dudes eating big steaks.

PQ6g1R7oWu8CQP3hJ0ViyQ.text: Love, love, love this restaurant.  I've had so many special times at the restaurant with great friends and loved ones.  It is loud and bustling - they brought the ambiance of NYC from their original place.  Superb steaks.  Just terrific - no other way to describe it.

N1MN0ZsszwTrSfgHWR_Mwg.text: I was very disappointed with this restaurant and for the first time let down by reviews for this restaurant. The ambiance was very nice, but our waiter, an older gentlemen I was expecting to be a pro, first let my husband and I down by only telling us of their summer lobster special was that it would save us $50. We love lobster, but decided against it thinking it would be a whole lobster we would have to break apart ourselves (let's just say the last place I ordered a whole lobster turned into an extremely messy and unpleasant affair). However, as we waited for a very long time for our beverages to arrive, we watched waiters bringing food to nearby tables and saw the lobster special. It was already split and the waiter even broke apart the rest of the lobster for you and took away the shells upon service of your food. We were a little mad our waiter did not tell us this, it would have been a selling point for us. Anyway, as a starter I ordered a Garden Salad with the Garlic Vinaigrette on the side, which was really pure oil, not even good tasting extra virgin olive oil.... It made me upset to my stomach. As an entree, I had the broiled crab cakes, which were okay. My husband had a steak, he also thought was okay, but after having a steak at the Mesa Grill the previous night he thought his steak at Palm did not compare. Overall, this was not a good experience especially, for the cost of the meal.

WLKiMmvfGS_pNPDdeQ3oIg.text: I miss this place.  It's been awhile.  Wow, I always forget that you can smoke in restaurants here.  No smoke police around.   Anyway, the food is awesome.  I only had a problem with the size of my filet.  I'm on vacation what the Hell am I going to do with the leftovers.  I don't mind paying the price, but chill on the portion.  I don't need the whole cow.  I can feed a small army on my dinner or 1 sumo wrestler. You know I will be back.

plPp9tZNl09z9pSKeE34zA.text: No longer as inspired, service is aloof at best.  I used to look forward to power lunch specials but they seem off par lately and filet is no longer offered on the $25 business lunch.  Last time we ate here, steaks were grisly and tough - quality control?

IgkDYXTO6XP7VGi6xIOJbw.text: best steakhouse in vegas. i know everyone has their own favorite steak in sin city, but this is where i like to go. last year i almost flew a boyfriend to vegas just to go to The Palm for dinner on his birthday. its that good.

xtHhErjqRwdt_iVP3mwlrg.text: I was looking forward to the Palm. Having visited there before it has been a place for melt in your mouth steaks.This time was a huge let down. The calamari was overcooked and bland, I had to salt it. I planned on ordering the 9 oz. filet but the waiter told us it was "Restaurant Week" and we had a few options. I chose the Palm salad and filet with bearnaise sauce with crab meat. A dinner guest ordered the lobster bisque as his starter.  I of course had to try the bisque because they have one of the yummiest. Well this one was barely warm and not the bisque I've had in the past. It tasted pre-made, like they order it frozen and reheat. The crab on my steak was cold and fishy, my steak was chewy even though it was cooked perfectly. We didn't visit there because it was restaurant week, we just thought the special offer sounded great. I mean if they're going to cut corners they should serve a smaller steak instead of mediocre everything. I would have gladly paid 43$ for a great steak instead of 39.95 for what's supposed to be the same steak with sauce on it.  I also had to salt everything. I never salt my food. So Palm, you were a let down and I don't know if I'll visit next time I'm in town with so many new places to choose from.

rGFpOTCTAZm1Kd0dyQmQeA.text: i wouldn't say this is the best steakhouse in vegas (see delmonico), but i did have a 5 star worthy steak, along with professional and authentic (read: new yorker) waiter.  having lived a half block from palm and palm2 on 45th street for several years, i was not disappointed.  this place is not the same "sawdust on the ground" type new york institution, but still is a great steakhouse nonetheless.

N5GRREq9vyvawrTN40VPeQ.text: Hey, it's a Palm.  We got great service - no complaints.  A couple of bone-in rib eyes hit the table that were pretty good.  And a couple of steak specials - the bone-in filet mignons were above average.  Having been to Mastro's in Beverly Hills a week earlier made this a tough comparison.

Sfuy0FM31sFDcaHIcneJ8w.text: Food is good, in a traditional way. No surprise. There are so many steak house in the trip to choose. But the receiption desk was the place need to get improve. The check in process is painfully slow, the guests are blocking the entrance. I guess they assume that their customers get the whole night to give to the dinner. Only the problem is in Las Vegas, there are tons of shows that people try to go. The receiption creatatively without asking to put us to wait even there were many tables and two groups behinds us seated before us. We seated until we asked, then there is no sincere appologies, the manager wasn't care....From that point, my husband, a poor die heart fan of Palm in Philly, was completely turned down.

g6-5ILkFbYGzwT_MzdgoYQ.text: I'll be quick: The food was great...except for the steak and the clams we ordered as appetizer.  I really enjoyed the bread (yes, i know it's free, but it's important) and the mashed potatoes and the mushroom sides were out of this world yummy yummy yummy.  The service was very good - the waiter was nice and helpful, he cut up our steak in two and brought it on separate plates (since we were splitting).  We ordered only one glass of wine, trying to keep the price down, but it was brought out in a little decanter and was enough for two full glasses - it worked out great!  The only thing - our steak was a bit overcooked (16oz sirloin at $40), but that maybe because they misunderstood our desire for medium as a medium well....  The clams oregano were a bit too oily and bread crumby.  In general, it was a good experience with large portions. (Price: $100 approx for one glass of wine, appetizer, $40 steak entree, 2 sides)

Sq500RiXY7Kf4vmxLE2Bdw.text: Pretty good steakhouse. Went here with a large group for a business dinner. The service was great. Very fast and efficient, which can be a challenge with a large group. The food was good. I had the sea bass, which I don't normally do at a steak house but I had had a big lunch. The sea bass was good, slightly on the bland side. The steak oscar which I think was a special and included a steak and lobster was awesome from what I hear. Bites were shared and all agreed it was delicious. The sides were good, nothing really stood out. What did stand out were the desserts. The carrot cake was off the charts from what I'm told. I didn't try that one because I had my hands full with the chocolate cake. This thing looked like rich top soil, it was so dark. The serving size was HUGE. The table of some 12 ordered one carrot cake and one chocolate cake to share and we couldn't finish either even though they were spectacular. I think I could have mustered up the courage to finish the chocolate cake but I didn't want to go into a food coma. The chocolate cake is very moist and nearly melts in your mouth with deliciousness.

mbykGLViSdX-RbprUfNxYA.text: Let me just start out by saying that we were seated outside of the restaurant on their 'patio' that looks out onto the shops in Caesar's Palace.  This felt like eating at a food court to me, so I was in kind of a strange mood, but I decided to be open minded.  Two dirty martinis helped me lighten up a good bit, so once the food started coming around I was a very happy fellow.  I ordered a Monday Night Salad, which, for what I paid for it should have been better; it was average at best.  When the meal finally came out, I was basically in glutton heaven.  We ordered (for a table of 4), a 6 lb. lobster and a bone-in rib-eye with three sides (three-cheese potatoes, creamed spinach, and brussel sprouts served with lobster in a madeira wine sauce).  The lobster was phenomenal and they left the roe in the body cavity so that made it that much more decadent!  The steak was good, but came out a bit cooler than I had hoped for.  The sides, well, you read the description earlier; they were flavorful and heavy and terrible for me, but delicious.  After that meal I needed a nap, but we sat and I finished my big glass of wine while my crazy father ordered dessert!  The food here is nothing revolutionary, but it comes in big portions and is very tasty.  Maybe not worth the bill at the end, but I had a nice time, so put a price-tag on that!

ee4p16O08vDVW5O2ZqBUsw.text: Good food and service...but over-priced and over-rated. This location is far better than the famous celebrity-studded West Hollywood spot both in food quality and service. Having an expense account or a friend/relative treat is the best way to experience the Palm!

5N7N8FRmTKsLGz2NjIrVWA.text: I dined here for lunch while picking up tickets to a show at the box office. I have always heard of The Palm, but never experienced it before. I always see their products at home goods lol. I started with the lobster bisque. The waitress poured it table side on top of a pile of lobster meat. DELISH! We both ordered a $22 lunch deal that included a steak, side and a salad. I was definitely a good deal for the food included. I ate the skirt steak that tasted like more of a Latin preparation with onions and peppers than an American steakhouse.  It came with an avocado which felt like an odd combination, but it worked. I enjoyed it. We chose the Brussels sprouts and half and half potatoes as our sides. The vegetables were great, but the potatoes looked like fried potato scraps and chips. Nothing special or appetizing about it. The restaurant definitely has an old school feel. The service was good, but slow. I wouldn't go out of my way to dine here, but if you're in the area or shopping at the Forums, it seems like a reliable choice.

4k5TGJ3USytiqEpn8Z4cGw.text: If you frequent this restaurant enough, management bestows their highest honor to its loyal patrons - your caricature prominently displayed on the wall.   They don't however bestow any awards for those who attempt to eat directly from their plate, as if in a pie eating contest. But then they don't throw you out either.  I know this after two successive years of waking up the next morning with garlic mashed potatoes in my hair and eyebrows.  If you dine here, and perchance exceed the 10mg suggested dose for marijuana edibles just a skosh, say by 200 mg, don't ask to be seated on the patio. In fact don't ask to be seated anywhere.  Get back to your hotel room post-haste and enjoy the total body paralysis that WILL be your weekend. I think that's why management didn't boot me. They probably got a good laugh out of all the Forum Shops passersby who laughed at my potato coiffe.  My friends loved the experience, said the service and food was excellent.  Especially my buddy, the one whose picture is on the wall in the bar area.  I do recall that much - laughing at the size of his teeth until I Chris Reev'd out.  I'm going to have a damned good talk with my neighbor who gave me the edibles. Apparently, his cancer is no match for my sciatica.  PS. I did find a petite filet (9 oz) in my cargo shorts the next day. It was cooked Pittsburgh style absolutely perfectly.  Big shout out to the chef, and to a lesser extent, Polo.

sz190WejcgPMLizVqIsOyQ.text: Oh My Gosh Do I LOVE This Place!  This past Vegas trip (Oct. 2013) me and the boyfriend decided to branch away from the group of 15 we were with and do a date night at Cesar's Palace since it was close to our hotel (The Palazzo) and after numerous restaurant suggestions from my girlfriend Mochi who lives there, I ended up choosing The Palm restaurant located in Cesar's Palace right in the beginning of the Forum shops. We made reservations through open table and got a table within 45 minutes of booking it.   The place is kind of loud so we opted to sit outside where it was a lot quieter and a nicer view. We both weren't that hungry so we decided to share a salad and an entree.  What I love about this place: 1.) The Chilean sea bass ($37) 2.) Mixed green salad ($11.50) 3.) The ambiance 4.) Workers 5.) THE FREE BREAD they give and whip butter (I had to ask our waiter twice to refill our basket---especially with the sweet raisin cinnamon bread)  Don't be like us and forget to use your rewards card for points and discount!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy Chilean sea bass
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Zg4T2MyniGL9hD4yGFHXCA.text: This was my first meal in Vegas at Ceasar's Palace. We sat out on the patio (which I highly suggest), because it makes for great people watching in a place that is known for attracting nearly all walks of life.   The service at Palm Restaurant was excellent. We had an older either Russian or Italian server, and unlike a lot of other fine-ish dining resturants where a bus boys ends up being the one serving the table, he was very attentive the entire time and knew the menu like the back of his hand.   I was with three friends and we ordered three salads and split the three-pound lobster. The salads were pretty average (I mean really, how can you get that crafty with a salad) and the lobster was just ok too, however it did feed all of us comfortably.   Having been spoiled with some really fresh seafood in my lifetime, I will say this lobster wasn't the freshest thing I've ever tasted. While it did taste good, it was lacking that just-out-of-the-ocean taste that food at some other seafood restaurants has.  Overall, the Palm serves average food with great service at a high price point. With the competition for dining in Vegas, it's like Yelp says, A-OK.

fHLKXZjb086eib7JMur9dw.text: Creamed corn was the best ever!  Filet was delicious (but not the best ever).  Nice atmosphere in the Forum shop mall.

fKEvYGNaDv4dI3is59yPGA.text: Standard service not bad not exceptional.  She had the Zinfandel I had the Stella, mine was better but Zinfandel is tasty...  Shared a small Caesar salad just ok not really impressed and actually kind of disappointed.  Shared small 3 cheese potatoes au gratin, good.  She had the 14 oz NY strip, yum!  I had the 14 oz filet mignon, good but not wow her's was better...think I'm a NY strip man for a while.  Had my filet oscar style with crab meat, asparagus and hollandaise sauce. Sauce just ok, crab meat good not great not "fresh" asparagus was average.  All in all 3.5 but rounding up because it's Christmas lol. LA location made for better food and more memorable experience.  $187 with tip...I expected a ill bit more... Again 3.5 but rounding up and thus not posting a 3 star review...

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner #yum

_Yz17PE2xd-aBYblHC9H5Q.text: We went on a Thursday night, 8:45 reservations, large group of 14. The restaurant had maybe three other tables as well as ours, I would not consider it busy. There was a party going on in one of the private rooms. They took our order and it went downhill from there. It seemed the entire time as if they had something better to do. One person's order came out wrong, they never checked on us, refilled wine, they just left us there. The food for what we paid for it was just meh. I've had way better. They knew they were separating the checks, gratuity was added (as usual for such a large group) but somehow they added the entire gratuity to one person's check, but no gratuity was added to our check. When we questioned it they got upset. They even went as far as to ask one of the people in the party if that was all they were going to tip! But they did take our checks back and fix it (I think, the jury is still out on that one). We left and made it all the way down to where Smashburger and Starbucks was and a waiter chased me down yelling my name asking me if we paid! Yes, not only had we paid, but also my husband tipped on top of the added gratuity. I told them they had been paid plenty. I will never return. I have had far better food and service in Las Vegas.

v4yAKxjO18UEQGv_8W3cBA.text: We were a party of four before the Absinthe show on July 4th. The restaurant is beautifully decorated with extremely accommodating wait staff. It is very pricey with huge portions but well worth every bite. We had lobster and our friends had steak. They served us quickly. We thoroughly enjoyed our experience at this restaurant.

yYECX6BqEOhvy97G9ujeNQ.text: Great service tonight by David Lopez! He really made our dining experience fun and he helped choose some great dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great service deserves a kiss of appreciation! David

VM8rpWvtohfiQs_fy9SvYg.text: What's a Vegas trip without stopping by a great steakhouse by the forum shops at Caesars?! Usually we try and switch it up with other restaurants in the area as we tend to stay at Caesars the few times we go every year. This past time we decided to try out this place other guests were raving about.    We started with the "Monday Night Salad". With the right amount of anchovies and roasted red peppers with a nice creamy bleu cheese dressing this salad was a hit amongst the other patrons at the table. Other people in our party got the Caesar salad which they seemed to enjoy as well and we're happy the anchovies came on the side.   For another appetizer, we elected to get two lobsters for the table to share. The server explained they were 3 lb. freshly broiled Nova Scotia lobsters. I felt these would have been very good however, they may have been broiled a tad too long leaving the inside a little dry. Still good nevertheless but could have been great! Would like to try this again next time we visit and give this item another chance.  Steaks were all very good. Sides excellent. All patrons in party pleased and stuffed! Had to walk around the casino a couple times to digest. Will definitely be back in the upcoming year.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome bibs! Nobody got dirty that&#39;s for sure
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 lb. lobster!

18AGGwLtdBsZQ52Oc8yDTQ.text: Had my birthday dinner here and it was amazing! The lobster and steak was cooked perfectly! The staff was efficient, courteous and fun! Kellie the Assistant General Manager went out of her way to make sure my birthday was special, and it was!! Thank you! PS. If your craving something spicy ask for the Kellie potatoes their awesome!

cdttQWIqkgSvoVhnVf_-GA.text: Ruben and I joined another fun couple to take advantage of the Restaurant Week menu tonight. We sat inside and ordered drinks to start. I had the PALM REFRESH (vodka, muddled basil, etc) and it was tasty and refreshing (haha)!   After looking at the menus, we asked our server for the Restaurant Week menu. He not only proceeded to look at me like I was crazy, but actually said, "What are you talking about??? What is that? What are you saying?" Not sure why he got so upset. So, instead of continuing this frustrating discussion, I started to bring the page up on my phone. Our friend, Diana, ended up asking the young lady that brought our water and fortunately, she knew exactly what we were talking about and graciously brought us menus. No apologies from our server. He seemed really confused about a lot of things and was also argumentative, absentminded, and not entirely friendly. We tried joking with him to lighten the mood or to show that we had forgiven his prior offenses, but it didn't do much.  We all did the RW prie fixe and an order of CALAMARI FRITTI. The portion was extremely generous! The calamari was not fresh and completely lacked in flavor though. I think it was served with marinara and it was not good. For the first course, Ruben got the LOBSTER BISQUE and it was all right, just unfortunately salty. I chose the ROASTED BEET AND GOAT CHEESE SALAD; the beets were nice and overall, the salad was good, however, the goat cheese was just okay and the arugula was weighed down by the amount of dressing.  I ordered the FILET MIGNON, single cut served with Goat Cheese Whipped Potatoes and Wild Mushroom & Black Truffle Demi as my second course. The filet was dry and not flavorful; I also ordered medium rare and it obviously wasn't. The whipped potatoes were really delicious and the Demi was good. Ruben had the CHICKEN PARMIGIANA; the Linguine Marinara was good - cooked perfectly al dente, simple sauce, and fresh basil, however, the chicken was disappointing.  For dessert, everyone chose the NEW YORK STYLE CHEESECAKE and I chose the KEY LIME PIE. They were both really great! The cheesecake was light, crumbly, not too dense, the crust was wonderful, and I loved the compote with it. Perfect. The key lime pie wasn't overly tart, same wonderful crust, great flavor. Nice berry compote too.  The good: generous portions, dessert. The bad: service, food quality and overall taste. I'd rather pay more money for better food, so the plate sizes are a petty matter and comparatively, there are much better Italian restaurants (Ferraro's!) and Steakhouses in town. Also, let your servers know when you're participating in a week-long event as to avoid an awkward situation with your patrons!

ClW7YK22WwVuJQhIDMU7UA.text: We've dined at The Palm several times for both lunch and dinner.  This steakhouse is obviously very famous and has a great location near the entrance to the Forum Shops from the casino at Caesars.  If I had to give one tip, it would be not to forget about this place for lunch.  Excellent burgers, I'm partial to blue cheese, which is of excellent quality here.  It's more expensive than other lunches, but it's certainly worth it.  At dinner, the wine list is solid, but certainly not the best on the strip.  The crabcake is solid.  The chipotle tartar sauce is a welcome departure from the usual sauce.  It has a nice flavor with some kick, but certainly not too much.  Potatoes au gratin probably our favorite side.  The steaks are all prime.  You don't need a sauce, but the best one I've had here is the brandy peppercorn.  Neither ingredient is overpowering, but both are certainly there.  It's a nice achievement.  I request that you order fried onions to eat with your steak.  They are very thin and the juice from the steak soaks into the onions, which brings the two together.  Every lobster we've ordered here has been perfectly prepared, hot and tender.    In the end, it's not a cheap meal, but it's very good quality and you won't regret it.

NO1NdNQ7k-Buy507CO7FGg.text: We stay at Caesar's every year and every year we go to the Palm.  The Palm is always fantastic.  The food is amazing, but what makes the Palm truly excellent is the staff.  Last year we were waited on by Barry (and I meant to post something a year ago but never got around to it).  This year we were waited on by Ruan (I hope I have his name right- energetic man from Brazil).  Both waiters read our group right and made perfect suggestions.  They were knowledgeable and attentive without being intrusive.    We like to mix it up every year and try new places.  This restaurant is always at the top of the list, and honestly, better than high end places at the Venetian and other high end hotels.  Next year's stay in Vegas will include a trip to the Palm.  We hope to see Barry or Ruan again, but I'm sure we will be pleased with any of the staff.

Iq5JFjRmRFj9OhzJhlcUfQ.text: Came to Vegas for Thanksgiving and decided to have dinner at The Palm as we eat at the one in Beverly Hills all the time. We had the absolute best meal but by far the best part of the meal was the service we got. Martha and Kaylee were two of the best servers I have ever experienced. I eat out at least 5 meals a week and have never experienced better service in my life. I will come back to The Palm in Vegas every time I am here based solely on the service we received.

2FQK5nxSM9O9Tj4IJ2kmJg.text: Great food. Excellent service by Anna! She was super helpful from picking out the wine to our entrees!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SMMs8MsE-mkgiU1BBI9bjg.text: The Two Stars are for the servers that try their best.  This used to be my favorite place for all special occasions. Not anymore.  I went their for my birthday, as they gave a free lobster dinner. The old saying, "A Free Meal Tastes Better" , only applies to a cheap acquaintance, not me.   The Lobster, that my wife shared, was very sad. Their special, a Bone in Filet, was Sizzler Quality, not worth the $60, not worth half the price.   The Bread Basket is still one of the best in town. That's about it.   It is obvious that this place has either gone "corporate", or just like most Las Vegas places on the Strip, does not care about repeat business, and certainly could care less about locals.  The last draw was when I wanted to have a special dinner, after my wedding ceremony.  We walked in on President's Day, and were told the person in charge of Banquets was off, and only she had the schedule. Holiday, fair enough.  The next day I called, and no reply. I called the manager, he couldn't help me. I did not get a call back for four days, by which time, I chose another place.  The only reason I am not sending a nasty letter to Corporate is because, first, it will do no good. Second, they will still send me a free lobster dinner for my birthday, and I will give it to my son, to impress some girl.  Here's what sums up my feeling;  My sister gave us a $200 Palm Gift Card for a wedding gift. I told my wife to take her friends there.   NO way will I ever eat there again!!!!!  Try Del Frisco's. Much better quality and value, and they want your business.   These folks could care less.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZJPwwUrZr8OnvmIOCoz1tQ.text: Delicious from start to finish. The bread basket had a great variety but the pretzel roll was the best. Our server recommended the filet and lobster tail. For $49 we thought this was a great deal. The meal was perfect and we thoroughly enjoyed our experience here. With so many options in vegas, this restaurant is definitely one you should consider.

FsSBzuOSda1NOJD5ktITOA.text: Was in town for a friends 40th bday this weekend. I had eaten here before several times in the past couple of years I come to the LV and always with a reservation. I raved to my buddies that were I was with how great this place was!!!! Well again they didn't disappoint!!! It was full as usual and I ask the gentleman at the front can you sit 4, he was polite and answered let me see what I can do. Not even 5 min later I hear "right this way sir". The treatment here is as if they know you've been here from previous dining!!   I proceeded to order ask the waiter if there was any Prime Rib left...oh I forgot to mention it was 10pm when this all occurred. The waiter says sir it's to late I think we have run out...let me check. He comes back and says there is 1 piece left that chef has saved for himself, but he is willing to part with it if you eat the whole thing....I said bring it on. My boyz order New York's and all the food arrived as order and we all ate happily ever after!!! This place is the one of the best!!! If I had room for a 5lbs lobster I would of gone for it but the Prime rib cut was overly huge!!! Thanks again Palms!!  Great food, great service.

rMSZg_Vd0wav91dbCTgp5A.text: Used to b better. I don't want to give them a bad review but they forgot the salad. The potatoes au gratin was liquid potato salad. I ll quit here cause I am not a hater.

XMHBEkG5gVafrv6PY4PqNA.text: We stopped by on a Sunday at noon for lunch. Ruan, our waiter, was fantastic! He was attentive but not pushy, gave us a lot of good ideas about the menu options and treated us (including our two kids) very nicely.   We enjoyed the lobster salad (delicious although there was a little too much dressing for my taste, huge chunks of fresh lobster), two "Power Lunch" steaks and pasta. While there is no children's menu, they made a half order of pasta for us.  The portions were quite large. The Flourless Chocolate cake and Donut Holes were delicious for dessert!   We had a front row seat for great people watching in the Forum Shops. I was comfortable bringing my children here for lunch.

lcuFrEJjTL4cX1eQ47nE4g.text: The Palm is one of my favourite steakhouses Restaurants. The Las Vegas location honours reservations . They are very friendly and the waiter took extra time to make recommendations for my associate who is a fussy eater . The key point to mention that they did not rush us and the came around several times for drinks and making sure everything was perfect .   The food was hot large portions and perfect . The lobsters and steak was amazing . The side dishes were perfect and complimented our meal. The Fried Potato Chips And Fried Onion Rings are amazing . All in all we had another amazing meal at The Palm.

3GrR1SO3ls_QLsrdJncSJQ.text: This establishment oozes excellence.   From the moment you walk in, to the moment you leave, you feel valued and appreciated for your patronage while you feast and imbibe on delicacies that are unparalleled in terms of quality and flavor.  While the fare is delectable, the staff is what sets this place apart. We've been coming here for years, and lately we've noticed an uptick in overall experience. It turns out the reason for that is Michael, the GM. This man is uncompromising and exudes professionalism. He insists that his customers leave happy, every time, and maintains only the highest standards both in the kitchen and on the floor.   Servers like Barry (Barry "Smiles"), are the beating heart of this establishment and the reason why my wife and I are loyal customers for life. Barry makes the entire dining experience an absolute joy; ensuring your every need is met, and doing so with the humor and attention to detail that makes him truly unforgettable and someone you insist your friends and family go visit. You leave just wanting Barry to be your new best friend.   We also met Luigi, the floor manager, for the first time last night, and he perfectly upheld the incredibly high standards that the Palm maintains.   I cannot speak highly enough about the Palm, it's offerings, and especially it's incredible staff.   If you're in Las Vegas, you're doing yourself a huge disfavor if you don't dine at the Palm. Ask to sit in Barrys section, if available. You'll be grateful you did.

zHhZzzj9157QiiDYxxFiTQ.text: Excellent, food always superb. Went on a Saturday night, 8pm reservation.  Special was the 3lb Lobster just flown in, split, with 2 salads and a side for $99.  It was 4 of us, so we ordered 2 of the specials.  I had to Caesar Salad with anchovies, and the others had the Palm Salad.  I tried the Palm salad, and that was also so good.  It came with a vinegarette and their signature Blue Cheese dressing.    The dressing was so good, I used it on my bread.  We ordered the garlic mash and cream spinach sides.  Delicious.....

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster special $99
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half 3lb Lobster and it&#39;s high claw

Z6wyzdaZuJnJU2eTcQ6vVA.text: The hostess was friendly and accommodating  and the service was great but the food was mediocre.  Baked clams for an appetizer was a disappointment, the clams were the smallest I've seen and the bacon on top was burnt. I was debating between the Chilean Sea Bass and the lobster and opted for the Chilean Sea Bass as recommended by our server.  The Sea Bass was bland and needed more flavor and the  butternut squash risotto that came with the entree was nothing special. My husbands bone in ribeye was tasty so I ate most of his instead. Cheesecake for dessert was delish! I've heard their known for their lobster so we'll need to try that next time!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

u5dg6jXlsUJ9rASaTtxeng.text: My boyfriend had been to the LA location several times and had great things to say. Since we were staying at Caesars we decided to make reservations for dinner. We sat at the bar and had a drink at the bar first while we waited for our friends to arrive . I ordered a cosmo and my boyfriend ordered a manhattan. Both were made well. We were seated in a booth for dinner and it was quiet and comfortable. We ordered the lump crab meat cocktail and scallops for appetizers. The perfect amount for 4 adults. The appetizers were spot on. Next my boyfriend and I shared a Caesar salad. For dinner our friends order the 4 lb lobster to share.   We had a sample of it and it melted in my mouth. My boyfriend and I shared a 12 oz filet, medium. It was a little over cooked, which we were hoping for. It was so juicy. We ordered the asparagus and hash browns for sides to share. The hash browns were AMAZING! For dessert, my boyfriend and I ordered a key lime pie And cappuccino to share. This was also so good. Everything was delicious. The service was great. The ambiance was great. I definitely recommend that you have dinner at Palm restaurant.

TtzYMedaxy_KauNOl7fGJQ.text: Another fabulous dinner tonight.  Our sever, Lopez made this an absolutely amazing evening  Lopez took this dinner to another level.  The food , presentation and the service was simply amazing   a real winner

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

T0siCjapJpFrWXbZda7vBA.text: One of the best steaks I've ever had in my life. When I say the steak was cooked perfectly ( medium rare ) I mean it was legitimately cooked perfectly.  I went with the 12 oz Wagyu ribeye w/ lobster truffle butter. I HIGHLY recommend this to anyone who is a steak lover. The lobster mac & cheese was also a winner, very smokey flavor too it. Service was great as well can't complain about anything.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Jf9ONVt0zuX5eDxDtpOzVw.text: I've dined at The Palm three times now and each time I have experienced a problem with my order. What makes it worse is that it has been the SAME issue.   The first time I ordered their steak tenderloin sandwich which is supposed to have a sriracha aioli sauce. It took a couple of bites to realize they took it upon themselves to substitute the aioli for horseradish. Once I brought it to their attention, they waitress was great and got me a new one quickly and it was delicious.  I liked the sandwich so much that I ordered it again on the second visit. Again, they substituted the aioli for horseradish without telling me. This waiter however, argued a little bit before replacing it.  I visited again today and wanted the same sandwich but I made them aware of my previous issues beforehand to try and avoid it altogether. The waiter said no problem, there will be no horseradish this time. The food arrives and no horseradish but also no aioli. When I asked my waiter to bring some, he said the chef had ran out and they brought me a side of straight up sriracha from the bottle instead. No apology, just made it seem like it was my problem that an ingredient listed on the menu was out.   In case it's not clear, I'm not asking for anything special here, I literally just wanted exactly what is written on the menu and all three times ran into an issue. I even let the manager know after the second visit that there must be some disconnect between the kitchen and the menu.  When they get it right, this place is fire, but for me, I think the three strike rule applies and I'm out.

p_ImLyOmUnzMA-0KbwDVmA.text: Excellent steakhouse!  Tasty filet mignon! Sides were great!  Service was really good.  Ambiance was subtly vibrant!  Prices was reasonable and not outrageous!  The pre-meal bread was awesome!

eyqCZHF7G65NibR6G7FjIA.text: This was our first time here and we will definitely be back! Our waiter JR was the best! His explanation of the menu was very detailed and gave very good suggestions. The Assistant Manager Luigi Perez made sure we were enjoying our experience as well! Service was amazing and the food was phenomenal! A must to visit while in Las Vegas!

fvnu9NC6Uo6Hg-8Fw0nKJg.text: Its the best hotel to be at! Movie theater to dayclub and nightclub. They also have a food court to high end restaurants! Love it!

F5WCJ4PypytIgSeupNC7Kw.text: I've only been for lunch but they have an excellent lunch menu & the food is always fabulous.   Anyone will feel like celebrity in here because of it's past guests, status, & atmosphere.  I highly recommend the lobster salad!  The service is great but can be a little slow at times.

EdBRcUO52Y1g0PrVYw7zjQ.text: I love it here there bread is great! My favorite is the huge sides and the gigi shrimp salad! My absolute favorite is the flourless chocolate cake! One day I came here just for that ! A must try so rich and tasty ! Calamari also very good!

hbnCB4-H1KK9chSF97HahQ.text: Delicious meal. Amazing tender ribeye steak cooked to a perfect medium. Juicy and tender steak. Definitely recommend.

lOVOzjhNibvdxMA6NYFKKA.text: I took my wife to the Palms Restaurant after watching a Cirque du Soleil show. Since we were heading in the Caesar's Palace direction anyway, figured we should try something besides Spago out.  It oozed quality the minute you got in and were met by the maitre d'hotel and checked our coats in. It wasn't busy when we arrived and they found us a table straight away. Nicely furnished and relaxing atmosphere. Interesting walls, where they have picture/cartoon paintings of all the famous people who have eaten in the restaurant.   The waiter brought us over the beers we had asked for and the menus. Food on the menu is pricey, so much so that I was scared to look at what the beer was costing. We decided to start with a Caesar Salad with a vinaigrette sauce and, much as I don't do rabbit food, I almost ate all of it by myself!  We both went for the 14oz Filet Mignon with the lobster add-on, with all the side dishes (mashed potatoes and creamed spinach) we wanted. What I didn't expect them to do was bring the love lobster out to us to see what the before and after would look like! We thought it was funny that they let us hold it up to take pictures of.   Anyway, the steak and lobster were cooked exactly the way I wanted. The sauce and the side dishes were excellent too.  We were offered dessert, when they brought over a big tray showing what was available, but neither of us were up for eating any more. my mate though asked for one of the huge portions of carrot cake to be put in a takeaway box to take home for his wife.  So the downside is that it's not cheap! (But what good restaurant in Vegas is?) If you can afford it, the Palms is a great place to go. Most satisfying meal I've had in ages!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The wife and I enjoying our meal at Palm Restaurant
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 14 oz Filet Mignon with Lobster at Palm Restaurant
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holding up my dinner at Palm Restaurant

XDex5g_GV-eRHXZeOY-dfg.text: Came here to celebrate my 21st birthday in Vegas and the Palm did not disappoint at all thanks to Izzy. Izzy was an impeccable server and he really made out experience at the Palm something I will never forget. He gave us a hefty slice of chocolate cake as well as a piece of cheese cake which were both incredible.  Our entrees was equally as impressive as was the service and I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone looking for a place to have dinner in Caesar's Palace!

KwgGeFalesI2IvXY9q0jgw.text: A perfect 10! I have been dining here 1 to 3 times a year, for almost 20 years! family events and business and have always had a great time, great food and GREAT service! We always request "Dutch " as our waiter as he rules Las Vegas' dining scene! Says a lot he has that much staying power! Awesome steak and seafood but seriously best service ever, like a good cocktail? This is the place!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cZ-gofU6BfnaUfoCUL5oQQ.text: Just had the most fatastic dinner! AJ and Ricky took amazing care of us and the food was out of this world!!! This is the best steak and lobster in Vegas! Incredible food, tremendous service, can't recommend this enough!

-E8aKPb6vv2-t0z_m1Z43A.text: Every time I am in Vegas I make sure to make it to the Palms! The ambiance is so pleasant (especially on the patio), the service is great, and the food is exceptional. I highly recommend the burger, various soups, steaks, cesar salad, and the beautiful plate full of fried deliciousness (fries and onion strings).      Sit on the patio and enjoy great food and people watching.

lxXpqbpYrJA_f2ridb1whQ.text: As usual another visit to the Palm, this time in LAS and it didn't disappoint. From NYC to LA and LAS, it's always the same, excellent service & food. The Menu is always basically the same and the food and service consistently excellent. You get what you pay for, great job guys!

Cq6XoB_veCs5gUDm2Rb_Pg.text: Beside the food being incredible, go simply for the experience of Lopez.  He's the best server you're gonna find. Prompt, funny, personal, AND he made our kid happier than happy :).  Thanks Lopez.
