yjCHqq7GdAOxbMI8QAWJGg.text: JR was the best server we've ever had!! Food was amazing! We had a great time celebrating my birthday here!

z4D_DBUI5rJqXYyunQAQ6Q.text: This review should have been a FIVE!  Palm folk please hear me out.  I am a longtime local customer of yours and love the place.  However, I am a fan of Martini's and yours sadly are among the lower percentile. In no particular order:  1.  The size of the drink is always different.  I ordered a Martini straight up on Thanksgiving and it was half full.  My wife even commented, "strange place to save some money". 2.  The cocktail is never properly strained.  You mostly feel like you are drinking icebergs. 3.  NO VERMOUTH IS NO VERMOUTH.   4.  Very warm when the drink gets to the table.  Palm folk, the martini is an iconic drink and needs to be treated with respect.  It is the start of the meal and starting dinner with a bad martini is like going to bed with you wife while she is mad at you.  Thanks for listening!

Mta-Q9kuR1G085iToh4-Fg.text: I think this is supposed to be a fine cuisine restaurant but did not have fine cuisine taste. it's very overpriced for the food you get. Expected something out of the ordinary or exquisite for that price of salmon/ veal dinner we had. Husband said veal was super thin and covered in so much marinara and cheese that you could not even taste the veal anymore. Menu says the fish is cooked within hours of being caught, but my sauteed salmon was a little tough at the top which led me to believe that it was not as fresh as advertised or we're talking more than several days at least. I believe I could have gotten the same if not better at TGI Fridays. Also they piecemeal the dinner so none of the sides come with that heavily priced main entree. Each side is about 15 bucks to go with your 50$ entree. I just don't think the meal was worth that price and I would have had the same if not better tasting meal at red lobster or this Friday's. Fresh cloth dinner napkin on table was soiled and had previously been used. We set it aside. Staff was nice

YwD_EDJDk0xAIWck26jRwg.text: This is a hard review to write. Over the years I have had excellent dinners at the Palm.  Whether it was the Palm in NYC, Chicago or Orlando it has ALWAYS been a great experience.  Tonight, could simply have been one of the worst experiences from beginning to end.    We started with drinks in the bar and we should have left when the bartender didn't know how to make a dark and stormy.  The drinks arrived almost clear.  We asked if they were out of Gosslings or some dark rum and the bartender responded with "Was I suppose to use dark rum?  I thought I was suppose to."  And the glass size...laughably small.  We were assured that he would make a "much better one " next time.  The next ones were jam packed with ice and very little rum, not dark either.  We wrote it off because the steaks and prime rib will more than make up for it.    We ordered lobster bisque, the Iceberg wedge and bacon.  For dinner we ordered the special Milanese (described as a "nice veal chop pounded thin with Parmesan...) one "special 27oz bone in prime rib" and the porterhouse.  Both steaks were requested medium rare, closer to rare.  We also ordered the asparagus with hollandaise and hash browns.    Let's start with the good.  The lobster bisque was full of flavor and rich, but not over so.  The wedge was nice with plenty of tomatoes , bacon, blue cheese and onion strings while being dressed properly.  The asparagus we fine (shouldn't really screw up steamed asparagus) but the hollandaise was forgettable.  Not bad just off.  The porterhouse was very good.  Cooked beautifully with with excellent flavor.  Could have used a bit more seasoning but still great.    Now here comes the tidal was of horrible.  The bacon was saltier than any bacon I have ever had.  Not a single person in our party of four could eat more than a single bite.  The special veal Milanese was burnt and gray all at the same time.  And it was as tough as shoe leather.  And that's not just figure of speech.  It was brutally tough.  Then the prime rib, requested medium rare, closer to rare, came gray with some searing.  It was closer to well done than rare and the texture was a bit mealy.  After we had all tried the prime rib and the veal Milanese we asked to speak with the manager.  While our waiter was fine the manager was a condescending, pardon my poor language, prick.  He had the unmitigated gall to actually ask us what was wrong with the "Milanese" (please see the pictures I have provided and I will let you all decide.). He also did the same with the prime rib. Again, the pictures speak for themselves.  When asked if this is what a pounded veal chop should look like Mr Manager responded with "What's wrong with it?"  When I asked him if this is what the prime rib they serve all other guests looked like Mr. manager responded "Yeah, what's wrong with it?".  And he followed that with "What do you want me to do?"  Never once did we get an apology but rather condescending attitude.  I told him we were not happy that we had to pay for the bad dishes.  He left fairly abruptly.    Now I will give him some credit as he did not charge us for the prime rib, the Milanese, or the bacon.  But he never returned to apologize but rather left the waiter to do the work.  A simple apology would have been nice.  Acknowledging that the food was poorly prepared would have gone a long way.  But we were told that we were wrong and that food at the Palm is prepared this way.  Again, pictures speak a thousand words.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Veal Milanese&#34;
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Medium rare prime rib&#34;

SIUn5iy2fGni759YVAqhCA.text: Awesome lobster bisque! I try to visit The Palm at least once when I am in town. Today's lunch was delicious, especially with starting with the bisque. Heavenly!

4-qGMd6OnPrf4EwTyGU1nA.text: I probably would never stay here again. Check in took almost 30 minutes! There were hidden fees that we did not know about. They do not call to confirm any reservations with you. The room that we stayed at had bed bugs. I woke up with bites all over my legs. I told an associate about it and they didn't do anything. Never again.

zZdD6dH2DLsaIlyU8grG3Q.text: Celebrated our anniversary Saturday October 6th, with Ruan as our server...no, make that our dinner friend. He was awesome in every thing he did and so much more to make our special night that much better.  From appetizer to wine, to entree, to Gluten free dessert, Ruan was the MAN. We also want to compliment Michael the wine steward for doing an exceptional job and for just being so super friendly that it was an absolutely wonderful evening. We give this a 5 star since not only exceptional food but the staff from host to bus person were so awesome and so easy to talk to and just made everything an unforgettable evening. Thank you Palm staff. We will be back. Jeannie and Steve

ujhMFO87tas-qantMex2rQ.text: 14 people and about 60 lbs of lobster for their Summer Special.  Don't miss this next year.  4 lb Lobster for two people with sides for just $99.  We do this every year.  We have been enjoying the Palm Restaurants in Miami, Denver, Los Angeles and Las Vegas for years.  the best for both food and service.

idFaU0jLQHhLthUjDjSaYw.text: Everything you would expect from a 1st class steakhouse. The food was amazing, the service was incredible as was the entire dining experience.

uyhpEkiJJHaixAPxIuQj_w.text: Another great dinner with friends last night. I wish I had remembered our servers name. What a wonerful personality, full of energy, and a terrific sense of humor. All I remember is that he was from New Orleans. Also recommended a really great bottle of wine. The food was as usual, delicious. Again if you go,sit in the indoor patio along the rail and experience the best of people watching. Especially when it's 109 outside. Ciao

8ncdZZN1syENyF8o90imkg.text: This is one of my favorite steakhouses in town! I usually go there for lunch and have their Business Lunch special. You get a salad, entree, side and dessert for around $25. You really can't beat it!  My favorites are the caesar salad and the filet, oscar style. This was actually the first restaurant that I ever tried oscar style on my steak and it's still my favorite. Their cheesecake is actually pretty delicious too. I don't care for raspberry, so I ate it plain and it was amazing.  During my most recent visit, I ordered the lobster and was disappointed in so many ways. However, I am  not letting that ruin my overall opinion of this restaurant. Before my recent visit, everything was great.  Bonus: Employees in the Forum Shops receive a discount during lunch.

x3F1_wiSUZEx7VHP0Hb2iA.text: Absolutely the worst service ever. Never have I had such poor service at a Palm restaurant. The manager was not helpful and completely ruined our entire evening.

sEn00pMkk65I3uh0FBt1XQ.text: The service was not nearly up to standards one would expect of the Palm Brand.  Appetizers of calamari and the lettuce wedge were excellent.  The main course was a disaster.  Very, very delayed service.  The medium lamb chops once delivered were raw (had ordered medium on advice of wait staff) and the lobster Mac tasted like it came out of my freezer.  To their credit, they were very apologetic and made it up to us.  But this is the Palm;  We expected more.

Xkek6pMpk7dAkBPn7m2zSA.text: What the hell happened here!?!?!? This used to be a staple of the the Las Vegas dining scene. Super disappointed in this evenings meal and can honestly say that I will NEVER return.   Wagyu rib eye was a 1/2" cut and overcooked. Linguine and clams dry and $30'for chicken caesar salad!?  Over priced in an understatement for the "quality" of the meal. There are far better food choices on the strip and even in Caesar's. Would avoid this spot, it is just not the same anymore.

YGGkJaPX1heXeAU3iBThqA.text: As far as the atmosphere, it is really nice and upscale. I ordered the NY strip medium but it came nearly well done as did my brother's filet mignon. The cheesy potatoes didn't taste too fresh, and the baked clams weren't a favorite, but I would recommend the Brussels sprouts and asparagus as side dishes instead. The appetizers came early but the entrees took over an hour to prepare and serve. Overall, I do think you can find better steak and food with these prices.

upX5EUKaZygBx2_Z5ET5ZQ.text: I came for a birthday dinner with a large group of 19. I didn't know most people in the group, so I can't speak for everyone's experience, but here's mine:  Location: killer. It's just at the entrance to the forum shops. Why does this matter? If you're local, you can easily park in the (still free) Self Parking garage, take the elevator, make a quick left and BOOM you're there!  Those walking in heels will appreciate this.  Service: meh. We were seated in the back room, (which sounds private but it was not) and I asked the server if she agreed that it was warm. She said, "it's not cold, it's not hot...it's a nice temperature." I was literally sweating...so...neat.   Food: Mine was fab. I had the veal chop ($42). I heard a few other people complaining though - the pasta was "more than al dente" and the steak they ordered medium was clearly much more rare than expected.   A final note - DOUBLE CHECK your bill. On our bill, it clearly said "Gratuity not included," but when we read through the actual itemized bill, there was $210 of Gratuity. Now look - I don't mind that at all, it was a 20% auto-grat, that's cool. But...don't misrepresent in the text and say it's not included! We were also charged for an item that never arrived, but like...it's a giant group, these things happen. I'm not docking a star for that.

CrkcTk5oFSswEBDuNWSn5g.text: Came in for lunch to celebrate a friend's birthday and sunshine was our server. She was friendly, knowledgeable, and not pushy. We both ordered the prix fixe lunch for $22 and the food portions were huge! We will be back, thank you for such great service!

kYjxuYCi2ie6X7dD-39TNg.text: Service was exceptional and not at all pretentious. The food was amazing. The lobster tails were very well priced at $20 each, and I enjoyed them so much. The steak was cooked perfectly.

zV_UMfjWUpNY0vLh15NQsA.text: Service?  What service?   Tried to sit down outside- which had a ton of empty tables-but was told by a waiter to see the non-existent hostess.    After waiting as long as I could- I just left and took my party and money somewhere else.  Hey if you're looking for the NYC experience in LV- they seem to have got the service or lack there of -down right.   Shame cause I used to LOVE the Palm.

pjWm_PNfVPfVW25JmaOavA.text: Wow what a disappointment! We have been to The Palm at least 10+ times for our Anniversary and Birthdays and this time we just wanted a fancy lunch...it was the worse. We opted for the Power Lunch and ordered the NY strip and the Skirt steak w/chimichurri sauce. Both Medium. Well...BOTH arrived WELL DONE. Had them sent back (and we all know chefs hate that). Our new steaks...the NY Strip was still alive and the skirt steak was Medium well.  Also the chimichurri sauce was missing. UGH just get it right the first time guys! The BEST thing on the table was the shoestring onions! Enough about the food let's give a high five for the servers :)) They were attentive and apologized for our meal. The Palm probably acquired a new chef or he just partied the night before because he was not on his game today. Bottom line I should have ordered the burger, can't mess up a burger. :p We will stick to Mortons Steakhouse from now on.

zt6eySqnjCcIVokvhiy5QA.text: I normally try my best to stay away from bad reviews and always give the restaurant a chance to right their wrongs before going to Yelp. I've eaten here 3 times now and all 3 times were great, great food and great staff. The problem didn't happen until we packed our food up to take home. I got a filet oscar style (which is Hollandaise, crab, and asparagus) but when I got my food I had already eaten 2 shrimp cocktails, some crab cake, lobster bisque, and maybe half the bread basket with butter lol (that's probably where I messed up!) Steak came, ate a couple bites, and asked for the rest to go since I was still getting dessert. They packed my food up, we paid, and were ready to go home.. sounds good right? Wrong, this is where the problem begins. The next day I open up my left overs, excited, and notice there is no crab on my steak or in the to-go container. I show my wife, who thinks that's funny, and she mentions maybe they didn't take it off the plate to put in with it.. that's when I noticed they didn't put the asparagus in as well. Still not a big deal, not too upset, but she thinks I should call to let them know, so I do. I call and ask to speak to a manager. The lady Kelly who answered said she was a manager. I tell her my story about how they didn't pack up my oscar style, which I paid an additional 12 dollars to add on, and that they just threw that away. (It's quite a bit of crab too, I highly recommend it.) Then she paused and said "and what do you want me too do about it..." I was shocked! Our check was right around a grand for the night and this is how she responds?? To a place I planned on frequenting more often, hell our friend ate there 3 nights in a row. Just the unprofessionalism and the lack of character and customer service was appalling. I guess Joe's will be getting more business from now on. At least I know my left overs are secure and the managers are trained and well mannered

jUlQ7ixRI0hMYyarW4elPw.text: Great value for lunch. Power Lunch - For $22, you are able to get a salad, entree, and a personal side. Considering you could post that for a crummy burger in Vegas, we were very happy.  I had a Caesar salad, panko crusted halibut, and green beans. All were fantastic. My wife had a lobster salad that consisted of mixed greens, lobster, tomatoes, onion, and avocado. Had to be a pound of lobster in the salad. She couldn't even finish it all.  The one thing that was just okay was the thick cut bacon appetizer. The sauce and smoke on it were just a little too overpowering. Didn't impact the meal overall, we would just opt for a different starter next time.

ILjqlDFRr4ryTGJSNU_oNA.text: There is a reason. We come back again and again ove the years. Impeccable service, excellent foods, always a great experience. Lopez was an awesome server and went over the top to MAKE chocolate ice cream for him (when they only offer vanilla).  Will continue to come and enjoy this landmark of a restaurant.

oxR5bY2GTc6RERc9puynKQ.text: Had the maple glazed bacon (pork belly) appetizer, the highlight of the dinner. It went downhill from there. We both choose the special. A dry aged, prime, NY Strip. Both ordered the same way, charred Medium Rare. They looked beautiful when they arrived. The problem, both order the same way at the same time. One cooked beautifully with a warm red center. Mine was grey towards the edge and bare pink in the deep center, no marbling evident.  I told the waiter and he took it back to be re-fired. On cutting into the second steak I found this it the quite firm and tough to cut through. It was at least red in the center but was still over cooked. The middle was not cool, but cold. The chef's trick, on the re-fired he used a steak from the refer instead of a rested room temp steak to keep it from looking over cooked.   Really chef? You insult both your customers and what should have been an exceptional piece of prime beef with cheap tricks like this. $65 steaks and a $400 check and this is how we are treated...After making the first mistake, which can happen from time to time, you made it worse trying to fix the problem.  I guess they are happy to have tourists who will likely never be repeat customers. I guess they are right, I'll likely never give them my business again.

TO682hBbZYS7Ks9bmVhVmw.text: I had amazing dinners at Vegas but the Palm was not one of them. Noisy and The customer service is not comparable to other steakhouses in-town. We were very disappointed by the quality of service being used to waiters and waitresses who know their menus and welcome you with a smile and personable service. The food was OK, I had a Wagu ribeye. But it wasn't the best I've had.

zWt7xpP55p4ACyLQmzZkjQ.text: Second time I have been here and boy do I wonder why I let a whole year lapse before going back! Now I will say this... I'm a huge carnivore and I am a self proclaimed steak house connoisseur. So it is a little odd for me that neither time did I have steak. Both times were for their Sumner Lobster Fest. Oh yeah.... So amazing from the greeting, to the service and the food as well. Our server was a sweetheart and apparently has been there since they first opened like 20 years ago. Everyone in our group went for the lobster special which started with a salad or lobster bisque. I only ate broccoli and humus all day in preparation for the bisque and its rich creamy delight. My friend opted for the Cesar (which was delicious but not to ever be considered into the same ballgame as the bisque). She was worried she was going to be on lobster overload, however, one bite of my bisque and she had a brand new outlook on life. Next came the lobster which came nice and neatly split not to mention declawed by the staff tableside. We had a plethora of sides including lobster mac n cheese, potatoes at gratin, pancetta green beans and lemon zest broccoli. So much great food! Will be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y6epl5ijw5Dsfe_eayURbA.text: Really enjoyed shrimp cocktail from here and fresh ahi seared on a seafood platter. Large portions enough to share with two people! I didn't realize that :) but it is delicious and the waiters are great here, very attentive and truly caring to all your needs or wants! The steaks are mouth watering , and I'm not a big steak eater. I recommend this place because the ambiance, the waiters , and the food !

WPcb7QMspo1swL8LDfRmvA.text: I recently ate dinner at The Palm with three of my friends.  I shared the 4 pound lobster with one friend.  This is their $99 special.  Believe me it was not a 4 pound lobster.  My half had so little meat it was embarrassing.  The tail was two bites and the claw was not much more.  My friend's half was not much better.   The steak my other friend had, a filet, was tasteless.   She said she had had far better meat at many other steak restaurants. The service was awful.  The waiter had difficulty splitting a check and preparing the lobster to our specifications.   He had difficulty serving the salad with dressing on the side.   And he NEVER brought hot wet towels to cleanse hands after eating the lobsters.   If I didn't stop another server we would never have gotten anything to clean up.   I am member of their 837 club.  They couldn't find my membership.  Just as well.  They have downgraded everything from food to service.  I have been a member since 2006 and this was the worst meal I have ever had there.   I will never return and have told all of my friends about this experience.   Too bad.  I used to love it in NY and was glad to see it here when I moved here.  Never again !!!  Zero stars

FYV6i9UDJNXMEvJ_ZZWKZA.text: First time we had dinner at the Palm.  I had been looking forward to eating there.   We ordered 4 surf and turf -- filets and NY strips with lobster tails  plus many side dishes.  Food was delicious.  I particularly loved the green beans with panchetta and pine nuts toppings. It was so tasty.   My husband loved their hash brown as his fav side dish.   They even made buttered noodles for our six year-old daughter.  We have tried many steak houses in Vegas. Most of them have been great.  We liked this one as well (price was decent).

WNKwbUk877ju1OJfAHfkNA.text: I frequent this restaurant often absolutely one of my faves. I love their lobster bisque. Derrick is the best bartender in Las Vegas!!

dxCBcGiK-0uQjKCti6cKAg.text: Amazing!!! This is my favorite place to eat in Vegas. J.R. is an awesome compliment to the meal. If that's not enough the patio seating is perfect for people watching.

gfJvxLrRmyJYSX-l6AykoA.text: awesome Happy Hour specials! you have to get the lobster/bacon fondue with pretzel rolls. Damn. half off drinks and a great open bar area. oh, and perfectly timed from 5-7p. our bartender was also a cool dude and very helpful. located right in the Forum Shops area. we may just come back and try their dinner. i hear they have a good steak.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HH menu
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster fondue on HH

Axj59gTBhDciyVF9X3TNTA.text: Pros: portions were huge! Chicken parm was the size of my plate and ok tasting. Carrot cake single serving can feed 2-3 people. 7 layer double serving could feed 4-5 people and very rich! Server was nice. Head hostess will put unruly patrons in line! Atmosphere inside is dark. Con: server wasn't very tentative. We waited forever for dessert menus and he didnt wait to take all our orders. We had to call him back to the table. They sang for my aunty and uncle's anniversary but they weren't even lively so it was lame! French fries were like regular fries....i'd get better fries at mcdonald's. server couldn't describe his menu items. Compared their coffee to foldgers...really?   For the price of the menu, i was a bit disappointed. Not likely to return.

UVGexhzgGEtNjmski6fH1g.text: I just wanted to thank you for a wonderful dinner tonight. Our servers were Fernando Coyote and Leo, and they were both particularly welcoming. Specifically, my dad and I ordered the double 36 oz steak with a 3lb lobster, but the lobster claw meat was small and so Leo gave us an extra claw to compensate. Both my dad and I were blown away. We are from Los Angeles and our favorite steakhouse is the palm in downtown la. However, the Las Vegas location definitely takes the cake. Together they made our night extra special and we definitely can't wait to come back again with my mom and sisters. So thank you for the wonderful meal.

Gfrxm00P4BP7VK_09apoDA.text: We had lunch here with another couple while shopping recently, and the food was great, but the service was TERRIBLE.  We waited more than 15 minutes to get a drink - and I don't mean just alcoholic drinks, but that was just the wait for water.  Once we finally received water, the waiter came back 10 minutes later with our cocktails.  Great bloody mary if you can wait for it.   It took another 10 minutes for her to make it back to take our order, and then 10 more to get the bread basket!   Ridiculous.  The food was good - I had a jumbo lump crab cocktail that was full of crab and well worth the price, while others in the group had sandwiches and steak burgers with fries.  My husband said his blue cheese steak burger was delicious, and another guest said that the chicken sandwich from the specialty menu was really tasty.    Overall we would try this restaurant again on another visit to Vegas, but definitely would NOT sit with the inattentive server again.  Cheers!

1tGjQWvyYYV9m63yK4cNZg.text: Lunch was excellent. We ate at the bar and Linda was excellent. Highly recommend if you are in the Forum shopping area for great food.

t0TVlLfbtjlazE3KucYsYw.text: scallops  lamb chops bartender  Im thankful to have a palm restaurant in Houston but i must say i enjoyed this locations food more.

QvjM45KzSRgPRy32m8lk0A.text: I hear your heart beat to the beat of the drums Oh, what a shame that you came here with someone So while you're here in my arms Let's make the most of the night like we're gonna die young at PALM RESTAURANT! - Kesha (die young)  Let's start with the good: 1. romantic atmosphere where you can sit inside where it's darker or outside where the forum shops are 2. kitchen is open late compared to other steakhouses 3. crab cakes were one of the best i've had in a while 4. service was extremely diligent  And the bad: 1. the bone in filet I ordered didn't stand out and the Bearnaise sauce didn't help 2. bread seemed more like leftovers 3. they are part of their own restaurant group from Caesar's so you can't use your comps here, kinda wish I knew this ahead of time haha oh well!  Back story: This place wasn't our first choice but I messed up with timing and thinking that kitchens were opened later than they actually were on weekends so yah...since my heart was set on a steakhouse, this was the most accessible place I could come up with given it was past 10 pm and kitchens were closing fast. Literally a super last minute decision that turned out serviceable, just gotta plan ahead a little better next time :)

Z_DWahqFLowN99lSnkQOpw.text: I would NOT come back here. Service was great, the food was sub-par. We got a calamari to share, which was good. The salad was also good. My dad and I both ordered the burger with fries and the bun and fries were burnt on both dishes.   I asked for my burger medium well and it was WAY past well done. Bun and fries had that charred taste.  For $70+ total, I expect a meal that, at the least, isn't overcooked and burned. I will add pictures soon.

Az2Xh8_YkwHWXW66816rug.text: A coworker recommended this restaurant to me and I recently had a chance to try it. I was in town and made online reservations a day in advance for dinner for a party of five on a Saturday evening @ 6:30pm. We arrived a few minutes early and were seated almost immediately. The table we were seated at was located just inside of the outdoor seating area, which was great, because we could enjoy the pulse of activity going on outside in the forum shops area right in front of us. Our male server was polite and for the most part attentive, but we had to remind him for an item he initially forgot and we had to ask for water refills.   Decent menu selection, but very pricey! The food we ordered was okay...but was nothing special (which included orders of the NY Strip Steak & Filet Mignon). I don't mind paying high prices as long as it's worth it...but in this instance I didn't feel the food quality matched the prices being charged. Which is the same with how we felt about the service. My wife and I felt that we've had a better overall dining experience at Flemings and they aren't even as expensive. Interesting note: I initially tried to get reservations at Flemings, but it was booked solid whereas at this restaurant it was definitely not packed.   Overall, I would have to say nice ambiance, neat location being located in the Caesar's Forum Shops...but in my opinion the food and service fell short of the $$$ paid.

WbJgOoMiQyPvmNg2N35JuA.text: This was a truly great meal. We started with the clams casino and they were very tasty. We then split the boneless ribeye which was for "2-3 people." This thing could easily feed 3-4! We sure did get our fill of steak! It was a fabulous steak though. Cooked perfectly and sliced table side. The service was impecable. The atmosphere is fun with all the caricatures everywhere. Very good wine list. This was not our first choice on a busy night when our other plans fell through but ended up being the best meal we had in Vegas. Now the prices are what you would expect from a place with aged steaks but it was worth it. Second best steak I have ever had. We also had a side of the cheese potatoes and they were so flavorful. I could have eaten them for a meal! The sides for 2 are very good portions for the price. You will not leave hungry!

R3pJ2Vh3KPeI4mh2Jg6M1w.text: I had the opportunity to join a friend at a business dinner. I most likely wouldn't have tried this place otherwise. The calamari was excellent, the steak well prepared, loved the creamed spinach. The staff in the private dining area were very attentive, my only real qualms as an observer were the noise level of the restaurant on a busy night was VERY loud, even in the private area, and exiting the private area and dodging staff to get to the restroom is like taking your life in your hands.

4agNnsLaiN5XtTMrAd7DzA.text: Came here with a party of 12.. 6 chicken Parma and 3 Prime Double Cut Steaks... The steaks were described to us as "brought to you on a cutting board and slices in front of you" .. Instead all 3 steaks were precut and put on a simple plate... Ridiculous service, and delivery...  Fail fail Fail .. I love the Palm and actually have been to the original ... This is a misrepresentation of the brand, and the quality of steak. If I could give 0 stars I would have.  The manager did a piss poor job of overseeing his restaurant .. Instead looked to blame wait staff and chef..

6Z2ssEUQe-dM-SfO4N_glg.text: Went for the power lunch on to weds before thanksgiving.   Was surprised it wasn't more crowded but the better for us!   Food and service were quite good and the value of the power lunch is a steal.   Will be back for more lunches here.  Our server, a younger gentleman than typically found at the palm, seemed well versed in the menu and made some very helpful suggestions.

05HAPC0scLVizOFj3-EAjg.text: Been here so many times but we just went here on Sunday and it was better than ever. I recommend this restaurant to anybody and everybody who loves good food. Can't wait to go back on my next big occasion. Oh and if you go, ask for Barry he's the best waiter ever!!

HXVjIknJt1Qh7bm5ffm-jA.text: Sitting outside the restaurant in the Forum Shops.  Great place to people watch and have a lobster dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jack having dinner before Rod Stewart concert

GEsH0zX_4si7Xa6GA2QpCw.text: Obviously I'm a fan of The Palm, see my previous reviews from my local location in Bal Harbor, but here in Vegas in the Forum Shops tonight 8 of us tackled this place for a good friend of mines retirement party and birthday. It also considers with our annual Fall Golf trip to Vegas so here we are.  Meeting in the bar for a few drinks, the very friendly Jax takes care of the boys and our table on the Patio in the forum ships is ready for what we hope is great food and people watching.  JR is serving us tonight and after ordering a very overpriced bottle of wine we are off and running.  Cesar Salads, Traditional Blue Cheese Wedges with beefsteak Tomatoes, and a shrimp cocktail and a shrimp Bruno started off the food orgy.  The wedges were as expected & the Wet & Dry blue Cheese is the same as their Miami location.  Everyone was extremely pleased with their salads which were cold fresh and very tasty.   On to the Entrees.  Excellent for the most part with the NY STRIP & The Rib Eye being the best of the bunch here.  A little disappointing Prime Rib is only available on Friday & Saturday night.  Their price Fix option of $49.00 with Salad, choice of a particular entree and dessert looks great but I have to believe the following.  The Filet Mignon is not the same as the menu item. All 3 were funny looking and gray.  Taste was ok but really a weak presentation.  Small 6 ounce Lobster tail was NOT 6 ounces and it was Ok but not great.   The  1/2 lobsters were much better with plenty of meat and great claws which were expertly cracked and deshelled tableside.    Sides of Half & Half "Cottage fries and string onions were on the money as well as the sauteed wild mushrooms & Creamed spinach.  Lyonnais potatoes were good but Red Onions instead of traditional white did not do them justice.   A nice giant piece of chocolate cake for the birthday boy was presented along with homemade whipped cream.  Couple of Espressos & Cappuccinos was consumed as well.   Not a perfect night as the Filets & Lobster tails in the price fixe was weak but rest of the food was Top Shelf and service was impeccable as JR did a really great job... 4 Stars tonight!

sowJF8nTW2K2SvXegiHTtA.text: lve only been here for lunch, usually after shopping in the forum shops but lve never been disappointed. Service and food is consistently good. Best dish lve had from here is the Manhattan clam Chowder YUM

Y1rE5zqTfjmJnKscB_wncQ.text: Always amazing here with consistent service and superior food.  Try the lobster bisque for a nice refreshing treat.  Ribeye is succulent and full of flavor,  never any need for steak sauce on this steaks...  This time my wife had the king crab legs which came out as expected...   Simply magnificent...  Thankyou palms,  we will be back next time

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab legs so good,  you don&#39;t mind the price

eXPWyDZTWbRnvAUVN4MG1g.text: Kellie, Israel, and Mike delivered an unparalleled level of service. Outstanding! The new Decor fantastic. The food was amazing as always. Love this place! I love it even more now that Kellie is there.

ra8acE1WX--_veiRIxmeIg.text: LOVE eating at the Palm!!!  We try to eat here on every visit to Las Vegas.  It's the only restaurant where we make reservations based on whether our favorite waiter is working (Israel.....dude is awesome!!).  Oscar style petite filet for the wife, monster bone-in rib eye for me, creamed spinich and the goat cheese whipped potatoes, and a nice bottle of Russian River Valley Pinot Noir (B. R. Cohn).   Ahhhhhhhhh.....................    Israel brought us a piece of flourless chocolate cake with raspberry drizzle to compliment the remains of our wine.  Perfect.  We always leave the Palm feeling a little better about life....even if my pants don't button after dinner here.  Yes, yes...it's very expensive.  But it's a hell of a dining experience!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 24oz bone-in rib eye, with bernaise
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wife interviewing her potential menu selection

DKB7Q_CvTX90U9b_4YHicw.text: This is the restaurant that I always make sure that I make a stop at while I'm in Vegas. I enjoy the steaks and their side dishes and fantastic service.

yxaQIdKr8tinVFYkPLDOTQ.text: Last night was my third visit to the Palm.  All I can say is it gets better and better.  Both my girlfriend and I and our husbands, celebrated our birthdays there last night.  My girlfriend and I shared the 4 lb lobster special.  Not only is the lobster the best I have had since having one in Nova Scotia, but we tried the creamed corn brulee and we were both still talking about how great it was, today.  What made our special celebration extra special was our server, Barry.  Could not ask for better service!  Thank you Barry for the creme brulee with 2 candles for our birthdays.  Best restaurant in Vegas!

1gaS1ZARn0JuvbrGRl802A.text: Great food Great service. My 3 pound lobster looked closer to 2 pounds but who is to argue. :) Maybe I need to order 4 pounds.

nHmKJqlEIM6jRz_JkvTV6A.text: We stopped in here for lunch on our first day in Vegas and it was fantastic. We ordered a few things but the lobster salad and crab cakes were the best. Jose was our server and I can't say enough good things about him. Attentive, helpful and funny, he made a really good meal, great. Even though we're only here for 5 nights and there are so many restaurants to choose from, I think we will be coming again before we leave.

vjf9tbSt4nTj_3KFL5boUw.text: Ruined my vegas trip.  Got so sick after eating here. Received a message from a Larry C to contact him regarding my experience.  Of course didn't bother to leave his contact info.  Highly do not recommend this restaurant.  Go to the Wynn Steakhouse or Gallaghers.  Stay away from here.  Not Anythjng close to the quality of the NY location and literally ruined my wife and I Saturday night in vegas.

qMim87DVj_p0sylEUdjTlA.text: Use to go in for bar happy hour. But it's now gone. Wahhhhhhh ! I ended up paying $6 for a ginger ale, what a joke!  Guess I won't be doing ta Happy Hour anymore!

YIFZl-AphiUSSFHQULpwtg.text: Yeah. This place spits game that's legit.  Let me set the scene. Last night, at the Elite event, several Elite Yelpers and I were feeling the hunger a bit. We'd had a few cocktails, and some appetizers. Most of us were ready for a serious nosh session. Thankfully Rob P aka veeRob aka the Master of Disaster had a Happy Hour (Prime Time) menu for Palm saved on his phone.  We walked over, had a seat at the bar, and ordered off this heavenly Happy Hour Menu. 9:30-close.   Let's start with the things I loved:  --Service. Our bartender's name was Jax. I have a slight crush on her. She is pretty awesome. I should come back and talk to her. Hopefully she's not married or something. --Food. Awesome. I ordered the Steak sliders, the Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail and the Lobster BLT sliders. My total tab was under 20 bones. --The ambience. Perfect. I was able to hang out with my friends, and watch some basketball. All at once.  I'd come back. This is a great spot for a date, business lunch, or whatnot. It's a tad pricey when it's not Happy Hour. I'll be a bargain shopper and come back during Prime Time.  Next time, I'm coming back and trying the oysters. Only a $1.50 or so. Not bad.   And yes, this is a multi-location restaurant (a chain). There are some locations in LA. This is just as good as the original in NYC. Git some.

photos.caption: Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Sliders
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two Jumbo Shrimp
Photo of The Palm Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nova Scotia Lobster BLT Sliders

PnENj9Cq4BHSNyUmP_sSQA.text: the rating and the following was based on my experience in 2009.  i heard the menu has since changed, and the meals i had are no longer on the menu.  bummer.  ******************************************** I've been to Palm more than a few times, and i was never disappointed!  I had their club member special, which includes a salad, half and half of cottage fries and onion rings, and an order of their Filet Mignon Oscar style.  The salad was pretty standard, mixed greens tosses with light vinegrette.  It definitely went great with their assorted bread basket, which has a white chocolate bread that I've never had anywhere else!  I'd go back just for that bread!  For those of you who don't know what cottage fries are, they're basically hot-off-da-fryer-fresh thick cut potato chips.  The serving is huge!  The plate was piled high with them fries, then topped off with another pile of  strings of thinly battered and fried sweet onion that has a perfect balance of crunchiness and sweetness.  I'd go back just for them fries and rings too!  Oscar style Filet Mignon, where do I start!  The tender filet is always perfectly cooked to order, then its paired with that creamy hollandaise sauce, fresh lumped crab, and baby asparagus...simply perfection!  service is friendly and it's also a great place to people watch if you sit outside the restaurant.

bHAV5d8vLRgtd862m9DSZQ.text: Dinner was poor. Not the very high quality I have  had in other locations. Crab cakes were great, also the onion straws. Then dinner got poor. For a class operation that takes pride in their steaks what was served bordered on one star.   My son  had a Delmonico and I had the Strip.  Both came out properly cooked. Problem was is that their was no taste. Massive doses of salt did not help. And we don't normally use salt. Service was good but no concession even though we advised her before they were half eaten. Poor quality has no place in this operation.

IKhcbLbSl9vl2eRcmaUfeg.text: Without exception, the Businessman's Lunch has to be one of the best deals in town!  The Caesar Salad is truly one of the tastiest I've ever had and the portion was huge!  We each had fish (one Salmon and one Swordfish).  Didn't care for the cottage fries, and suggest the option of a French Fry or some other potato.  Also had the vegetable du jour and the swordfish was served on a bed of broccoli.  OK, found my new favorite desert--the Palm's Key Lime Pie!  It looks entirely different that most Key Lime pies in that there is no meringue and the color of this one looks like butterscotch.  But it is so dense, rich in citrus flavor and simply unbelievable--very homemade tasting.  I really cannot endorse the Palm enough for this bargain ($24 for all three courses per person) and hope to have dinner there next time I'm in town.

H77WBdibXo4pLziIqyKEww.text: I go to Palm restaurants every few months and had racked up some points...figured we would cash them in for a free meal in Vegas.  Our steaks were good, but lacked seasoning...something I have noticed on recent Palm visits.  Our server was also having trouble with us using our certificate and ended up having to charge me for a coke just so I could leave a gratuity...annoying.

7ywmSxI7__9Af5dSqx9yqQ.text: So, I might be a bit biased because my good friend, Tommy, is a bartender at this location.  However, I have nothing but good things to say about this establishment.  First, the atmosphere is great.  I usually dine at the bar becuase that is where Tommy works, but even without that, this is the best place to be, in my opinion.  One night, I sat next to Pete Rose, who is a regular at the bar.  Tommy tells me all kinds of fun stories about the people he meets and the regulars that visit him at the bar.  As far as food, I highly recommend the tomato capri salad and the filet mignon.  I always get my steak prepared medium rare.  It usually comes out a bit on the rare side (which I like) so if you want medium rare by "normal" standards, you might want to order medium.  The calamari is also very good.  The only thing that I have ever tasted here that I wasn't a big fan of was the lobster bisque.  However, I have taken guests who really enjoyed it.  It might be a matter of personal taste.  If you go on the right night, there is an Elvis impersonator working as the bathroom attendant.  Gotta love Vegas!

d5nH_o7yf15JrA1hNUQLsA.text: I have been here a few times and always look forward to another visit.   It is better to come with a few people as you order vegetable plates that feed several people.  Steaks have always been done to perfection.  Service is good. Wait staff know to stay in the background when you are having conversation or business dinners.  Decor is interesting  with cartoons and caricatures of celebrities.

puDees_ljSxDIbofkDxrUg.text: NY Strip was solid, but not the best I've ever had.  Our server Barry really made the experience though.  Attentive, solid recs, and great conversation.  Can't ask for more from server.  Salud Barry.

M9VP09uzS7ipuQ8oG9BXqw.text: My last meal in Vegas was such a disappointment. I stopped by The Palm after lots of walking and was starving. I looked over the menu and ordered the business lunch special (3 course lunch for like $20). The soup of the day was a chowder that was fairly decent but the fresh fish of the day however was drained in sauce that was overpowered by lemon juice. I could only handle a few bites and moved on to my vegetable side which was way over cooked and soggy. I prayed the dessert would be better and it definitely was thank goodness.  The service was nice but was incredibly slow. We had a flight to catch and I had to ask for my ticket three times, boo.

rUPbgSwbGHXaR8UaIgZ_tg.text: We ate at the Palm for a work dinner with six others, and aside from leaving full, happy, and slightly buzzed from the wine, I left feeling conflicted.  The menu is standard for a steakhouse---they do meat, and they do seafood, and not much else.  The sides come extra, and are more than big enough for two people to share.  They don't mark up their wine as much as most places do---which is a good thing.  For Las Vegas, though, their wine selection leaves a bit to be desired.  What causes me such consternation about the Palm is the disparity between the food/prices and the attitude/service.   They have great food, fantastic food actually, and you pay relatively fair prices for it.  In fact, the steak I had there is one of the best I've ever had.  Unfortunately, it was matched with equally terrible service.  They are slow, they are rude, they are arrogant, they are pushy, and no matter how many times we asked for water, asked for more wine, asked for butter for the bread, or asked the server not to do something he didn't listen!  I wish we'd listened when, while waiting to be seated, a woman walked out of the back dining room and announced to the entire restaurant that they should leave while they still could to avoid a terrible experience.  For an 8-top, purchasing multiple bottles of wine, and nearly everything on the menu (total bill over $2,000) you'd think you could get better service.  Thankfully, I wasn't paying.  If I was, I'd never go back here again.

rb4qqAlEx2YQzbjMMd9rZA.text: The atmosphere and service were great.  I don't eat meat but usually love this type restaurant for salads and sides.  I had a salad, fried asparagus and a potato dish, none of which I particularly enjoyed.

LCI8_jLTURmNeM3MuzOWxA.text: I can't say enough about the Palm and the food and service that our group received there. Our entire table got the special which increased the value of the meal though it would have been acceptable at full price. However, at a place like Palm, Filet (Oscar style), Au Gratin Potatoes, and asparagus, along with the famous lobster bisque for $39.50 really can't be beat. The filet was perfectly done, and there was no cheese or butter spared in the making of the Au Gratin potatoes. Even at full price, I would highly recommend the entire aforementioned meal.  The service that we received was absolutely top notch; professional and extremely helpful, while remaining casual and friendly. As an entire experience, the Palm is a can't miss spot. Given the great food, friendly service, and central location in Caesar's, the Palm is a great choice for any steak loving group at anytime of the year.

OaMI3zGIYy9MMGXkjBaumg.text: Horrible experience! We walk in and the old man greeter ignores us for a good 10 minutes then tells us there won't be a table for 2 hours.... But there was plenty seating around!  HORRIBLE SERVICE

yzh93SqDjUJlQadzEeKGhg.text: excellent service & food however super duper pricey! be aware of that.

Km3gUykanK2nYdQw-TuiAg.text: Palm is located inside Caesars Palace Forum Shops. Reservation was at 7pm and was seated promptly. I odered the wedge salad w/blue chees to start which was just average and ordered the bone in filet but came back to tell me they were out of it so went with a 12 oz filet. medium rare. The filet was cooked perfectly and the flavor was great. The service was not very good by our sever though as she seemed bothered when we asked for stuff that she forgot to bring. i wont be back because of the service

JMv11UjaaM_80q0x3hZ7Hg.text: Dined at the Palm for a work luncheon. We had a private room which was nice. Then, our choice of soup or salad, entree (steak or salmon) and dessert. I had the caesar salad. It nice flavor and a ton of anchovies, six, I think. Usually, you'll get a filet or two. The sauteed salmon angelo which was a wine butter sauce with capers and artichokes. It was beautifully prepared and quite tasty. We also had shared plates of chips, fried onions and veggies. Dessert followed, key-lime pie or NY Cheesecake. I had the latter, it was rich and creamy. Service was attentive, we had two, that catered to the ten of us. Overall, it was a nice experience.

wpxp7ITLgT_1-BujKmeY1w.text: Amazing service, amazing food.  The lobster was awesome.  Came with a group, and they gave us our own back room, without even requesting it.  Only problem, unless you know where you are going, its a little hard to find.  Look for the Burberry cuz its right across from Palm, since everyone we asked thought we were looking for the Palm hotel.

VSV8KzfgcM_ufuLyJaRYzg.text: I had a wonderful time here with my boyfriend for a romantic, intimate dinner.  Here are the positives: delicious food, awesome server, delicious cocktails, and a fun environment.  The negatives:  my boyfriend's dinner came out warm, and more on the cool side.  He wasn't too happy about that.  Another negative was the waiter recommended the lobster.  Little did we know, we were ordering too much food, and the price of the lobster was a little crazy.  We weren't too happy about that, but considering we still had a good time, we tried not to leave with a sour taste in our mouth.

DXXpvl3xJkcZFYHKDTHviw.text: The only reason this place gets one star is bc we had a good waiter, Alan!  3 of us got terrible food poisoning from the wild mushrooms (which was the common denominator  & the rest offered no help after paying $100 for lunch.  SO disappointed bc this was one if my fav places:(

t0yjv6EMFRrogB4kHC-R3w.text: Great Food for a great price! If you know when to go. The lunch special is off the hook great! for less then $25/pp get a fantastic 3 course meal that will have you rolling out the joint.   The place has got that great old time vibe to it with the wood booths, and white coated servers.  The drinks are stiff and the beer cold and fresh. The choice of soup or salad is spot on and the entrees are delicious! And to top it off choose either the Key Lime pie or the huge cheese cake slice. You can't go wrong at lunch!  Go at lunch it's a great lunch, a great deal and a great special!  The Happy Hour menu by the way looks just as tempting!

PZTkbfzUqJNOYIu4YXBatw.text: If lobster got any better it'd be illegal.  The food is exceptional, the portions generous, the service impeccable, the drinks good. Actually, there's very negatives about the Palm, except perhaps the prices, but then if the prices were lower, the quality would overall quality would probably suffer.  My wife tried the filet and almost broke down in tears.  The food is really that good
